1:4.en_khattab: Master of the Day of Judgment.

1:5.en_khattab: and You ˹alone˺ we ask for help.

1:7.en_khattab: not those You are displeased with,

2:2.en_khattab: There is no doubt about it
a guide for those mindful ˹of Allah˺,

2:3.en_khattab: what We have provided for them,

2:4.en_khattab: in what has been revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺
and what was revealed before you,

2:5.en_khattab: It is they who are ˹truly˺ guided
and it is they who will be successful.

2:6.en_khattab: As for those who persist in disbelief,
it is the same whether you warn them
or you do not warn them—

2:7.en_khattab: They will suffer a tremendous punishment.

2:9.en_khattab: They seek to deceive Allah and the believers
but they fail to perceive it.

2:10.en_khattab: There is sickness in their hearts,
and Allah ˹only˺ lets their sickness increase.
They will suffer a painful punishment

2:11.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ لَا تُفۡسِدُواْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ
2:11.en_khattab: When they are told, “Do not spread corruption in the land,”

2:12.en_khattab: Indeed, it is they who are the corruptors,
but they fail to perceive it.

2:13.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ ءَامِنُواْ كَمَآ ءَامَنَ ٱلنَّاسُ
2:13.en_khattab: And when they are told, “Believe as others believe,”
they reply, “Will we believe as the fools believe?”
Indeed, it is they who are fools,

2:14.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا لَقُواْ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ قَالُوٓاْ ءَامَنَّا
2:14.en_khattab: When they meet the believers they say, “We believe.”

2:14.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا خَلَوۡاْ إِلَىٰ شَيَٰطِينِهِمۡ قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا مَعَكُمۡ إِنَّمَا نَحۡنُ مُسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
2:14.en_khattab: But when alone with their evil associates they say, “We are definitely with you; we were only mocking.”

2:15.en_khattab: Allah will throw their mockery back at them,
leaving them to continue wandering blindly in their defiance.

2:16.en_khattab: They are the ones who trade guidance for misguidance.

2:16.qpc_hafs: فَمَا رَبِحَت تِّجَٰرَتُهُمۡ وَمَا كَانُواْ مُهۡتَدِينَ
2:16.en_khattab: But this trade is profitless, and they are not ˹rightly˺ guided.

2:17.qpc_hafs: مَثَلُهُمۡ كَمَثَلِ ٱلَّذِي ٱسۡتَوۡقَدَ نَارٗا فَلَمَّآ أَضَآءَتۡ مَا حَوۡلَهُۥ
2:17.en_khattab: Their example is that of someone who kindles a fire, but when it lights up all around them,

2:17.qpc_hafs: ذَهَبَ ٱللَّهُ بِنُورِهِمۡ وَتَرَكَهُمۡ فِي ظُلُمَٰتٖ لَّا يُبۡصِرُونَ
2:17.en_khattab: Allah takes away their light, leaving them in complete darkness— unable to see.

2:18.en_khattab: They are ˹wilfully˺ deaf, dumb, and blind,
so they will never return ˹to the Right Path˺.

2:19.en_khattab: Or ˹those caught in˺ a rainstorm from the sky

2:19.qpc_hafs: يَجۡعَلُونَ أَصَٰبِعَهُمۡ فِيٓ ءَاذَانِهِم مِّنَ ٱلصَّوَٰعِقِ
2:19.en_khattab: They press their fingers into their ears at the sound of every thunder-clap
for fear of death. And Allah encompasses the disbelievers ˹by His might˺.

2:20.en_khattab: It is as if the lightning were about to snatch away their sight.
Whenever lightning strikes, they walk in its light,
but when darkness covers them, they stand still.

2:20.qpc_hafs: وَلَوۡ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَذَهَبَ بِسَمۡعِهِمۡ وَأَبۡصَٰرِهِمۡۚ
2:20.en_khattab: Had Allah willed, He could have taken away their hearing and sight.

2:20.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ
2:20.en_khattab: Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

2:21.qpc_hafs: ٱعۡبُدُواْ رَبَّكُمُ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكُمۡ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِكُمۡ
2:21.en_khattab: Worship your Lord, Who created you and those before you,
so that you may become mindful ˹of Him˺.

2:22.en_khattab: ˹He is the One˺ Who has made the earth a place of settlement for you

2:22.qpc_hafs: وَأَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءٗ فَأَخۡرَجَ بِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ رِزۡقٗا لَّكُمۡۖ
2:22.en_khattab: and sends down rain from the sky, causing fruits to grow as a provision for you.

2:22.qpc_hafs: فَلَا تَجۡعَلُواْ لِلَّهِ أَندَادٗا وَأَنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ
2:22.en_khattab: So do not knowingly set up equals to Allah ˹in worship˺.

2:23.qpc_hafs: وَإِن كُنتُمۡ فِي رَيۡبٖ مِّمَّا نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَىٰ عَبۡدِنَا
2:23.en_khattab: And if you are in doubt about what We have revealed to Our servant,
then produce a sûrah like it

2:23.qpc_hafs: وَٱدۡعُواْ شُهَدَآءَكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ
2:23.en_khattab: and call your helpers other than Allah, if what you say is true.

2:24.en_khattab: But if you are unable to do so— and you will never be able to do so

2:24.qpc_hafs: فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱلنَّارَ ٱلَّتِي وَقُودُهَا ٱلنَّاسُ وَٱلۡحِجَارَةُۖ
2:24.en_khattab: then fear the Fire fuelled with people and stones
which is prepared for the disbelievers

2:25.en_khattab: Give good news ˹O Prophet˺ to those who believe and do good

2:25.qpc_hafs: أَنَّ لَهُمۡ جَنَّٰتٖ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُۖ
2:25.en_khattab: that they will have Gardens under which rivers flow

2:25.qpc_hafs: كُلَّمَا رُزِقُواْ مِنۡهَا مِن ثَمَرَةٖ رِّزۡقٗا قَالُواْ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي رُزِقۡنَا مِن قَبۡلُۖ وَأُتُواْ بِهِۦ مُتَشَٰبِهٗاۖ
2:25.en_khattab: Whenever provided with fruit, they will say, “This is what we were given before,” for they will be served fruit that looks similar ˹but tastes different˺

2:25.qpc_hafs: وَلَهُمۡ فِيهَآ أَزۡوَٰجٞ مُّطَهَّرَةٞۖ وَهُمۡ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
2:25.en_khattab: They will have pure spouses, and they will be there forever

2:26.en_khattab: Surely Allah does not shy away

2:26.qpc_hafs: أَن يَضۡرِبَ مَثَلٗا مَّا بَعُوضَةٗ فَمَا فَوۡقَهَاۚ
2:26.en_khattab: from using the parable of a mosquito or what is even smaller

2:26.qpc_hafs: فَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ فَيَعۡلَمُونَ أَنَّهُ ٱلۡحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّهِمۡۖ
2:26.en_khattab: As for the believers, they know that it is the truth from their Lord

2:26.qpc_hafs: وَأَمَّا ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ فَيَقُولُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلٗاۘ
2:26.en_khattab: And as for the disbelievers, they argue, “What does Allah mean by such a parable?”

2:26.qpc_hafs: يُضِلُّ بِهِۦ كَثِيرٗا وَيَهۡدِي بِهِۦ كَثِيرٗاۚ
2:26.en_khattab: Through this ˹test˺, He leaves many to stray, and guides many
And He leaves none to stray except the rebellious—

2:27.qpc_hafs: مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مِيثَٰقِهِۦ وَيَقۡطَعُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ
2:27.en_khattab: after it has been affirmed, break whatever ˹ties˺ Allah has ordered to be maintained
and spread corruption in the land
It is they who are the ˹true˺ losers

2:28.en_khattab: then He will cause you to die
and again bring you to life
and then to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.

2:29.qpc_hafs: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ لَكُم مَّا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا
2:29.en_khattab: He is the One Who created everything in the earth for you.
Then He turned towards the heaven,
And He has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things.

2:30.en_khattab: ˹Remember˺ when your Lord said to the angels,
I am going to place a successive ˹human˺ authority on earth.

2:30.qpc_hafs: قَالُوٓاْ أَتَجۡعَلُ فِيهَا مَن يُفۡسِدُ فِيهَا وَيَسۡفِكُ ٱلدِّمَآءَ
2:30.en_khattab: They asked ˹Allah˺, “Will You place in it someone who will spread corruption there and shed blood
while we glorify Your praises and proclaim Your holiness?”

2:30.qpc_hafs: قَالَ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَمُ مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
2:30.en_khattab: Allah responded, “I know what you do not know.”

2:31.en_khattab: He taught Adam the names of all things
then He presented them to the angels
and said, “Tell Me the names of these
if what you say is true?”

2:32.qpc_hafs: لَا عِلۡمَ لَنَآ إِلَّا مَا عَلَّمۡتَنَآۖ
2:32.en_khattab: We have no knowledge except what You have taught us.
You are truly the All-Knowing, All-Wise.

2:33.en_khattab: Allah said, “O Adam! Inform them of their names.”

2:33.qpc_hafs: قَالَ أَلَمۡ أَقُل لَّكُمۡ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَمُ غَيۡبَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَأَعۡلَمُ مَا تُبۡدُونَ وَمَا كُنتُمۡ تَكۡتُمُونَ
2:33.en_khattab: Allah said, “Did I not tell you that I know the secrets of the heavens and the earth, and I know what you reveal and what you conceal?”

2:34.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,”
so they all did— but not Iblîs, who refused

2:35.qpc_hafs: وَقُلۡنَا يَٰٓـَٔادَمُ ٱسۡكُنۡ أَنتَ وَزَوۡجُكَ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ
2:35.en_khattab: We cautioned, “O Adam! Live with your wife in Paradise
and eat as freely as you please,

2:35.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَقۡرَبَا هَٰذِهِ ٱلشَّجَرَةَ فَتَكُونَا مِنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
2:35.en_khattab: but do not approach this tree, or else you will be wrongdoers.

2:36.en_khattab: But Satan deceived them— leading to their fall from the ˹blissful˺ state they were in,
and We said, “Descend from the heavens ˹to the earth˺

2:36.qpc_hafs: وَلَكُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُسۡتَقَرّٞ وَمَتَٰعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٖ
2:36.en_khattab: You will find in the earth a residence and provision for your appointed stay.

2:37.en_khattab: Then Adam was inspired with words ˹of prayer˺ by his Lord,

2:37.qpc_hafs: فَتَابَ عَلَيۡهِۚ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
2:37.en_khattab: so He accepted his repentance. Surely He is the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful.

2:38.en_khattab: Then when guidance comes to you from Me,

2:38.qpc_hafs: فَمَن تَبِعَ هُدَايَ فَلَا خَوۡفٌ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وَلَا هُمۡ يَحۡزَنُونَ
2:38.en_khattab: whoever follows it, there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.

2:39.en_khattab: But those who disbelieve and deny Our signs
will be the residents of the Fire

2:40.en_khattab: Fulfil your covenant and I will fulfil Mine,
and stand in awe of Me ˹alone˺.

2:41.qpc_hafs: وَءَامِنُواْ بِمَآ أَنزَلۡتُ مُصَدِّقٗا لِّمَا مَعَكُمۡ
2:41.en_khattab: Believe in My revelations which confirm your Scriptures.
Do not be the first to deny them
or trade them for a fleeting gain.

2:42.en_khattab: Do not mix truth with falsehood

2:43.en_khattab: and bow down with those who bow down.

2:44.en_khattab: and fail to practice it yourselves

2:45.en_khattab: And seek help through patience and prayer.

2:46.en_khattab: those who are certain that they will meet their Lord
and to Him they will return.

2:47.en_khattab: O Children of Israel! Remember ˹all˺ the favours I granted you

2:48.qpc_hafs: وَٱتَّقُواْ يَوۡمٗا لَّا تَجۡزِي نَفۡسٌ عَن نَّفۡسٖ شَيۡـٔٗا
2:48.en_khattab: Guard yourselves against the Day on which no soul will be of help to another.
and no help will be given.

2:49.en_khattab: ˹Remember˺ how We delivered you from the people of Pharaoh

2:49.qpc_hafs: يَسُومُونَكُمۡ سُوٓءَ ٱلۡعَذَابِ يُذَبِّحُونَ أَبۡنَآءَكُمۡ وَيَسۡتَحۡيُونَ نِسَآءَكُمۡۚ
2:49.en_khattab: who afflicted you with dreadful torment, slaughtering your sons and keeping your women

2:49.qpc_hafs: وَفِي ذَٰلِكُم بَلَآءٞ مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡ عَظِيمٞ
2:49.en_khattab: That was a severe test from your Lord

2:50.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We parted the sea

2:51.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We appointed forty nights for Moses
then you worshipped the calf in his absence

2:52.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ عَفَوۡنَا عَنكُم مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ ذَٰلِكَ

2:52.en_khattab: so perhaps you would be grateful

2:53.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We gave Moses the Scripture
to distinguish between right and wrong that perhaps you would be ˹rightly˺ guided

2:54.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his people,
“O my people! Surely you have wronged yourselves
so turn in repentance to your Creator
That is best for you in the sight of your Creator.”
Surely He is the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful.

2:55.qpc_hafs: لَن نُّؤۡمِنَ لَكَ حَتَّىٰ نَرَى ٱللَّهَ جَهۡرَةٗ
2:55.en_khattab: We will never believe you until we see Allah with our own eyes,

2:56.en_khattab: Then We brought you back to life after your death,
so that perhaps you would be grateful.

2:57.en_khattab: And ˹remember when˺ We shaded you with clouds
and sent down to you manna and quails,
˹saying˺, “Eat from the good things We have provided for you.”

2:57.qpc_hafs: وَمَا ظَلَمُونَا وَلَٰكِن كَانُوٓاْ أَنفُسَهُمۡ يَظۡلِمُونَ
2:57.en_khattab: The evildoers ˹certainly˺ did not wrong Us, but wronged themselves.

2:58.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We said, “Enter this city
and eat freely from wherever you please;
saying, ‘Absolve us.’ We will forgive your sins
and multiply the reward for the good-doers.

2:59.qpc_hafs: فَبَدَّلَ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ قَوۡلًا غَيۡرَ ٱلَّذِي قِيلَ لَهُمۡ
2:59.en_khattab: But the wrongdoers changed the words they were commanded to say.

2:59.qpc_hafs: فَأَنزَلۡنَا عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ رِجۡزٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَا كَانُواْ يَفۡسُقُونَ
2:59.en_khattab: So We sent down a punishment from the heavens upon them for their rebelliousness.

2:60.qpc_hafs: وَإِذِ ٱسۡتَسۡقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوۡمِهِۦ فَقُلۡنَا ٱضۡرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلۡحَجَرَۖ
2:60.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when Moses prayed for water for his people, We said, “Strike the rock with your staff.”
˹and˺ each tribe knew its drinking place.

2:60.qpc_hafs: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ مِن رِّزۡقِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا تَعۡثَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُفۡسِدِينَ
2:60.en_khattab: ˹We then said,˺ “Eat and drink of Allah’s provisions, and do not go about spreading corruption in the land.”

2:61.qpc_hafs: وَإِذۡ قُلۡتُمۡ يَٰمُوسَىٰ لَن نَّصۡبِرَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامٖ وَٰحِدٖ
2:61.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when you said, “O Moses! We cannot endure the same meal ˹every day˺.

2:61.qpc_hafs: فَٱدۡعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُخۡرِجۡ لَنَا مِمَّا تُنۢبِتُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ مِنۢ بَقۡلِهَا وَقِثَّآئِهَا وَفُومِهَا وَعَدَسِهَا وَبَصَلِهَاۖ
2:61.en_khattab: So ˹just˺ call upon your Lord on our behalf, He will bring forth for us some of what the earth produces of herbs, cucumbers, garlic, lentils, and onions.

2:61.qpc_hafs: قَالَ أَتَسۡتَبۡدِلُونَ ٱلَّذِي هُوَ أَدۡنَىٰ بِٱلَّذِي هُوَ خَيۡرٌۚ
2:61.en_khattab: Moses scolded ˹them˺, “Do you exchange what is better for what is worse?

2:61.qpc_hafs: ٱهۡبِطُواْ مِصۡرٗا فَإِنَّ لَكُم مَّا سَأَلۡتُمۡۗ
2:61.en_khattab: ˹You can˺ go down to any village and you will find what you have asked for.

2:61.qpc_hafs: وَضُرِبَتۡ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلذِّلَّةُ وَٱلۡمَسۡكَنَةُ وَبَآءُو بِغَضَبٖ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِۚ
2:61.en_khattab: They were stricken with disgrace and misery, and they invited the displeasure of Allah

2:61.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ يَكۡفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَقۡتُلُونَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ بِغَيۡرِ ٱلۡحَقِّۚ
2:61.en_khattab: for rejecting Allah’s signs and unjustly killing the prophets.
This is ˹a fair reward˺ for their disobedience and violations.

2:62.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَٱلَّذِينَ هَادُواْ وَٱلنَّصَٰرَىٰ وَٱلصَّٰبِـِٔينَ
2:62.en_khattab: Indeed, the believers, Jews, Christians, and Sabians

2:62.qpc_hafs: مَنۡ ءَامَنَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡأٓخِرِ وَعَمِلَ صَٰلِحٗا
2:62.en_khattab: whoever ˹truly˺ believes in Allah and the Last Day and does good

2:62.qpc_hafs: فَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرُهُمۡ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ وَلَا خَوۡفٌ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وَلَا هُمۡ يَحۡزَنُونَ
2:62.en_khattab: will have their reward with their Lord. And there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.

2:63.qpc_hafs: وَإِذۡ أَخَذۡنَا مِيثَٰقَكُمۡ وَرَفَعۡنَا فَوۡقَكُمُ ٱلطُّورَ
2:63.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We took a covenant from you and raised the mountain above you

2:63.qpc_hafs: خُذُواْ مَآ ءَاتَيۡنَٰكُم بِقُوَّةٖ وَٱذۡكُرُواْ مَا فِيهِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَتَّقُونَ
2:63.en_khattab: ˹saying˺, “Hold firmly to that ˹Scripture˺ which We have given you and observe its teachings so perhaps you will become mindful ˹of Allah˺.”

2:64.en_khattab: Had it not been for Allah’s grace and mercy upon you.
you would have certainly been of the losers.

2:65.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡتُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱعۡتَدَوۡاْ مِنكُمۡ فِي ٱلسَّبۡتِ
2:65.en_khattab: You are already aware of those of you who broke the Sabbath.
We said to them, “Be disgraced apes!”

2:66.qpc_hafs: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهَا نَكَٰلٗا لِّمَا بَيۡنَ يَدَيۡهَا وَمَا خَلۡفَهَا
2:66.en_khattab: So We made their fate an example to present and future generations.
and a lesson to the God-fearing.

2:67.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his people,

2:67.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَأۡمُرُكُمۡ أَن تَذۡبَحُواْ بَقَرَةٗۖ
2:67.en_khattab: “Allah commands you to sacrifice a cow.”

2:67.qpc_hafs: قَالَ أَعُوذُ بِٱللَّهِ أَنۡ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡجَٰهِلِينَ
2:67.en_khattab: Moses responded, “I seek refuge in Allah from acting foolishly!”

2:68.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ ٱدۡعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا هِيَۚ
2:68.en_khattab: They said, “Call upon your Lord to clarify for us what type ˹of cow˺ it should be!”

2:68.qpc_hafs: قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٞ لَّا فَارِضٞ وَلَا بِكۡرٌ عَوَانُۢ بَيۡنَ ذَٰلِكَۖ
2:68.en_khattab: He replied, “Allah says, ‘The cow should neither be old nor young but in between.
So do as you are commanded!’”

2:69.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ ٱدۡعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا لَوۡنُهَاۚ
2:69.en_khattab: They said, “Call upon your Lord to specify for us its colour.

2:69.qpc_hafs: قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٞ صَفۡرَآءُ فَاقِعٞ
2:69.en_khattab: He replied, “Allah says, ‘It should be a bright yellow cow— pleasant to see.’”

2:70.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ ٱدۡعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ يُبَيِّن لَّنَا مَا هِيَ
2:70.en_khattab: Again they said, “Call upon your Lord so that He may make clear to us which cow,
for all cows look the same to us.
Then, Allah willing, we will be guided to the right one.

2:71.qpc_hafs: قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ يَقُولُ إِنَّهَا بَقَرَةٞ لَّا ذَلُولٞ
2:71.en_khattab: He replied, “Allah says, ‘It should have been used neither to till the soil nor water the fields;

2:71.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ ٱلۡـَٰٔنَ جِئۡتَ بِٱلۡحَقِّۚ فَذَبَحُوهَا وَمَا كَادُواْ يَفۡعَلُونَ
2:71.en_khattab: They said, “Now you have come with the truth.” Yet they still slaughtered it hesitantly!

2:72.en_khattab: This is when a man was killed and you disputed who the killer was,
but Allah revealed what you concealed.

2:73.en_khattab: So We instructed, “Strike the dead body with a piece of the cow.”

2:73.qpc_hafs: كَذَٰلِكَ يُحۡيِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ وَيُرِيكُمۡ ءَايَٰتِهِۦ
2:73.en_khattab: This is how ˹easily˺ Allah brings the dead to life, showing you His signs

2:74.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ قَسَتۡ قُلُوبُكُم مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ ذَٰلِكَ
2:74.en_khattab: Even then your hearts became hardened
like a rock or even harder

2:74.qpc_hafs: وَإِنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡحِجَارَةِ لَمَا يَتَفَجَّرُ مِنۡهُ ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُۚ
وَإِنَّ مِنۡهَا لَمَا يَشَّقَّقُ فَيَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهُ ٱلۡمَآءُۚ
وَإِنَّ مِنۡهَا لَمَا يَهۡبِطُ مِنۡ خَشۡيَةِ ٱللَّهِۗ
2:74.en_khattab: while others are humbled in awe of Allah
And Allah is never unaware of what you do

2:75.en_khattab: Do you ˹believers still˺ expect them to be true to you,

2:75.qpc_hafs: وَقَدۡ كَانَ فَرِيقٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ يَسۡمَعُونَ كَلَٰمَ ٱللَّهِ
2:75.en_khattab: though a group of them would hear the word of Allah

2:75.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ يُحَرِّفُونَهُۥ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا عَقَلُوهُ وَهُمۡ يَعۡلَمُونَ
2:75.en_khattab: then knowingly corrupt it after understanding it?

2:76.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا لَقُواْ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ قَالُوٓاْ ءَامَنَّا
2:76.en_khattab: When they meet the believers they say, “We believe.”

2:76.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا خَلَا بَعۡضُهُمۡ إِلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ قَالُوٓاْ أَتُحَدِّثُونَهُم بِمَا فَتَحَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ
2:76.en_khattab: But in private they say ˹to each other˺, “Will you disclose to the believers the knowledge Allah has revealed to you,

2:76.qpc_hafs: لِيُحَآجُّوكُم بِهِۦ عِندَ رَبِّكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تَعۡقِلُونَ
2:76.en_khattab: so that they may use it against you before your Lord? Do you not understand?

2:77.qpc_hafs: أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعۡلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعۡلِنُونَ
2:77.en_khattab: that Allah is aware of what they conceal and what they reveal?

2:78.en_khattab: And among them are the illiterate
who know nothing about the Scripture except lies,

2:79.en_khattab: So woe to those who distort the Scripture with their own hands

2:79.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ يَقُولُونَ هَٰذَا مِنۡ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ لِيَشۡتَرُواْ بِهِۦ ثَمَنٗا قَلِيلٗاۖ
2:79.en_khattab: then say, “This is from Allah”—seeking a fleeting gain!
So woe to them for what their hands have written,
and woe to them for what they have earned.

2:80.qpc_hafs: وَقَالُواْ لَن تَمَسَّنَا ٱلنَّارُ إِلَّآ أَيَّامٗا مَّعۡدُودَةٗۚ
2:80.en_khattab: ˹Some of˺ the Jews claim, “The Fire will not touch us except for a number of days.”

2:80.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ أَتَّخَذۡتُمۡ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ عَهۡدٗا فَلَن يُخۡلِفَ ٱللَّهُ عَهۡدَهُۥٓۖ
2:80.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Have you taken a pledge from Allah— for Allah never breaks His word—

2:80.qpc_hafs: أَمۡ تَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
2:80.en_khattab: or are you ˹just˺ saying about Allah what you do not know?

2:81.en_khattab: will be the residents of the Fire.

2:82.en_khattab: And those who believe and do good
will be the residents of Paradise

2:83.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We took a covenant from the children of Israel

2:83.qpc_hafs: لَا تَعۡبُدُونَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهَ وَبِٱلۡوَٰلِدَيۡنِ إِحۡسَانٗا وَذِي ٱلۡقُرۡبَىٰ وَٱلۡيَتَٰمَىٰ وَٱلۡمَسَٰكِينِ
2:83.en_khattab: ˹stating˺, “Worship none but Allah; be kind to parents, relatives, orphans and the needy

2:83.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ تَوَلَّيۡتُمۡ إِلَّا قَلِيلٗا مِّنكُمۡ وَأَنتُم مُّعۡرِضُونَ
2:83.en_khattab: But you ˹Israelites˺ turned away— except for a few of you— and were indifferent

2:84.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We took your covenant

2:84.qpc_hafs: لَا تَسۡفِكُونَ دِمَآءَكُمۡ وَلَا تُخۡرِجُونَ أَنفُسَكُم مِّن دِيَٰرِكُمۡ
2:84.en_khattab: that you would neither shed each other’s blood nor expel each other from their homes
you gave your pledge and bore witness

2:85.en_khattab: But here you are, killing each other
and expelling some of your people from their homes
aiding one another in sin and aggression
and when those ˹expelled˺ come to you as captives
you still ransom them— though expelling them was unlawful for you
Do you believe in some of the Scripture and reject the rest?

2:85.qpc_hafs: فَمَا جَزَآءُ مَن يَفۡعَلُ ذَٰلِكَ مِنكُمۡ إِلَّا خِزۡيٞ فِي ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَاۖ
2:85.en_khattab: Is there any reward for those who do so among you other than disgrace in this worldly life

2:85.qpc_hafs: وَيَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ يُرَدُّونَ إِلَىٰٓ أَشَدِّ ٱلۡعَذَابِۗ
2:85.en_khattab: and being subjected to the harshest punishment on the Day of Judgment
For Allah is never unaware of what you do

2:86.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱشۡتَرَوُاْ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِۖ
2:86.en_khattab: These are the ones who trade the Hereafter for the life of this world

2:86.qpc_hafs: فَلَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنۡهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُ وَلَا هُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ
2:86.en_khattab: So their punishment will not be reduced, nor will they be helped

2:87.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدۡ ءَاتَيۡنَا مُوسَى ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَقَفَّيۡنَا مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِۦ بِٱلرُّسُلِۖ
2:87.en_khattab: Indeed, We gave Moses the Book and sent after him successive messengers

2:87.qpc_hafs: وَءَاتَيۡنَا عِيسَى ٱبۡنَ مَرۡيَمَ ٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتِ وَأَيَّدۡنَٰهُ بِرُوحِ ٱلۡقُدُسِۗ
2:87.en_khattab: And We gave Jesus, son of Mary, clear proofs and supported him with the holy spirit

2:87.qpc_hafs: أَفَكُلَّمَا جَآءَكُمۡ رَسُولُۢ بِمَا لَا تَهۡوَىٰٓ أَنفُسُكُمُ ٱسۡتَكۡبَرۡتُمۡ
2:87.en_khattab: Why is it that every time a messenger comes to you ˹Israelites˺ with something you do not like, you become arrogant

2:88.qpc_hafs: بَل لَّعَنَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِكُفۡرِهِمۡ فَقَلِيلٗا مَّا يُؤۡمِنُونَ
2:88.en_khattab: In fact, Allah has condemned them for their disbelief. They have but little faith

2:89.qpc_hafs: وَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمۡ كِتَٰبٞ مِّنۡ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ
2:89.en_khattab: When there came to them a Book from Allah
confirming the Scripture they had ˹in their hands˺

2:89.qpc_hafs: وَكَانُواْ مِن قَبۡلُ يَسۡتَفۡتِحُونَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ
2:89.en_khattab: Although they used to pray for victory ˹by means of the Prophet˺ over the polytheists,

2:89.qpc_hafs: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُم مَّا عَرَفُواْ كَفَرُواْ بِهِۦۚ

2:89.en_khattab: So may Allah’s condemnation be upon the disbelievers

2:90.en_khattab: Miserable is the price they have sold their souls for—

2:90.qpc_hafs: بَغۡيًا أَن يُنَزِّلَ ٱللَّهُ مِن فَضۡلِهِۦ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنۡ عِبَادِهِۦۖ
2:90.en_khattab: resenting Allah for granting His grace to whoever He wills of His servants!
They have earned wrath upon wrath.
And such disbelievers will suffer a humiliating punishment.

2:91.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ ءَامِنُواْ بِمَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ
2:91.en_khattab: When it is said to them: “Believe in what Allah has revealed
they reply, “We only believe in what was sent down to us
and they deny what came afterwards
though it is the truth confirming their own Scriptures

2:91.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ فَلِمَ تَقۡتُلُونَ أَنۢبِيَآءَ ٱللَّهِ مِن قَبۡلُ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
2:91.en_khattab: Ask ˹them, O  Prophet˺, “Why then did you kill Allah’s prophets before, if you are ˹truly˺ believers?

2:92.en_khattab: Indeed, Moses came to you with clear proofs
then you worshipped the calf in his absence

2:93.en_khattab: And when We took your covenant
and raised the mountain above you
˹saying˺, “Hold firmly to that ˹Scripture˺ which We have given you and obey,”
The love of the calf was rooted in their hearts because of their disbelief.

2:93.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ بِئۡسَمَا يَأۡمُرُكُم بِهِۦٓ إِيمَٰنُكُمۡ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
2:93.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “How evil is what your ˹so-called˺ belief prompts you to do, if you ˹actually˺ believe ˹in the Torah˺!”

2:94.qpc_hafs: إِن كَانَتۡ لَكُمُ ٱلدَّارُ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ خَالِصَةٗ مِّن دُونِ ٱلنَّاسِ
2:94.en_khattab: ˹O Prophet,˺ “If the ˹eternal˺ Home of the Hereafter with Allah is exclusively for you ˹Israelites˺ out of all humanity,
then wish for death if what you say is true!”

2:95.qpc_hafs: وَلَن يَتَمَنَّوۡهُ أَبَدَۢا بِمَا قَدَّمَتۡ أَيۡدِيهِمۡۚ
2:95.en_khattab: But they will never wish for that because of what their hands have done.
And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of the wrongdoers.

2:96.en_khattab: You will surely find them clinging to life more eagerly than any other people,

2:96.qpc_hafs: يَوَدُّ أَحَدُهُمۡ لَوۡ يُعَمَّرُ أَلۡفَ سَنَةٖ
2:96.en_khattab: Each one of them wishes to live a thousand years.

2:96.qpc_hafs: وَمَا هُوَ بِمُزَحۡزِحِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلۡعَذَابِ أَن يُعَمَّرَۗ
2:96.en_khattab: But even if they were to live that long, it would not save them from the punishment.
And Allah is All-Seeing of what they do.

2:97.en_khattab: should know that he revealed this ˹Quran˺ to your heart
a guide and good news for the believers.”

2:98.qpc_hafs: مَن كَانَ عَدُوّٗا لِّلَّهِ وَمَلَٰٓئِكَتِهِۦ وَرُسُلِهِۦ وَجِبۡرِيلَ وَمِيكَىٰلَ
2:98.en_khattab: Whoever is an enemy of Allah, His angels, His messengers, Gabriel, and Michael,
then ˹let them know that˺ Allah is certainly the enemy of the disbelievers.

2:99.en_khattab: Indeed, We have sent down to you ˹O Prophet˺ clear revelations.
˹But˺ none will deny them except the rebellious.

2:100.qpc_hafs: أَوَكُلَّمَا عَٰهَدُواْ عَهۡدٗا نَّبَذَهُۥ فَرِيقٞ مِّنۡهُمۚ
2:100.en_khattab: Why is it that every time they make a covenant, a group of them casts it aside?
In fact, most of them do not believe.

2:101.qpc_hafs: وَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمۡ رَسُولٞ مِّنۡ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ مُصَدِّقٞ لِّمَا مَعَهُمۡ
2:101.en_khattab: Now, when a messenger from Allah has come to them— confirming their own Scriptures

2:101.qpc_hafs: نَبَذَ فَرِيقٞ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ كِتَٰبَ ٱللَّهِ وَرَآءَ ظُهُورِهِمۡ
2:101.en_khattab: some of the People of the Book cast the Book of Allah behind their backs
as if they did not know.

2:102.qpc_hafs: وَٱتَّبَعُواْ مَا تَتۡلُواْ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ عَلَىٰ مُلۡكِ سُلَيۡمَٰنَۖ
2:102.en_khattab: They ˹instead˺ followed the magic promoted by the devils during the reign of Solomon.

2:102.qpc_hafs: وَمَا كَفَرَ سُلَيۡمَٰنُ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينَ كَفَرُواْ
2:102.en_khattab: Never did Solomon disbelieve, rather the devils disbelieved.

2:102.qpc_hafs: يُعَلِّمُونَ ٱلنَّاسَ ٱلسِّحۡرَ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَى ٱلۡمَلَكَيۡنِ بِبَابِلَ هَٰرُوتَ وَمَٰرُوتَۚ
2:102.en_khattab: They taught magic to the people, along with what had been revealed to the two angels, Hârût and Mârût, in Babylon.

2:102.qpc_hafs: وَمَا يُعَلِّمَانِ مِنۡ أَحَدٍ حَتَّىٰ يَقُولَآ إِنَّمَا نَحۡنُ فِتۡنَةٞ فَلَا تَكۡفُرۡۖ
2:102.en_khattab: The two angels never taught anyone without saying, “We are only a test ˹for you˺, so do not abandon ˹your˺ faith.”

2:102.qpc_hafs: فَيَتَعَلَّمُونَ مِنۡهُمَا مَا يُفَرِّقُونَ بِهِۦ بَيۡنَ ٱلۡمَرۡءِ وَزَوۡجِهِۦۚ وَمَا هُم بِضَآرِّينَ بِهِۦ مِنۡ أَحَدٍ إِلَّا بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِۚ
2:102.en_khattab: Yet people learned ˹magic˺ that caused a rift ˹even˺ between husband and wife; although their magic could not harm anyone except by Allah’s Will.
They learned what harmed them and did not benefit them

2:102.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمُواْ لَمَنِ ٱشۡتَرَىٰهُ مَا لَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ مِنۡ خَلَٰقٖۚ
2:102.en_khattab: although they already knew that whoever buys into magic would have no share in the Hereafter.

2:102.qpc_hafs: وَلَبِئۡسَ مَا شَرَوۡاْ بِهِۦٓ أَنفُسَهُمۡۚ لَوۡ كَانُواْ يَعۡلَمُونَ
2:102.en_khattab: Miserable indeed was the price for which they sold their souls, if only they knew!

2:103.en_khattab: If only they were faithful and mindful ˹of Allah˺
there would have been a better reward from Allah

2:104.en_khattab: Do not say, “Râ’ina.” [Herd us!] But say, “Unẓurna,”
˹attentively˺. And the disbelievers will suffer a painful punishment.

2:105.en_khattab: from the People of the Book and the polytheists

2:105.qpc_hafs: أَن يُنَزَّلَ عَلَيۡكُم مِّنۡ خَيۡرٖ مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡۚ
2:105.en_khattab: would not want you to receive any blessing from your Lord,
but Allah selects whoever He wills for His mercy.
And Allah is the Lord of infinite bounty.

2:106.qpc_hafs: مَا نَنسَخۡ مِنۡ ءَايَةٍ أَوۡ نُنسِهَا
2:106.en_khattab: If We ever abrogate a verse or cause it to be forgotten,
We replace it with a better or similar one.

2:106.qpc_hafs: أَلَمۡ تَعۡلَمۡ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٌ
2:106.en_khattab: Do you not know that Allah is Most Capable of everything?

2:107.qpc_hafs: أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۗ
2:107.en_khattab: that the kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs ˹only˺ to Allah,

2:107.qpc_hafs: وَمَا لَكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِيّٖ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ
2:107.en_khattab: and you have no guardian or helper besides Allah?

2:108.en_khattab: But whoever trades belief for disbelief
has truly strayed from the Right Way.

2:109.en_khattab: Many among the People of the Book wish

2:109.qpc_hafs: لَوۡ يَرُدُّونَكُم مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ إِيمَٰنِكُمۡ كُفَّارًا حَسَدٗا
2:109.en_khattab: they could turn you ˹believers˺ back to disbelief because of their envy,

2:109.qpc_hafs: مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلۡحَقُّۖ
2:109.en_khattab: the truth has been made clear to them.

2:109.qpc_hafs: فَٱعۡفُواْ وَٱصۡفَحُواْ حَتَّىٰ يَأۡتِيَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَمۡرِهِۦٓۗ
2:109.en_khattab: Pardon and bear with them until Allah delivers His decision.

2:109.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ
2:109.en_khattab: Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

2:110.en_khattab: Whatever good you send forth for yourselves,
you will ˹certainly˺ find ˹its reward˺ with Allah.
Surely Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

2:111.qpc_hafs: وَقَالُواْ لَن يَدۡخُلَ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ إِلَّا مَن كَانَ هُودًا أَوۡ نَصَٰرَىٰۗ
2:111.en_khattab: The Jews and Christians each claim that none will enter Paradise except those of their own faith.
if what you say is true.

2:112.qpc_hafs: مَنۡ أَسۡلَمَ وَجۡهَهُۥ لِلَّهِ وَهُوَ مُحۡسِنٞ
2:112.en_khattab: Whoever submits themselves to Allah and does good
will have their reward with their Lord.

2:112.qpc_hafs: وَلَا خَوۡفٌ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وَلَا هُمۡ يَحۡزَنُونَ
2:112.en_khattab: And there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.

2:113.qpc_hafs: وَقَالَتِ ٱلۡيَهُودُ لَيۡسَتِ ٱلنَّصَٰرَىٰ عَلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ
2:113.en_khattab: The Jews say, “The Christians have nothing to stand on”

2:113.qpc_hafs: وَقَالَتِ ٱلنَّصَٰرَىٰ لَيۡسَتِ ٱلۡيَهُودُ عَلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ
2:113.en_khattab: and the Christians say, “The Jews have nothing to stand on,”

2:113.qpc_hafs: كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ مِثۡلَ قَوۡلِهِمۡۚ
2:113.en_khattab: And those ˹pagans˺ who have no knowledge say the same ˹about people of faith˺.
Surely Allah will judge between them on the Day of Judgment

2:114.qpc_hafs: وَمَنۡ أَظۡلَمُ مِمَّن مَّنَعَ مَسَٰجِدَ ٱللَّهِ أَن يُذۡكَرَ فِيهَا ٱسۡمُهُۥ
2:114.en_khattab: Who does more wrong than those who prevent Allah’s Name from being mentioned in His places of worship

2:114.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ مَا كَانَ لَهُمۡ أَن يَدۡخُلُوهَآ إِلَّا خَآئِفِينَۚ
2:114.en_khattab: Such people have no right to enter these places except with fear.
For them is disgrace in this world,
and they will suffer a tremendous punishment in the Hereafter.

2:115.en_khattab: To Allah belong the east and the west,
so wherever you turn you are facing ˹towards˺ Allah.

2:116.qpc_hafs: بَل لَّهُۥ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ كُلّٞ لَّهُۥ قَٰنِتُونَ
2:116.en_khattab: In fact, to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth— all are subject to His Will.

2:117.en_khattab: ˹He is˺ the Originator of the heavens and the earth!

2:117.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا قَضَىٰٓ أَمۡرٗا فَإِنَّمَا يَقُولُ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ
2:117.en_khattab: When He decrees a matter, He simply tells it, “Be!” And it is!

2:118.en_khattab: Those who have no knowledge say,

2:118.qpc_hafs: لَوۡلَا يُكَلِّمُنَا ٱللَّهُ أَوۡ تَأۡتِينَآ ءَايَةٞۗ
2:118.en_khattab: “If only Allah would speak to us or a sign would come to us!”

2:118.qpc_hafs: كَذَٰلِكَ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّثۡلَ قَوۡلِهِمۡۘ
2:118.en_khattab: The same was said by those who came before.
Indeed, We have made the signs clear for people of sure faith.

2:119.en_khattab: We have surely sent you with the truth
˹O Prophet˺ as a deliverer of good news and a warner.
And you will not be accountable for

2:120.en_khattab: Never will the Jews or Christians be pleased with you,
Say, “Allah’s guidance is the only ˹true˺ guidance.”
And if you were to follow their

2:120.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ إِنَّ هُدَى ٱللَّهِ هُوَ ٱلۡهُدَىٰۗ
2:120.en_khattab: Say, “Allah's guidance is the only true guidance.

2:120.qpc_hafs: وَلَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعۡتَ أَهۡوَآءَهُم بَعۡدَ ٱلَّذِي جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِ
2:120.en_khattab: desires after ˹all˺ the knowledge that has come to you,

2:120.qpc_hafs: مَا لَكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِيّٖ وَلَا نَصِيرٍ
2:120.en_khattab: there would be none to protect or help you against Allah.

2:121.en_khattab: Those We have given the Book
follow it as it should be followed.
It is they who truly believe in it.
As for those who reject it, it is they

2:123.qpc_hafs: وَٱتَّقُواْ يَوۡمٗا لَّا تَجۡزِي نَفۡسٌ عَن نَّفۡسٖ شَيۡـٔٗا
2:123.en_khattab: And guard yourselves against the Day when no soul will be of any help to another.
and no help will be given.

2:124.qpc_hafs: وَإِذِ ٱبۡتَلَىٰٓ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمَ رَبُّهُۥ بِكَلِمَٰتٖ فَأَتَمَّهُنَّۖ
2:124.en_khattab: ˹Remember˺ when Abraham was tested by his Lord with ˹certain˺ commandments, which he fulfilled.
Allah said, “I will certainly make you into a role model for the people.”

2:124.qpc_hafs: قَالَ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِيۖ قَالَ لَا يَنَالُ عَهۡدِي ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
2:124.en_khattab: Abraham asked, “What about my offspring?” Allah replied, “My covenant is not extended to the wrongdoers.”

2:125.qpc_hafs: وَإِذۡ جَعَلۡنَا ٱلۡبَيۡتَ مَثَابَةٗ لِّلنَّاسِ وَأَمۡنٗا
2:125.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We made the Sacred House a centre and a sanctuary for the people
˹saying˺, “˹You may˺ take the standing-place of Abraham as a site of prayer.”

2:125.qpc_hafs: وَعَهِدۡنَآ إِلَىٰٓ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسۡمَٰعِيلَ أَن طَهِّرَا بَيۡتِيَ
2:125.en_khattab: And We entrusted Abraham and Ishmael to purify My House
for those who circle it, who meditate in it, and who bow and prostrate themselves ˹in prayer˺.

2:126.qpc_hafs: وَإِذۡ قَالَ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمُ رَبِّ ٱجۡعَلۡ هَٰذَا بَلَدًا ءَامِنٗا
2:126.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham said, “My Lord, make this city ˹of Mecca˺ secure and

2:126.qpc_hafs: وَٱرۡزُقۡ أَهۡلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ مَنۡ ءَامَنَ مِنۡهُم بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡأٓخِرِۚ
2:126.en_khattab: provide fruits to its people— those among them who believe in Allah and the Last Day.”

2:126.qpc_hafs: قَالَ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَأُمَتِّعُهُۥ قَلِيلٗا ثُمَّ أَضۡطَرُّهُۥٓ إِلَىٰ عَذَابِ ٱلنَّارِۖ وَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ
2:126.en_khattab: He answered, “As for those who disbelieve, I will let them enjoy themselves for a little while, then I will condemn them to the torment of the Fire. What an evil destination!”

2:127.qpc_hafs: وَإِذۡ يَرۡفَعُ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمُ ٱلۡقَوَاعِدَ مِنَ ٱلۡبَيۡتِ
2:127.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham raised the foundation of the House.
With Ishmael, ˹both praying,˺ “Our Lord! Accept ˹this˺ from us.
You are indeed the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

2:128.en_khattab: Our Lord! Make us both ˹fully˺ submit to You.
And from our descendants a nation that will submit to you.
Show us our rituals, and turn to us in grace.
You are truly the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful.

2:129.en_khattab: Our Lord! Raise from among them a messenger

2:129.qpc_hafs: يَتۡلُواْ عَلَيۡهِمۡ ءَايَٰتِكَ وَيُعَلِّمُهُمُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡحِكۡمَةَ
2:129.en_khattab: who will recite to them Your revelations, teach them the Book and wisdom
and purify them. Indeed, You ˹alone˺ are the Almighty, All-Wise.

2:130.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يَرۡغَبُ عَن مِّلَّةِ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمَ إِلَّا مَن سَفِهَ نَفۡسَهُۥۚ
2:130.en_khattab: And who would reject the faith of Abraham except a fool!

2:130.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدِ ٱصۡطَفَيۡنَٰهُ فِي ٱلدُّنۡيَاۖ وَإِنَّهُۥ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
2:130.en_khattab: We certainly chose him in this life, and in the Hereafter he will surely be among the righteous.

2:131.en_khattab: When his Lord ordered him, “Submit ˹to My Will˺,”
he responded, “I submit to the Lord of all worlds.”

2:132.en_khattab: This was the advice of Abraham— as well as Jacob— to his children

2:132.qpc_hafs: يَٰبَنِيَّ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱصۡطَفَىٰ لَكُمُ ٱلدِّينَ
2:132.en_khattab: ˹saying˺, “Indeed, Allah has chosen for you this faith;
so do not die except in ˹a state of full˺ submission.

2:133.qpc_hafs: أَمۡ كُنتُمۡ شُهَدَآءَ إِذۡ حَضَرَ يَعۡقُوبَ ٱلۡمَوۡتُ
2:133.en_khattab: Or did you witness when death came to Jacob?

2:133.qpc_hafs: إِذۡ قَالَ لِبَنِيهِ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ مِنۢ بَعۡدِيۖ
2:133.en_khattab: He asked his children, “Who will you worship after my passing?”

2:133.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ نَعۡبُدُ إِلَٰهَكَ وَإِلَٰهَ ءَابَآئِكَ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسۡمَٰعِيلَ وَإِسۡحَٰقَ إِلَٰهٗا وَٰحِدٗا
2:133.en_khattab: They replied, “We will ˹continue to˺ worship your God, the God of your forefathers— Abraham, Ishmael, and Isaac— the One God.

2:134.en_khattab: That was a community that had already gone before.

2:134.qpc_hafs: لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتۡ وَلَكُم مَّا كَسَبۡتُمۡۖ
2:134.en_khattab: For them is what they earned and for you is what you have earned.
And you will not be accountable for what they have done.

2:135.qpc_hafs: وَقَالُواْ كُونُواْ هُودًا أَوۡ نَصَٰرَىٰ تَهۡتَدُواْۗ
2:135.en_khattab: The Jews and Christians each say, “Follow our faith to be ˹rightly˺ guided.”
Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “No! We follow the faith of Abraham, the upright.

2:136.qpc_hafs: قُولُوٓاْ ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيۡنَا وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَىٰٓ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمَ
2:136.en_khattab: Say, ˹O believers,˺ “We believe in Allah and what has been revealed to us; and what was revealed to Abraham.
Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and his descendants.

2:136.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أُوتِيَ مُوسَىٰ وَعِيسَىٰ وَمَآ أُوتِيَ ٱلنَّبِيُّونَ مِن رَّبِّهِمۡ
2:136.en_khattab: And what was given to Moses, Jesus, and other prophets from their Lord.
We make no distinction between any of them.
And to Allah we all submit.

2:137.qpc_hafs: فَإِنۡ ءَامَنُواْ بِمِثۡلِ مَآ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦ فَقَدِ ٱهۡتَدَواْۖ
2:137.en_khattab: So if they believe in what you believe, then they will indeed be ˹rightly˺ guided.

2:137.qpc_hafs: وَّإِن تَوَلَّوۡاْ فَإِنَّمَا هُمۡ فِي شِقَاقٖۖ
2:137.en_khattab: But if they turn away, they are simply opposed ˹to the truth˺.
But Allah will spare you their evil.
For He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

2:138.qpc_hafs: صِبۡغَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَمَنۡ أَحۡسَنُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ صِبۡغَةٗۖ
2:138.en_khattab: This is the ˹natural˺ Way of Allah. And who is better than Allah in ordaining a way?

2:139.qpc_hafs: أَتُحَآجُّونَنَا فِي ٱللَّهِ وَهُوَ رَبُّنَا وَرَبُّكُمۡ
2:139.en_khattab: Would you dispute with us about Allah, while He is our Lord and your Lord?
We are accountable for our deeds and you for yours.
And we are devoted to Him ˹alone˺.

2:140.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمَ وَإِسۡمَٰعِيلَ وَإِسۡحَٰقَ وَيَعۡقُوبَ وَٱلۡأَسۡبَاطَ كَانُواْ هُودًا أَوۡ نَصَٰرَىٰۗ
2:140.en_khattab: that Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and his descendants were all Jews or Christians?
Say, “Who is more knowledgeable: you or Allah?

2:140.qpc_hafs: وَمَنۡ أَظۡلَمُ مِمَّن كَتَمَ شَهَٰدَةً عِندَهُۥ مِنَ ٱللَّهِۗ
2:140.en_khattab: Who does more wrong than those who hide the testimony they received from Allah?
And Allah is never unaware of what you do.

2:141.en_khattab: That was a community that had already gone before.

2:141.qpc_hafs: لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتۡ وَلَكُم مَّا كَسَبۡتُمۡۖ
2:141.en_khattab: For them is what they earned and for you is what you have earned.
And you will not be accountable for what they have done.

2:142.en_khattab: The foolish among the people will ask,

2:142.qpc_hafs: مَا وَلَّىٰهُمۡ عَن قِبۡلَتِهِمُ ٱلَّتِي كَانُواْ عَلَيۡهَاۚ
2:142.en_khattab: “Why did they turn away from the direction of prayer they used to face?”

2:142.qpc_hafs: قُل لِّلَّهِ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقُ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبُۚ يَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٖ مُّسۡتَقِيمٖ
2:142.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “The east and west belong ˹only˺ to Allah. He guides whoever He wills to the Straight Path.”

2:143.en_khattab: And so We have made you ˹believers˺ an upright community
so that you may be witnesses over humanity
and that the Messenger may be a witness over you.

2:143.qpc_hafs: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا ٱلۡقِبۡلَةَ ٱلَّتِي كُنتَ عَلَيۡهَآ إِلَّا لِنَعۡلَمَ مَن يَتَّبِعُ ٱلرَّسُولَ
2:143.en_khattab: We assigned your former direction of prayer only to distinguish those who would remain faithful to the Messenger
from those who would lose faith.

2:143.qpc_hafs: وَإِن كَانَتۡ لَكَبِيرَةً إِلَّا عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ هَدَى ٱللَّهُۗ
2:143.en_khattab: It was certainly a difficult test except for those ˹rightly˺ guided by Allah.
And Allah would never discount your ˹previous acts of˺ faith.
Surely Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to humanity.

2:144.qpc_hafs: قَدۡ نَرَىٰ تَقَلُّبَ وَجۡهِكَ فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِۖ
2:144.en_khattab: Indeed, We see you ˹O Prophet˺ turning your face towards heaven.
Now We will make you turn towards a direction ˹of prayer˺ that will please you.
So turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque ˹in

2:144.qpc_hafs: وَحَيۡثُ مَا كُنتُمۡ فَوَلُّواْ وُجُوهَكُمۡ شَطۡرَهُۥۗ
2:144.en_khattab: Mecca˺—wherever you are, turn your faces towards it.

2:144.qpc_hafs: وَإِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ لَيَعۡلَمُونَ أَنَّهُ ٱلۡحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّهِمۡۗ وَمَا ٱللَّهُ بِغَٰفِلٍ عَمَّا يَعۡمَلُونَ
2:144.en_khattab: Those who were given the Scripture certainly know this to be the truth from their Lord. And Allah is never unaware of what they do.

2:145.qpc_hafs: وَلَئِنۡ أَتَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ بِكُلِّ ءَايَةٖ
2:145.en_khattab: Even if you were to bring every proof to the People of the Book
they would not accept your direction ˹of prayer˺
nor would any of them accept the direction ˹of prayer˺ of another.

2:145.qpc_hafs: وَلَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعۡتَ أَهۡوَآءَهُم مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِ إِنَّكَ إِذٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
2:145.en_khattab: And if you were to follow their desires after ˹all˺ the knowledge that has come to you, then you would certainly be one of the wrongdoers.

2:146.qpc_hafs: ٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيۡنَٰهُمُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ يَعۡرِفُونَهُۥ كَمَا يَعۡرِفُونَ أَبۡنَآءَهُمۡۖ
2:146.en_khattab: Those We have given the Scripture recognize this ˹Prophet˺ as they recognize their own children.

2:146.qpc_hafs: وَإِنَّ فَرِيقٗا مِّنۡهُمۡ لَيَكۡتُمُونَ ٱلۡحَقَّ وَهُمۡ يَعۡلَمُونَ
2:146.en_khattab: Yet a group of them hides the truth knowingly.

2:147.en_khattab: ˹This is˺ the truth from your Lord,
so do not ever be one of those who doubt.

2:148.en_khattab: Everyone turns to their own direction ˹of prayer˺.
So compete with one another in doing good.

2:148.qpc_hafs: أَيۡنَ مَا تَكُونُواْ يَأۡتِ بِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ جَمِيعًاۚ
2:148.en_khattab: Wherever you are, Allah will bring you all together ˹for judgment˺.

2:148.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ
2:148.en_khattab: Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

2:149.en_khattab: ˹O Prophet˺, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque.
This is certainly the truth from your Lord.
And Allah is never unaware of what you ˹all˺ do.

2:150.en_khattab: ˹O Prophet˺, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque.
so that people will have no argument against you,
Do not fear them; fear Me,
so that I may ˹continue to˺ perfect My favour upon you and so you may be ˹rightly˺ guided.

2:151.en_khattab: Since We have sent you a messenger from among yourselves—
reciting to you Our revelations, purifying you,
teaching you the Book and wisdom,
and teaching you what you never knew—

2:153.en_khattab: Seek comfort in patience and prayer.
Allah is truly with those who are patient.

2:154.qpc_hafs: لِمَن يُقۡتَلُ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ أَمۡوَٰتُۢۚ
2:154.en_khattab: that those martyred in the cause of Allah are dead
But you do not perceive it

2:155.en_khattab: with a touch of fear and famine
and loss of property, life, and crops
Give good news to those who patiently endure

2:156.en_khattab: who, when faced with a disaster

2:156.qpc_hafs: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا لِلَّهِ وَإِنَّآ إِلَيۡهِ رَٰجِعُونَ
2:156.en_khattab: say, “Surely to Allah we belong and to Him we will ˹all˺ return”

2:157.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ صَلَوَٰتٞ مِّن رَّبِّهِمۡ وَرَحۡمَةٞۖ
2:157.en_khattab: They are the ones who will receive Allah’s blessings and mercy
And it is they who are ˹rightly˺ guided

2:158.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلصَّفَا وَٱلۡمَرۡوَةَ مِن شَعَآئِرِ ٱللَّهِۖ
2:158.en_khattab: Indeed, ˹the hills of˺ Ṣafa and Marwah are among the symbols of Allah

2:158.qpc_hafs: فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيۡهِ أَن يَطَّوَّفَ بِهِمَاۚ
2:158.en_khattab: let them walk between ˹the two hills˺

2:159.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَكۡتُمُونَ مَآ أَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتِ وَٱلۡهُدَىٰ
2:159.en_khattab: Those who hide the clear proofs and guidance that We have revealed

2:159.qpc_hafs: مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا بَيَّنَّٰهُ لِلنَّاسِ فِي ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ
2:159.en_khattab: after We made it clear for humanity in the Book
will be condemned by Allah and ˹all˺ those who condemn

2:160.en_khattab: As for those who repent, mend their ways, and let the truth be known

2:160.qpc_hafs: فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَتُوبُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وَأَنَا ٱلتَّوَّابُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
2:160.en_khattab: they are the ones to whom I will turn ˹in forgiveness˺, for I am the Accepter of Repentance, Most Merciful

2:161.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَمَاتُواْ وَهُمۡ كُفَّارٌ
2:161.en_khattab: Surely those who disbelieve and die as disbelievers

2:161.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ لَعۡنَةُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ أَجۡمَعِينَ
2:161.en_khattab: are condemned by Allah, the angels, and all of humanity

2:162.en_khattab: They will be in Hell forever

2:162.qpc_hafs: لَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنۡهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُ وَلَا هُمۡ يُنظَرُونَ
2:162.en_khattab: Their punishment will not be lightened, nor will they be delayed ˹from it˺

2:163.qpc_hafs: لَّآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
2:163.en_khattab: There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him— the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful

2:164.en_khattab: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth;
the alternation of the day and the night;

2:164.qpc_hafs: وَٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلَّتِي تَجۡرِي فِي ٱلۡبَحۡرِ بِمَا يَنفَعُ ٱلنَّاسَ
2:164.en_khattab: the ships that sail the sea for the benefit of humanity;

2:164.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مِن مَّآءٖ
2:164.en_khattab: the rain sent down by Allah from the skies,
reviving the earth after its death;
the scattering of all kinds of creatures throughout;
the shifting of the winds and the clouds drifting;
between the heavens and the earth—˹in all of this˺
are surely signs for people of understanding.

2:165.qpc_hafs: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يَتَّخِذُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَندَادٗا
2:165.en_khattab: Still there are some who take others as Allah’s equal—
they love them as they should love Allah—
but the ˹true˺ believers love Allah even more.

2:165.qpc_hafs: وَلَوۡ يَرَى ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ إِذۡ يَرَوۡنَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ
2:165.en_khattab: If only the wrongdoers could see the ˹horrible˺ punishment ˹awaiting them˺,
they would certainly realize that all power belongs to Allah
and that Allah is indeed severe in punishment.

2:166.qpc_hafs: إِذۡ تَبَرَّأَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتُّبِعُواْ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُواْ
2:166.en_khattab: ˹Consider the Day˺ when those who misled others will disown their followers— when they face the torment—
and the bonds that united them will be cut off.

2:167.qpc_hafs: لَوۡ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةٗ فَنَتَبَرَّأَ مِنۡهُمۡ
2:167.en_khattab: If only we could have a second chance, we would disown them

2:167.qpc_hafs: كَذَٰلِكَ يُرِيهِمُ ٱللَّهُ أَعۡمَٰلَهُمۡ حَسَرَٰتٍ عَلَيۡهِمۡۖ
2:167.en_khattab: And so Allah will make them remorseful of their misdeeds.
And they will never ˹be able to˺ leave the Fire.

2:168.qpc_hafs: كُلُواْ مِمَّا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ حَلَٰلٗا طَيِّبٗا
2:168.en_khattab: Eat from what is lawful and good on the earth
and do not follow Satan’s footsteps.
He is truly your sworn enemy.

2:169.en_khattab: He only incites you to commit evil and indecency,

2:169.qpc_hafs: وَأَن تَقُولُواْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
2:169.en_khattab: and to claim against Allah what you do not know.

2:170.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱتَّبِعُواْ مَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ
2:170.en_khattab: When it is said to them, “Follow what Allah has revealed,”

2:170.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ بَلۡ نَتَّبِعُ مَآ أَلۡفَيۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ ءَابَآءَنَآۚ
2:170.en_khattab: they reply, “No! We ˹only˺ follow what we found our forefathers practicing.”

2:170.qpc_hafs: أَوَلَوۡ كَانَ ءَابَآؤُهُمۡ لَا يَعۡقِلُونَ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا يَهۡتَدُونَ
2:170.en_khattab: ˹Would they still do so,˺ even if their forefathers had ˹absolutely˺ no understanding or guidance?

2:171.qpc_hafs: كَمَثَلِ ٱلَّذِي يَنۡعِقُ بِمَا لَا يَسۡمَعُ إِلَّا دُعَآءٗ وَنِدَآءٗۚ
2:171.en_khattab: ˹not responding to the Messenger’s warning˺ is like a flock not comprehending the calls and cries of the shepherd.

2:171.qpc_hafs: صُمُّۢ بُكۡمٌ عُمۡيٞ فَهُمۡ لَا يَعۡقِلُونَ
2:171.en_khattab: ˹They are wilfully˺ deaf, dumb and blind so they have no understanding.

2:172.en_khattab: Eat from the good things We have provided for you.

2:172.qpc_hafs: وَٱشۡكُرُواْ لِلَّهِ إِن كُنتُمۡ إِيَّاهُ تَعۡبُدُونَ
2:172.en_khattab: And give thanks to Allah if you ˹truly˺ worship Him ˹alone˺.

2:173.qpc_hafs: إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ عَلَيۡكُمُ ٱلۡمَيۡتَةَ وَٱلدَّمَ وَلَحۡمَ ٱلۡخِنزِيرِ
2:173.en_khattab: He has only forbidden you ˹to eat˺ carrion, blood, swine,
and what is slaughtered in the name of any other than Allah.

2:173.qpc_hafs: فَمَنِ ٱضۡطُرَّ غَيۡرَ بَاغٖ وَلَا عَادٖ
2:173.en_khattab: But if someone is compelled by necessity— neither driven by desire nor exceeding immediate need—

2:173.qpc_hafs: فَلَآ إِثۡمَ عَلَيۡهِۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمٌ
2:173.en_khattab: they will not be sinful. Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2:174.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَكۡتُمُونَ مَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ
2:174.en_khattab: Indeed, those who hide Allah’s revelations
trading them for a fleeting gain

2:174.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ مَا يَأۡكُلُونَ فِي بُطُونِهِمۡ إِلَّا ٱلنَّارَ
2:174.en_khattab: consume nothing but fire into their bellies
Allah will neither speak to them on the Day of Judgment
And they will suffer a painful punishment

2:175.en_khattab: They are the ones who trade guidance for misguidance
How persistent are they in pursuit of the Fire

2:176.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ نَزَّلَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ بِٱلۡحَقِّۗ
2:176.en_khattab: That is because Allah has revealed the Book in truth
And surely those who differ regarding it

2:177.qpc_hafs: أَن تُوَلُّواْ وُجُوهَكُمۡ قِبَلَ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ
2:177.en_khattab: in turning your faces towards the east or the west.

2:177.qpc_hafs: وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱلۡبِرَّ مَنۡ ءَامَنَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡأٓخِرِ وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ وَٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ
2:177.en_khattab: Rather, the righteous are those who believe in Allah, the Last Day, the angels, the Books, and the prophets;
who give charity out of their cherished wealth

2:177.qpc_hafs: ذَوِي ٱلۡقُرۡبَىٰ وَٱلۡيَتَٰمَىٰ وَٱلۡمَسَٰكِينَ وَٱبۡنَ ٱلسَّبِيلِ
2:177.en_khattab: to relatives, orphans, the poor, ˹needy˺ travellers,

2:177.qpc_hafs: وَأَقَامَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتَى ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَٱلۡمُوفُونَ بِعَهۡدِهِمۡ إِذَا عَٰهَدُواْۖ
2:177.en_khattab: who establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and keep the pledges they make;

2:177.qpc_hafs: وَٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ فِي ٱلۡبَأۡسَآءِ وَٱلضَّرَّآءِ وَحِينَ ٱلۡبَأۡسِۗ
2:177.en_khattab: and who are patient in times of suffering, adversity, and in ˹the heat of˺ battle.
It is they who are true ˹in faith˺,
and it is they who are mindful ˹of Allah˺.

2:178.en_khattab: ˹The law of˺ retaliation is set for you in cases of murder—
a free man for a free man, a slave for a slave,
and a female for a female.

2:178.qpc_hafs: فَمَنۡ عُفِيَ لَهُۥ مِنۡ أَخِيهِ شَيۡءٞ
2:178.en_khattab: But if the offender is pardoned by the victim’s guardian,
then blood-money should be decided fairly and payment should be made courteously.
This is a concession and a mercy
from your Lord. But whoever transgresses after that

2:179.en_khattab: There is ˹security of˺ life for you
in ˹the law of˺ retaliation, O people of reason,
so that you may become mindful ˹of Allah˺.

2:180.qpc_hafs: كُتِبَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ إِذَا حَضَرَ أَحَدَكُمُ ٱلۡمَوۡتُ
2:180.en_khattab: It is prescribed that when death approaches any of you—

2:180.qpc_hafs: إِن تَرَكَ خَيۡرًا ٱلۡوَصِيَّةُ لِلۡوَٰلِدَيۡنِ وَٱلۡأَقۡرَبِينَ بِٱلۡمَعۡرُوفِۖ
2:180.en_khattab: if they leave something of value— a will should be made in favour of parents and immediate family with fairness.
˹This is˺ an obligation on those who are mindful ˹of Allah˺.

2:181.en_khattab: But whoever changes the will after hearing it
the blame will only be on those who made the change.

2:182.qpc_hafs: فَمَنۡ خَافَ مِن مُّوصٖ جَنَفًا أَوۡ إِثۡمٗا
2:182.en_khattab: Whoever suspects an error or an injustice in the will
and brings about a ˹fair˺ settlement among
the parties will not be sinful.
Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2:183.qpc_hafs: كَمَا كُتِبَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِكُمۡ
2:183.en_khattab: as it was for those before you
so perhaps you will become mindful of Allah.

2:184.qpc_hafs: فَمَن كَانَ مِنكُم مَّرِيضًا أَوۡ عَلَىٰ سَفَرٖ فَعِدَّةٞ مِّنۡ أَيَّامٍ أُخَرَۚ
2:184.en_khattab: But whoever of you is ill or on a journey, then ˹let them fast˺ an equal number of days ˹after Ramaḍân˺.

2:184.qpc_hafs: وَعَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ يُطِيقُونَهُۥ فِدۡيَةٞ طَعَامُ مِسۡكِينٖۖ
2:184.en_khattab: For those who can only fast with extreme difficulty, compensation can be made by feeding a needy person ˹for every day not fasted˺.

2:184.qpc_hafs: فَمَن تَطَوَّعَ خَيۡرٗا فَهُوَ خَيۡرٞ لَّهُۥۚ
2:184.en_khattab: But whoever volunteers to give more, it is better for them.

2:184.qpc_hafs: وَأَن تَصُومُواْ خَيۡرٞ لَّكُمۡ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ
2:184.en_khattab: And to fast is better for you, if only you knew.

2:185.qpc_hafs: شَهۡرُ رَمَضَانَ ٱلَّذِيٓ أُنزِلَ فِيهِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ هُدٗى لِّلنَّاسِ وَبَيِّنَٰتٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡهُدَىٰ وَٱلۡفُرۡقَانِۚ
2:185.en_khattab: Ramaḍân is the month in which the Quran was revealed as a guide for humanity with clear proofs of guidance and the standard ˹to distinguish between right and wrong˺.
So whoever is present this month, let them fast.

2:185.qpc_hafs: وَمَن كَانَ مَرِيضًا أَوۡ عَلَىٰ سَفَرٖ فَعِدَّةٞ مِّنۡ أَيَّامٍ أُخَرَۗ
2:185.en_khattab: But whoever is ill or on a journey, then ˹let them fast˺ an equal number of days ˹after Ramaḍân˺.

2:185.qpc_hafs: يُرِيدُ ٱللَّهُ بِكُمُ ٱلۡيُسۡرَ وَلَا يُرِيدُ بِكُمُ ٱلۡعُسۡرَ وَلِتُكۡمِلُواْ ٱلۡعِدَّةَ وَلِتُكَبِّرُواْ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ مَا هَدَىٰكُمۡ وَلَعَلَّكُمۡ تَشۡكُرُونَ
2:185.en_khattab: Allah intends ease for you, not hardship, so that you may complete the prescribed period and proclaim the greatness of Allah for guiding you, and perhaps you will be grateful.

2:186.en_khattab: When My servants ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about Me:
I respond to one’s prayer when they call upon Me.
So let them respond ˹with obedience˺ to Me and believe in Me,
perhaps they will be guided ˹to the Right Way˺.

2:187.qpc_hafs: أُحِلَّ لَكُمۡ لَيۡلَةَ ٱلصِّيَامِ ٱلرَّفَثُ إِلَىٰ نِسَآئِكُمۡۚ
2:187.en_khattab: It has been made permissible for you to be intimate with your wives during the nights preceding the fast.

2:187.qpc_hafs: هُنَّ لِبَاسٞ لَّكُمۡ وَأَنتُمۡ لِبَاسٞ لَّهُنَّۗ
2:187.en_khattab: Your spouses are a garment for you as you are for them.

2:187.qpc_hafs: عَلِمَ ٱللَّهُ أَنَّكُمۡ كُنتُمۡ تَخۡتَانُونَ أَنفُسَكُمۡ فَتَابَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ وَعَفَا عَنكُمۡۖ
2:187.en_khattab: Allah knows that you were deceiving yourselves. So He has accepted your repentance and pardoned you.

2:187.qpc_hafs: فَٱلۡـَٰٔنَ بَٰشِرُوهُنَّ وَٱبۡتَغُواْ مَا كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمۡۚ
2:187.en_khattab: So now you may be intimate with them and seek what Allah has prescribed for you.

2:187.qpc_hafs: وَكُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ حَتَّىٰ يَتَبَيَّنَ لَكُمُ ٱلۡخَيۡطُ ٱلۡأَبۡيَضُ مِنَ ٱلۡخَيۡطِ ٱلۡأَسۡوَدِ مِنَ ٱلۡفَجۡرِۖ
2:187.en_khattab: ˹You may˺ eat and drink until you see the light of dawn breaking the darkness of night,
then complete the fast until nightfall.

2:187.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تُبَٰشِرُوهُنَّ وَأَنتُمۡ عَٰكِفُونَ فِي ٱلۡمَسَٰجِدِۗ
2:187.en_khattab: Do not be intimate with your spouses while you are meditating in the mosques.
These are the limits set by Allah, so do not exceed them.

2:187.qpc_hafs: كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ ءَايَٰتِهِۦ لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمۡ يَتَّقُونَ
2:187.en_khattab: This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to people, so they may become mindful ˹of Him˺.

2:188.en_khattab: Do not consume one another’s wealth unjustly,
in order to devour a portion of others’ property
knowing that it is a sin.

2:189.en_khattab: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the phases of the moon.
Say, “They are a means for people to determine time and pilgrimage.”

2:189.qpc_hafs: وَلَيۡسَ ٱلۡبِرُّ بِأَن تَأۡتُواْ ٱلۡبُيُوتَ مِن ظُهُورِهَا
2:189.en_khattab: Righteousness is not in entering your houses from the back doors.
Rather, righteousness is to be mindful ˹of Allah˺.
So enter your homes through their ˹proper˺ doors,
and be mindful of Allah so you may be successful.

2:190.qpc_hafs: وَقَٰتِلُواْ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِينَ يُقَٰتِلُونَكُمۡ
2:190.en_khattab: Fight in the cause of Allah ˹only˺ against those who wage war against you,
but do not exceed the limits.

2:191.en_khattab: Kill them wherever you come upon them
and drive them out of the places from which they have driven you out.
For persecution is far worse than killing.

2:191.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تُقَٰتِلُوهُمۡ عِندَ ٱلۡمَسۡجِدِ ٱلۡحَرَامِ حَتَّىٰ يُقَٰتِلُوكُمۡ فِيهِۖ
2:191.en_khattab: And do not fight them at the Sacred Mosque unless they attack you there.
If they do so, then fight them
that is the reward of the disbelievers.

2:192.en_khattab: then surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2:193.en_khattab: Fight against them ˹if they persecute you˺ until there is no more persecution,
and ˹your˺ devotion will be to Allah ˹alone˺.
let there be no hostility except against the aggressors.

2:194.en_khattab: ˹There will be retaliation in˺ a sacred month for ˹an offence in˺ a sacred month,
and all violations will bring about retaliation.

2:194.qpc_hafs: فَمَنِ ٱعۡتَدَىٰ عَلَيۡكُمۡ فَٱعۡتَدُواْ عَلَيۡهِ بِمِثۡلِ مَا ٱعۡتَدَىٰ عَلَيۡكُمۡۚ
2:194.en_khattab: So, if anyone attacks you, retaliate in the same manner.
and know that Allah is with those mindful ˹of Him˺.

2:195.en_khattab: Spend in the cause of Allah
and do not let your own hands throw you into destruction ˹by withholding˺
for Allah certainly loves the good-doers

2:196.en_khattab: Complete the pilgrimage and minor pilgrimage for Allah.

2:196.qpc_hafs: فَإِنۡ أُحۡصِرۡتُمۡ فَمَا ٱسۡتَيۡسَرَ مِنَ ٱلۡهَدۡيِۖ
2:196.en_khattab: But if prevented ˹from proceeding˺, then ˹offer˺ whatever sacrificial animals you can afford.

2:196.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَحۡلِقُواْ رُءُوسَكُمۡ حَتَّىٰ يَبۡلُغَ ٱلۡهَدۡيُ مَحِلَّهُۥۚ
2:196.en_khattab: And do not shave your heads until the sacrificial animal reaches its destination.

2:196.qpc_hafs: فَمَن كَانَ مِنكُم مَّرِيضًا أَوۡ بِهِۦٓ أَذٗى مِّن رَّأۡسِهِۦ فَفِدۡيَةٞ مِّن صِيَامٍ أَوۡ صَدَقَةٍ أَوۡ نُسُكٖۚ
2:196.en_khattab: But if any of you is ill or has a scalp ailment ˹requiring shaving˺, then compensate either by fasting, charity, or a sacrificial offering.

2:196.qpc_hafs: فَإِذَآ أَمِنتُمۡ فَمَن تَمَتَّعَ بِٱلۡعُمۡرَةِ إِلَى ٱلۡحَجِّ فَمَا ٱسۡتَيۡسَرَ مِنَ ٱلۡهَدۡيِۚ
2:196.en_khattab: In times of peace, you may combine the pilgrimage and minor pilgrimage then make the sacrificial offering you can afford.

2:196.qpc_hafs: فَمَن لَّمۡ يَجِدۡ فَصِيَامُ ثَلَٰثَةِ أَيَّامٖ فِي ٱلۡحَجِّ وَسَبۡعَةٍ إِذَا رَجَعۡتُمۡۗ تِلۡكَ عَشَرَةٞ كَامِلَةٞۗ
2:196.en_khattab: Whoever cannot afford that ˹offering˺, let them fast three days during pilgrimage and seven after returning ˹home˺—completing ten.

2:196.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ لِمَن لَّمۡ يَكُنۡ أَهۡلُهُۥ حَاضِرِي ٱلۡمَسۡجِدِ ٱلۡحَرَامِۚ
2:196.en_khattab: These offerings are for those who do not live near the Sacred House.

2:196.qpc_hafs: وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلۡعِقَابِ
2:196.en_khattab: And be mindful of Allah, and know that Allah is severe in punishment.

2:197.en_khattab: ˹Commitment to˺ pilgrimage is made in appointed months.

2:197.qpc_hafs: فَلَا رَفَثَ وَلَا فُسُوقَ وَلَا جِدَالَ فِي ٱلۡحَجِّۗ
2:197.en_khattab: let them stay away from intimate relations, foul language, and arguments during pilgrimage.

2:197.qpc_hafs: وَمَا تَفۡعَلُواْ مِنۡ خَيۡرٖ يَعۡلَمۡهُ ٱللَّهُۗ
2:197.en_khattab: Whatever good you do, Allah ˹fully˺ knows of it.
Take ˹necessary˺ provisions ˹for the journey˺—surely the best provision is righteousness.
And be mindful of Me, O  people of reason!

2:198.qpc_hafs: لَيۡسَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ جُنَاحٌ أَن تَبۡتَغُواْ فَضۡلٗا مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡۚ
2:198.en_khattab: There is no blame on you for seeking the bounty of your Lord ˹during this journey˺.
praise Allah near the sacred place
and praise Him for having guided you

2:198.qpc_hafs: وَإِن كُنتُم مِّن قَبۡلِهِۦ لَمِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
2:198.en_khattab: for surely before this ˹guidance˺ you were astray.

2:199.en_khattab: Then go forth with the rest of
Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2:200.en_khattab: When you have fulfilled your sacred rites,
as you used to praise your forefathers
before Islam˺, or even more passionately.

2:200.qpc_hafs: مَن يَقُولُ رَبَّنَآ ءَاتِنَا فِي ٱلدُّنۡيَا
2:200.en_khattab: say, “Our Lord! Grant us ˹Your bounties˺ in this world,

2:200.qpc_hafs: وَمَا لَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ مِنۡ خَلَٰقٖ
2:200.en_khattab: but they will have no share in the Hereafter.

2:201.en_khattab: Yet there are others who say
“Our Lord! Grant us the good of this world
and protect us from the torment of the Fire

2:202.en_khattab: It is they who will receive a ˹heavenly˺ reward
for the good they have done
Surely Allah is swift in reckoning

2:203.en_khattab: And remember Allah during ˹these˺ appointed days.
Whoever departs swiftly on the second day
neither are those who stay behind
so long as they are mindful ˹of their Lord˺.
and know that to Him you will ˹all˺ be gathered.

2:204.qpc_hafs: مَن يُعۡجِبُكَ قَوۡلُهُۥ فِي ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَا
2:204.en_khattab: ˹hypocrites˺ who impress you with their views regarding worldly affairs

2:204.qpc_hafs: وَيُشۡهِدُ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ مَا فِي قَلۡبِهِۦ
2:204.en_khattab: and openly call upon Allah to witness what is in their hearts,
yet they are your worst adversaries.

2:205.en_khattab: And when they leave ˹you˺, they strive throughout the land
to spread mischief in it and destroy crops and cattle.

2:206.en_khattab: When it is said to them, “Fear Allah,”
pride carries them off to sin
Hell will be their proper place
What an evil place to rest!

2:207.qpc_hafs: مَن يَشۡرِي نَفۡسَهُ ٱبۡتِغَآءَ مَرۡضَاتِ ٱللَّهِۚ
2:207.en_khattab: who would dedicate their lives to Allah’s pleasure.
And Allah is Ever Gracious to ˹His˺ servants.

2:208.en_khattab: and do not follow Satan’s footsteps
Surely he is your sworn enemy

2:209.qpc_hafs: فَإِن زَلَلۡتُم مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَتۡكُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتُ
2:209.en_khattab: If you falter after receiving the clear proofs,
that Allah is indeed Almighty, All-Wise.

2:210.qpc_hafs: إِلَّآ أَن يَأۡتِيَهُمُ ٱللَّهُ فِي ظُلَلٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡغَمَامِ وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ
2:210.en_khattab: for Allah ˹Himself˺ to come to them in the shade of clouds, along with the angels?
˹If He did˺, then the matter would be settled ˹at once˺.
And to Allah ˹all˺ matters will be returned ˹for judgment˺.

2:211.en_khattab: how many clear signs We have given them.

2:211.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يُبَدِّلۡ نِعۡمَةَ ٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَتۡهُ
2:211.en_khattab: And whoever trades Allah’s favour— after receiving
it—˹for disbelief˺ should know that Allah is indeed severe in punishment.

2:212.en_khattab: The life of this world has been made appealing to the disbelievers,
Those who are mindful ˹of Allah˺ will rank above them on the Day of Judgment.

2:212.qpc_hafs: وَٱللَّهُ يَرۡزُقُ مَن يَشَآءُ بِغَيۡرِ حِسَابٖ
2:212.en_khattab: And Allah provides for whoever He wills without limit.

2:213.en_khattab: Humanity had once been one community
of believers before they lost faith
Then Allah raised prophets as deliverers of good news and as warners
and revealed to them the Scriptures in truth

2:213.qpc_hafs: لِيَحۡكُمَ بَيۡنَ ٱلنَّاسِ فِيمَا ٱخۡتَلَفُواْ فِيهِۚ
2:213.en_khattab: to judge among people regarding their disputes

2:213.qpc_hafs: وَمَا ٱخۡتَلَفَ فِيهِ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُوهُ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَتۡهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتُ
2:213.en_khattab: And no one disputed the Scriptures except the very people who received them after clear proofs had come to them

2:213.qpc_hafs: فَهَدَى ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ لِمَا ٱخۡتَلَفُواْ فِيهِ مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ بِإِذۡنِهِۦۗ
2:213.en_khattab: Then Allah, by His grace, has guided the believers to the truth regarding those disputes

2:213.qpc_hafs: وَٱللَّهُ يَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٖ مُّسۡتَقِيمٍ
2:213.en_khattab: And Allah guides whoever He wills to the Straight Path

2:214.en_khattab: you will be admitted into Paradise
They were afflicted with suffering and adversity

2:214.qpc_hafs: وَزُلۡزِلُواْ حَتَّىٰ يَقُولَ ٱلرَّسُولُ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مَعَهُۥ مَتَىٰ نَصۡرُ ٱللَّهِۗ
2:214.en_khattab: and were so ˹violently˺ shaken that ˹even˺ the Messenger and the believers with him cried out, “When will Allah’s help come?”

2:215.en_khattab: They ask you ˹O Prophet in˺ what ˹way˺ they should donate.
Say, “Whatever donations you give are for

2:215.qpc_hafs: فَلِلۡوَٰلِدَيۡنِ وَٱلۡأَقۡرَبِينَ وَٱلۡيَتَٰمَىٰ وَٱلۡمَسَٰكِينِ وَٱبۡنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِۗ
2:215.en_khattab: parents, relatives, orphans, the poor, and ˹needy˺ travellers.
is certainly well known to Allah.

2:216.en_khattab: Fighting has been made obligatory upon you ˹believers˺,
something which is good for you
something which is bad for you.
Allah knows and you do not know.

2:217.en_khattab: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about fighting in the sacred months.
Say, “Fighting during these months is a great sin.
Say, “Fighting during these months is a great sin.

2:217.qpc_hafs: وَصَدٌّ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَكُفۡرُۢ بِهِۦ وَٱلۡمَسۡجِدِ ٱلۡحَرَامِ
2:217.en_khattab: But hindering ˹others˺ from the Path of Allah, rejecting Him, and expelling the worshippers from the Sacred Mosque is ˹a˺ greater ˹sin˺ in the sight of Allah.

2:217.qpc_hafs: وَإِخۡرَاجُ أَهۡلِهِۦ مِنۡهُ أَكۡبَرُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِۚ
2:217.en_khattab: But hindering ˹others˺ from the Path of Allah, rejecting Him, and expelling the worshippers from the Sacred Mosque is ˹a˺ greater ˹sin˺ in the sight of Allah.
For persecution is far worse than killing.
And they will not stop fighting you

2:217.qpc_hafs: حَتَّىٰ يَرُدُّوكُمۡ عَن دِينِكُمۡ إِنِ ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْۚ
2:217.en_khattab: until they turn you away from your faith— if they can.

2:217.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يَرۡتَدِدۡ مِنكُمۡ عَن دِينِهِۦ فَيَمُتۡ وَهُوَ كَافِرٞ
2:217.en_khattab: And whoever among you renounces their own faith and dies a disbeliever,

2:217.qpc_hafs: فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ حَبِطَتۡ أَعۡمَٰلُهُمۡ فِي ٱلدُّنۡيَا وَٱلۡأٓخِرَةِۖ
2:217.en_khattab: their deeds will become void in this life and in the Hereafter.

2:217.qpc_hafs: وَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِۖ هُمۡ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
2:217.en_khattab: It is they who will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever.”

2:218.en_khattab: and struggled in the Way of Allah
they can hope for Allah’s mercy.
And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

2:219.en_khattab: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about intoxicants and gambling.

2:219.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ فِيهِمَآ إِثۡمٞ كَبِيرٞ وَمَنَٰفِعُ لِلنَّاسِ
2:219.en_khattab: Say, “There is great evil in both, as well as some benefit for people
but the evil outweighs the benefit.
They ˹also˺ ask you ˹O Prophet˺ what they should donate.

2:219.qpc_hafs: قُلِ ٱلۡعَفۡوَۗ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمُ ٱلۡأٓيَٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَتَفَكَّرُونَ
2:219.en_khattab: Say, “Whatever you can spare.” This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you ˹believers˺, so perhaps you may reflect.

2:220.en_khattab: upon this world and the Hereafter.
And they ask you ˹O Prophet˺ concerning orphans.
And if you partner with them, they are bonded with you ˹in faith˺.
And Allah knows who intends harm and who intends good.
Had Allah willed, He could have made it difficult for you.

2:221.en_khattab: Do not marry polytheistic women until they believe
for a believing slave-woman is better than a free polytheist
even though she may look pleasant to you.
And do not marry your women to polytheistic men until they believe
for a believing slave-man is better than a free polytheist
even though he may look pleasant to you.

2:221.qpc_hafs: وَٱللَّهُ يَدۡعُوٓاْ إِلَى ٱلۡجَنَّةِ وَٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ بِإِذۡنِهِۦۖ
2:221.en_khattab: while Allah invites ˹you˺ to Paradise and forgiveness by His grace.
He makes His revelations clear to the people so perhaps they will be mindful.

2:222.en_khattab: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about menstruation.

2:222.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ هُوَ أَذٗى فَٱعۡتَزِلُواْ ٱلنِّسَآءَ فِي ٱلۡمَحِيضِ وَلَا تَقۡرَبُوهُنَّ حَتَّىٰ يَطۡهُرۡنَۖ
2:222.en_khattab: Say, “Beware of its harm! So keep away, and do not have intercourse with your wives during their monthly cycles until they are purified.

2:222.qpc_hafs: فَإِذَا تَطَهَّرۡنَ فَأۡتُوهُنَّ مِنۡ حَيۡثُ أَمَرَكُمُ ٱللَّهُۚ
2:222.en_khattab: When they purify themselves, then you may approach them in the manner specified by Allah.

2:222.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحِبُّ ٱلتَّوَّٰبِينَ وَيُحِبُّ ٱلۡمُتَطَهِّرِينَ
2:222.en_khattab: Surely Allah loves those who always turn to Him in repentance and those who purify themselves.

2:223.qpc_hafs: نِسَآؤُكُمۡ حَرۡثٞ لَّكُمۡ فَأۡتُواْ حَرۡثَكُمۡ أَنَّىٰ شِئۡتُمۡۖ
2:223.en_khattab: Your wives are like farmland for you, so approach them ˹consensually˺ as you please.
And send forth something good for yourselves.
Be mindful of Allah, and know that you will meet Him.
And give good news to the believers.

2:224.en_khattab: Do not use Allah’s Name in your oaths

2:224.qpc_hafs: أَن تَبَرُّواْ وَتَتَّقُواْ وَتُصۡلِحُواْ بَيۡنَ ٱلنَّاسِۚ
2:224.en_khattab: as an excuse for not doing good, not guarding against evil, or not making peace between people

2:225.qpc_hafs: لَّا يُؤَاخِذُكُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِٱللَّغۡوِ فِيٓ أَيۡمَٰنِكُمۡ
2:225.en_khattab: Allah will not hold you accountable for unintentional oaths
but for what you intended in your hearts
And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Forbearing

2:226.qpc_hafs: لِّلَّذِينَ يُؤۡلُونَ مِن نِّسَآئِهِمۡ تَرَبُّصُ أَرۡبَعَةِ أَشۡهُرٖۖ
2:226.en_khattab: Those who swear not to have intercourse with their wives must wait for four months

2:226.qpc_hafs: فَإِن فَآءُو فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمٞ
2:226.en_khattab: If they change their mind, then Allah is certainly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful

2:227.en_khattab: But if they settle on divorce
then Allah is indeed All-Hearing, All-Knowing

2:228.en_khattab: Divorced women must wait three monthly cycles

2:228.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يَحِلُّ لَهُنَّ أَن يَكۡتُمۡنَ مَا خَلَقَ ٱللَّهُ فِيٓ أَرۡحَامِهِنَّ إِن كُنَّ يُؤۡمِنَّ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡأٓخِرِۚ
2:228.en_khattab: ˹before they can re-marry˺. It is not lawful for them to conceal what Allah has created in their wombs, if they ˹truly˺ believe in Allah and the Last Day.

2:228.qpc_hafs: وَبُعُولَتُهُنَّ أَحَقُّ بِرَدِّهِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ إِنۡ أَرَادُوٓاْ إِصۡلَٰحٗاۚ
2:228.en_khattab: And their husbands reserve the right to take them back within that period if they desire reconciliation.
Women have rights similar to those of men equitably,
although men have a degree ˹of responsibility˺ above them.

2:229.en_khattab: then the husband must retain ˹his wife˺ with honour or separate ˹from her˺ with grace.

2:229.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يَحِلُّ لَكُمۡ أَن تَأۡخُذُواْ مِمَّآ ءَاتَيۡتُمُوهُنَّ شَيۡـًٔا
2:229.en_khattab: It is not lawful for husbands to take back anything of the dowry given to their wives,

2:229.qpc_hafs: إِلَّآ أَن يَخَافَآ أَلَّا يُقِيمَا حُدُودَ ٱللَّهِۖ
2:229.en_khattab: unless the couple fears not being able to keep within the limits of Allah.

2:229.qpc_hafs: فَإِنۡ خِفۡتُمۡ أَلَّا يُقِيمَا حُدُودَ ٱللَّهِ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيۡهِمَا فِيمَا ٱفۡتَدَتۡ بِهِۦۗ
2:229.en_khattab: So if you fear they will not be able to keep within the limits of Allah, there is no blame if the wife compensates the husband to obtain divorce.
These are the limits set by Allah, so do not transgress them.

2:229.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يَتَعَدَّ حُدُودَ ٱللَّهِ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلظَّٰلِمُونَ
2:229.en_khattab: And whoever transgresses the limits of Allah, they are the ˹true˺ wrongdoers.

2:230.en_khattab: So if a husband divorces his wife
˹three times˺, then it is not lawful for him to remarry her until after
Then it is permissible for them to reunite,
to maintain the limits of Allah.
These are the limits set by Allah,
which He makes clear for people of knowledge.

2:231.en_khattab: and they have ˹almost˺ reached the end of their waiting period,
But do not retain them ˹only˺ to harm them

2:231.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يَفۡعَلۡ ذَٰلِكَ فَقَدۡ ظَلَمَ نَفۡسَهُۥۚ
2:231.en_khattab: Whoever does that surely wrongs his own soul.
Do not take Allah’s revelations lightly.

2:231.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أَنزَلَ عَلَيۡكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلۡحِكۡمَةِ يَعِظُكُم بِهِۦۚ
2:231.en_khattab: as well as the Book and wisdom He has sent down for your guidance.

2:231.qpc_hafs: وَٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَيۡءٍ عَلِيمٞ
2:231.en_khattab: and know that Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things.

2:232.en_khattab: and they have reached the end of their waiting period,
if they come to an honourable agreement.

2:232.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ يُوعَظُ بِهِۦ مَن كَانَ مِنكُمۡ يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡأٓخِرِۗ
2:232.en_khattab: This is enjoined on whoever has faith in Allah and the Last Day.
This is purer and more dignifying for you.
Allah knows and you do not know.

2:233.en_khattab: ˹Divorced˺ mothers will breastfeed their offspring for two whole years,
for those who wish to complete the nursing ˹of their child˺.

2:233.qpc_hafs: وَعَلَى ٱلۡمَوۡلُودِ لَهُۥ رِزۡقُهُنَّ وَكِسۡوَتُهُنَّ بِٱلۡمَعۡرُوفِۚ
2:233.en_khattab: The child’s father will provide reasonable maintenance and clothing for the mother ˹during that period˺.
No one will be charged with more than they can bear.

2:233.qpc_hafs: لَا تُضَآرَّ وَٰلِدَةُۢ بِوَلَدِهَا وَلَا مَوۡلُودٞ لَّهُۥ بِوَلَدِهِۦۚ
2:233.en_khattab: No mother or father should be made to suffer for their child.
The ˹father’s˺ heirs are under the same obligation.

2:233.qpc_hafs: فَإِنۡ أَرَادَا فِصَالًا عَن تَرَاضٖ مِّنۡهُمَا وَتَشَاوُرٖ فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيۡهِمَاۗ
2:233.en_khattab: But if both sides decide— after mutual consultation and consent— to wean a child, then there is no blame on them.
If you decide to have your children nursed by a wet-nurse,

2:233.qpc_hafs: فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ إِذَا سَلَّمۡتُم مَّآ ءَاتَيۡتُم بِٱلۡمَعۡرُوفِۗ
2:233.en_khattab: it is permissible as long as you pay fairly.

2:233.qpc_hafs: وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ بَصِيرٞ
2:233.en_khattab: Be mindful of Allah, and know that Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

2:234.en_khattab: As for those of you who die
let them observe a waiting period of four months and ten days
When they have reached the end of this period

2:234.qpc_hafs: فَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ فِيمَا فَعَلۡنَ فِيٓ أَنفُسِهِنَّ بِٱلۡمَعۡرُوفِۗ
2:234.en_khattab: then you are not accountable for what they decide for themselves in a reasonable manner
And Allah is All-Aware of what you do

2:235.qpc_hafs: وَلَا جُنَاحَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ فِيمَا عَرَّضۡتُم بِهِۦ مِنۡ خِطۡبَةِ ٱلنِّسَآءِ
2:235.en_khattab: There is no blame on you for subtly showing interest in ˹divorced or widowed˺ women
or for hiding ˹the intention˺ in your hearts
Allah knows that you are considering them ˹for marriage˺

2:235.qpc_hafs: وَلَٰكِن لَّا تُوَاعِدُوهُنَّ سِرًّا إِلَّآ أَن تَقُولُواْ قَوۡلٗا مَّعۡرُوفٗاۚ
2:235.en_khattab: But do not make a secret commitment with them— you can only show interest in them appropriately

2:235.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَعۡزِمُواْ عُقۡدَةَ ٱلنِّكَاحِ حَتَّىٰ يَبۡلُغَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبُ أَجَلَهُۥۚ
2:235.en_khattab: Do not commit to the bond of marriage until the waiting period expires

2:235.qpc_hafs: وَٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعۡلَمُ مَا فِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡ فَٱحۡذَرُوهُۚ
2:235.en_khattab: Know that Allah is aware of what is in your hearts, so beware of Him
And know that Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Forbearing

2:236.qpc_hafs: لَّا جُنَاحَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ إِن طَلَّقۡتُمُ ٱلنِّسَآءَ
2:236.en_khattab: There is no blame if you divorce women

2:236.qpc_hafs: مَا لَمۡ تَمَسُّوهُنَّ أَوۡ تَفۡرِضُواْ لَهُنَّ فَرِيضَةٗۚ
2:236.en_khattab: before the marriage is consummated or the dowry is settled

2:236.qpc_hafs: وَمَتِّعُوهُنَّ عَلَى ٱلۡمُوسِعِ قَدَرُهُۥ وَعَلَى ٱلۡمُقۡتِرِ قَدَرُهُۥ مَتَٰعَۢا بِٱلۡمَعۡرُوفِۖ
2:236.en_khattab: But give them a ˹suitable˺ compensation— the rich according to his means and the poor according to his
A reasonable compensation is an obligation on the good-doers

2:237.qpc_hafs: وَإِن طَلَّقۡتُمُوهُنَّ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن تَمَسُّوهُنَّ
2:237.en_khattab: And if you divorce them before consummating the marriage
but after deciding on a dowry

2:237.qpc_hafs: فَنِصۡفُ مَا فَرَضۡتُمۡ إِلَّآ أَن يَعۡفُونَ أَوۡ يَعۡفُوَاْ ٱلَّذِي بِيَدِهِۦ عُقۡدَةُ ٱلنِّكَاحِۚ
2:237.en_khattab: pay half of the dowry, unless the wife graciously waives it or the husband graciously pays in full
And do not forget kindness among yourselves
Surely Allah is All-Seeing of what you do

2:238.en_khattab: and stand in true devotion to Allah

2:239.en_khattab: pray on foot or while riding.

2:239.qpc_hafs: كَمَا عَلَّمَكُم مَّا لَمۡ تَكُونُواْ تَعۡلَمُونَ
2:239.en_khattab: for teaching you what you did not know.

2:240.en_khattab: But if they choose to leave,

2:240.qpc_hafs: فِي مَا فَعَلۡنَ فِيٓ أَنفُسِهِنَّ مِن مَّعۡرُوفٖۗ
2:240.en_khattab: for what they reasonably decide for themselves.

2:241.en_khattab: Reasonable provisions must be made for divorced women

2:242.en_khattab: clear to you, so perhaps you will understand.

2:243.qpc_hafs: أَلَمۡ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ خَرَجُواْ مِن دِيَٰرِهِمۡ
2:243.en_khattab: Have you ˹O Prophet˺ not seen those who fled their homes
in the thousands for fear of death?

2:243.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَذُو فَضۡلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ
2:243.en_khattab: Surely Allah is ever Bountiful to humanity,

2:244.en_khattab: Fight in the cause of Allah
and know that Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing

2:245.qpc_hafs: مَّن ذَا ٱلَّذِي يُقۡرِضُ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗا
2:245.en_khattab: Who will lend to Allah a good loan
which Allah will multiply many times over
