It is Allah ˹alone˺ who decreases and increases ˹wealth˺. And to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned

2:246.qpc_hafs: أَلَمۡ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلۡمَلَإِ مِنۢ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مُوسَىٰٓ
2:246.en_khattab: Have you not seen those chiefs of the Children of Israel after Moses?

2:246.qpc_hafs: إِذۡ قَالُواْ لِنَبِيّٖ لَّهُمُ ٱبۡعَثۡ لَنَا مَلِكٗا نُّقَٰتِلۡ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۖ
2:246.en_khattab: They said to one of their prophets, “Appoint for us a king, ˹and˺ we will fight in the cause of Allah.”

2:246.qpc_hafs: قَالَ هَلۡ عَسَيۡتُمۡ إِن كُتِبَ عَلَيۡكُمُ ٱلۡقِتَالُ أَلَّا تُقَٰتِلُواْۖ
2:246.en_khattab: He said, “Are you not going to cower if ordered to fight?”

2:246.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ وَمَا لَنَآ أَلَّا نُقَٰتِلَ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَقَدۡ أُخۡرِجۡنَا مِن دِيَٰرِنَا وَأَبۡنَآئِنَاۖ
2:246.en_khattab: They replied, “How could we refuse to fight in the cause of Allah, while we were driven out of our homes and ˹separated from˺ our children?”

2:246.qpc_hafs: فَلَمَّا كُتِبَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡقِتَالُ تَوَلَّوۡاْ إِلَّا قَلِيلٗا مِّنۡهُمۡۚ
2:246.en_khattab: But when they were ordered to fight, they fled, except for a few of them.
And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of the wrongdoers.

2:247.qpc_hafs: وَقَالَ لَهُمۡ نَبِيُّهُمۡ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَدۡ بَعَثَ لَكُمۡ طَالُوتَ مَلِكٗاۚ
2:247.en_khattab: Their prophet told them, “Allah has appointed Saul to be your king.”

2:247.qpc_hafs: قَالُوٓاْ أَنَّىٰ يَكُونُ لَهُ ٱلۡمُلۡكُ عَلَيۡنَا وَنَحۡنُ أَحَقُّ بِٱلۡمُلۡكِ مِنۡهُ وَلَمۡ يُؤۡتَ سَعَةٗ مِّنَ ٱلۡمَالِۚ
2:247.en_khattab: They protested, “How can he be our king when some of us are more deserving of kingship than he, and he has not been blessed with vast riches?”

2:247.qpc_hafs: قَالَ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱصۡطَفَىٰهُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ وَزَادَهُۥ بَسۡطَةٗ فِي ٱلۡعِلۡمِ وَٱلۡجِسۡمِۖ
2:247.en_khattab: He replied, “Allah has chosen him over you and blessed him with knowledge and stature.

2:247.qpc_hafs: وَٱللَّهُ يُؤۡتِي مُلۡكَهُۥ مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَٱللَّهُ وَٰسِعٌ عَلِيمٞ
2:247.en_khattab: Allah grants kingship to whoever He wills. And Allah is All-Bountiful, All-Knowing.”

2:248.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ءَايَةَ مُلۡكِهِۦٓ أَن يَأۡتِيَكُمُ ٱلتَّابُوتُ
2:248.en_khattab: The sign of Saul’s kingship is that the Ark will come to you

2:248.qpc_hafs: وَبَقِيَّةٞ مِّمَّا تَرَكَ ءَالُ مُوسَىٰ وَءَالُ هَٰرُونَ
2:248.en_khattab: and relics of the family of Moses and the family of Aaron
which will be carried by the angels.

2:248.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗ لَّكُمۡ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
2:248.en_khattab: Surely in this is a sign for you, if you ˹truly˺ believe.

2:249.en_khattab: When Saul marched forth with his army,
he cautioned: “Allah will test you with a river.
So whoever drinks ˹his fill˺ from it is not with me,
and whoever does not taste it—

2:249.qpc_hafs: فَإِنَّهُۥ مِنِّيٓ إِلَّا مَنِ ٱغۡتَرَفَ غُرۡفَةَۢ بِيَدِهِۦۚ
2:249.en_khattab: except a sip from the hollow of his hands— is definitely with me.
They all drank ˹their fill˺ except for a few!

2:249.qpc_hafs: فَلَمَّا جَاوَزَهُۥ هُوَ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مَعَهُۥ
2:249.en_khattab: When he and the ˹remaining˺ faithful with him crossed the river,

2:249.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا ٱلۡيَوۡمَ بِجَالُوتَ وَجُنُودِهِۦۚ
2:249.en_khattab: they said, “Now we are no match for Goliath and his warriors.”

2:249.qpc_hafs: قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَظُنُّونَ أَنَّهُم مُّلَٰقُواْ ٱللَّهِ كَم مِّن فِئَةٖ قَلِيلَةٍ غَلَبَتۡ فِئَةٗ كَثِيرَةَۢ بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِۗ
2:249.en_khattab: But those ˹believers˺ who were certain they would meet Allah reasoned, “How many times has a small force vanquished a mighty army by the Will of Allah!
And Allah is ˹always˺ with the steadfast.

2:250.en_khattab: When they advanced to face Goliath and his warriors
they prayed, “Our Lord! Shower us with perseverance
and give us victory over the disbelieving people.

2:251.en_khattab: So they defeated them by Allah’s Will

2:251.qpc_hafs: وَءَاتَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡمُلۡكَ وَٱلۡحِكۡمَةَ وَعَلَّمَهُۥ مِمَّا يَشَآءُۗ
2:251.en_khattab: And Allah blessed David with kingship and wisdom and taught him what He willed

2:251.qpc_hafs: وَلَوۡلَا دَفۡعُ ٱللَّهِ ٱلنَّاسَ بَعۡضَهُم بِبَعۡضٖ
2:251.en_khattab: Had Allah not repelled a group of people by ˹the might of˺ another

2:251.qpc_hafs: لَّفَسَدَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ذُو فَضۡلٍ عَلَى ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
2:251.en_khattab: corruption would have dominated the earth, but Allah is Gracious to all

2:252.en_khattab: which We recite to you ˹O Prophet˺ in truth
And you are truly one of the messengers

2:253.qpc_hafs: تِلۡكَ ٱلرُّسُلُ فَضَّلۡنَا بَعۡضَهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖۘ
2:253.en_khattab: We have chosen some of those messengers above others.
and raised some high in rank.
To Jesus, son of Mary, We gave clear proofs.
and supported him with the holy spirit.

2:253.qpc_hafs: وَلَوۡ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مَا ٱقۡتَتَلَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِم
2:253.en_khattab: If Allah had willed, succeeding generations would not have fought among themselves.

2:253.qpc_hafs: فَمِنۡهُم مَّنۡ ءَامَنَ وَمِنۡهُم مَّن كَفَرَۚ

2:253.en_khattab: Yet if Allah had willed, they would not have fought one another.
But Allah does what He wills.

2:254.en_khattab: Donate from what We have provided for you before

2:254.qpc_hafs: أَن يَأۡتِيَ يَوۡمٞ لَّا بَيۡعٞ فِيهِ وَلَا خُلَّةٞ وَلَا شَفَٰعَةٞۗ
2:254.en_khattab: the arrival of a Day when there will be no bargaining, friendship, or intercession
Those who disbelieve are ˹truly˺ the wrongdoers.

2:255.en_khattab: Allah! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him,
Neither drowsiness nor sleep overtakes Him.

2:255.qpc_hafs: لَّهُۥ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۗ
2:255.en_khattab: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.

2:255.qpc_hafs: مَن ذَا ٱلَّذِي يَشۡفَعُ عِندَهُۥٓ إِلَّا بِإِذۡنِهِۦۚ
2:255.en_khattab: Who could possibly intercede with Him without His permission?

2:255.qpc_hafs: يَعۡلَمُ مَا بَيۡنَ أَيۡدِيهِمۡ وَمَا خَلۡفَهُمۡۖ
2:255.en_khattab: He ˹fully˺ knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them,

2:255.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيۡءٖ مِّنۡ عِلۡمِهِۦٓ إِلَّا بِمَا شَآءَۚ
2:255.en_khattab: but no one can grasp any of His knowledge— except what He wills ˹to reveal˺.
His Seat encompasses the heavens and the earth,
and the preservation of both does not tire Him.
For He is the Most High, the Greatest.

2:256.en_khattab: Let there be no compulsion in religion,
for the truth stands out clearly from falsehood.
So whoever renounces false gods and believes in Allah

2:256.qpc_hafs: فَقَدِ ٱسۡتَمۡسَكَ بِٱلۡعُرۡوَةِ ٱلۡوُثۡقَىٰ لَا ٱنفِصَامَ لَهَاۗ
2:256.en_khattab: has certainly grasped the firmest, unfailing hand-hold.

2:257.en_khattab: Allah is the Guardian of the believers—
He brings them out of darkness and into light.
who lead them out of light and into darkness.
It is they who will be the residents of the Fire.

2:258.qpc_hafs: أَلَمۡ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِي حَآجَّ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمَ فِي رَبِّهِۦٓ
2:258.en_khattab: Are you ˹O Prophet˺ not aware of the one who argued with Abraham about his Lord
because Allah had granted him kingship?

2:258.qpc_hafs: إِذۡ قَالَ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمُ رَبِّيَ ٱلَّذِي يُحۡيِۦ وَيُمِيتُ
2:258.en_khattab: ˹Remember˺ when Abraham said, “My Lord is the One Who has power to give life and cause death.”
He argued, “I too have the power to give life and cause death.”

2:258.qpc_hafs: قَالَ إِبۡرَٰهِـۧمُ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَأۡتِي بِٱلشَّمۡسِ مِنَ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ
2:258.en_khattab: Abraham challenged ˹him˺, “Allah causes the sun to rise from the east.
So make it rise from the west.
And so the disbeliever was dumbstruck.
And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

2:259.qpc_hafs: أَوۡ كَٱلَّذِي مَرَّ عَلَىٰ قَرۡيَةٖ وَهِيَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا
2:259.en_khattab: Or ˹are you not aware of˺ the one who passed by a city which was in ruins.

2:259.qpc_hafs: قَالَ أَنَّىٰ يُحۡيِۦ هَٰذِهِ ٱللَّهُ بَعۡدَ مَوۡتِهَاۖ
2:259.en_khattab: He wondered, “How could Allah bring this back to life after its destruction?”

2:259.qpc_hafs: فَأَمَاتَهُ ٱللَّهُ مِاْئَةَ عَامٖ ثُمَّ بَعَثَهُۥۖ
2:259.en_khattab: So Allah caused him to die for a hundred years then brought him back to life.

2:259.qpc_hafs: قَالَ كَمۡ لَبِثۡتَۖ قَالَ لَبِثۡتُ يَوۡمًا أَوۡ بَعۡضَ يَوۡمٖۖ قَالَ بَل لَّبِثۡتَ مِاْئَةَ عَامٖ
2:259.en_khattab: Allah asked, “How long have you remained ˹in this state˺?” He replied, “Perhaps a day or part of a day.” Allah said, “No! You have remained here for a hundred years!

2:259.qpc_hafs: فَٱنظُرۡ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِكَ وَشَرَابِكَ لَمۡ يَتَسَنَّهۡۖ وَٱنظُرۡ إِلَىٰ حِمَارِكَ وَلِنَجۡعَلَكَ ءَايَةٗ لِّلنَّاسِۖ
2:259.en_khattab: Just look at your food and drink— they have not spoiled. ˹But now˺ look at ˹the remains of˺ your donkey! And ˹so˺ We have made you into a sign for humanity.

2:259.qpc_hafs: وَٱنظُرۡ إِلَى ٱلۡعِظَامِ كَيۡفَ نُنشِزُهَا ثُمَّ نَكۡسُوهَا لَحۡمٗاۚ
2:259.en_khattab: And look at the bones ˹of the donkey˺, how We bring them together then clothe them with flesh!”

2:259.qpc_hafs: فَلَمَّا تَبَيَّنَ لَهُۥ قَالَ أَعۡلَمُ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ
2:259.en_khattab: When this was made clear to him, he declared, “˹Now˺ I know that Allah is Most Capable of everything.”

2:260.en_khattab: “My Lord! Show me how you give life to the dead.”
Abraham replied, “Yes I do, but just so my heart can be reassured.”

2:260.qpc_hafs: فَصُرۡهُنَّ إِلَيۡكَ ثُمَّ ٱجۡعَلۡ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ جَبَلٖ مِّنۡهُنَّ جُزۡءٗا
2:260.en_khattab: train them to come to you, ˹then cut them into pieces,˺ and scatter them on different hilltops.
Then call them back, they will fly to you in haste.
And ˹so you will˺ know that Allah is Almighty, All-Wise.

2:261.qpc_hafs: مَّثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمۡوَٰلَهُمۡ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ
2:261.en_khattab: The example of those who spend their wealth in the cause of Allah

2:261.qpc_hafs: كَمَثَلِ حَبَّةٍ أَنۢبَتَتۡ سَبۡعَ سَنَابِلَ فِي كُلِّ سُنۢبُلَةٖ مِّاْئَةُ حَبَّةٖۗ
2:261.en_khattab: is that of a grain that sprouts into seven ears, each bearing one hundred grains.
And Allah multiplies ˹the reward even more˺ to whoever He wills.

2:262.qpc_hafs: ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمۡوَٰلَهُمۡ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ
2:262.en_khattab: Those who spend their wealth in the cause of Allah

2:262.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ لَا يُتۡبِعُونَ مَآ أَنفَقُواْ مَنّٗا وَلَآ أَذٗى
2:262.en_khattab: and do not follow their charity with reminders of their generosity or hurtful words

2:262.qpc_hafs: لَّهُمۡ أَجۡرُهُمۡ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ وَلَا خَوۡفٌ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وَلَا هُمۡ يَحۡزَنُونَ
2:262.en_khattab: they will get their reward from their Lord, and there will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve.

2:263.qpc_hafs: قَوۡلٞ مَّعۡرُوفٞ وَمَغۡفِرَةٌ خَيۡرٞ مِّن صَدَقَةٖ يَتۡبَعُهَآ أَذٗىۗ
2:263.en_khattab: Kind words and forgiveness are better than charity followed by injury.
And Allah is Self-Sufficient, Most Forbearing.

2:264.en_khattab: Do not waste your charity with reminders ˹of your generosity˺ or hurtful words,

2:264.qpc_hafs: كَٱلَّذِي يُنفِقُ مَالَهُۥ رِئَآءَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَا يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡأٓخِرِۖ
2:264.en_khattab: like those who donate their wealth just to show off and do not believe in Allah or the Last Day.
Their example is that of a hard barren rock covered with a thin layer of soil
hit by a strong rain— leaving it just a bare stone.

2:264.qpc_hafs: لَّا يَقۡدِرُونَ عَلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ مِّمَّا كَسَبُواْۗ
2:264.en_khattab: Such people are unable to preserve the reward of their charity.
Allah does not guide ˹such˺ disbelieving people.

2:265.qpc_hafs: وَمَثَلُ ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمۡوَٰلَهُمُ ٱبۡتِغَآءَ مَرۡضَاتِ ٱللَّهِ
2:265.en_khattab: And the example of those who donate their wealth, seeking Allah’s pleasure
and believing the reward is certain,
is that of a garden on a fertile hill:
when heavy rain falls, it yields up twice its normal produce.
If no heavy rain falls, a drizzle is sufficient.
And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

2:266.qpc_hafs: أَن تَكُونَ لَهُۥ جَنَّةٞ مِّن نَّخِيلٖ وَأَعۡنَابٖ
2:266.en_khattab: to have a garden with palm trees, grapevines

2:266.qpc_hafs: تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ لَهُۥ فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ
2:266.en_khattab: and all kinds of fruits with rivers flowing underneath
and as they grow very old with dependent children,
a fiery whirlwind hits the garden, burning it all up?

2:266.qpc_hafs: كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمُ ٱلۡأٓيَٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَتَفَكَّرُونَ
2:266.en_khattab: This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you, so perhaps you will reflect.

2:267.en_khattab: Donate from the best of what you have earned
and of what We have produced for you from the earth.
Do not pick out worthless things for donation,

2:267.qpc_hafs: وَلَسۡتُم بِـَٔاخِذِيهِ إِلَّآ أَن تُغۡمِضُواْ فِيهِۚ
2:267.en_khattab: which you yourselves would only accept with closed eyes.
And know that Allah is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

2:268.en_khattab: The Devil threatens you with ˹the prospect of˺ poverty
and bids you to the shameful deed ˹of stinginess˺,
while Allah promises you forgiveness and ˹great˺ bounties from Him.

2:269.en_khattab: Allah grants wisdom to whoever He wills.

2:269.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يُؤۡتَ ٱلۡحِكۡمَةَ فَقَدۡ أُوتِيَ خَيۡرٗا كَثِيرٗاۗ
2:269.en_khattab: And whoever is granted wisdom is certainly blessed with a great privilege.
But none will be mindful ˹of this˺ except people of reason.

2:270.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أَنفَقۡتُم مِّن نَّفَقَةٍ أَوۡ نَذَرۡتُم مِّن نَّذۡرٖ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعۡلَمُهُۥۗ
2:270.en_khattab: Whatever charities you give or vows you make are surely known to Allah.
And the wrongdoers will have no helpers.

2:271.en_khattab: To give charity publicly is good,

2:271.qpc_hafs: وَإِن تُخۡفُوهَا وَتُؤۡتُوهَا ٱلۡفُقَرَآءَ فَهُوَ خَيۡرٞ لَّكُمۡۚ
2:271.en_khattab: but to give to the poor privately is better for you,

2:271.qpc_hafs: وَيُكَفِّرُ عَنكُم مِّن سَيِّـَٔاتِكُمۡۗ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ خَبِيرٞ
2:271.en_khattab: and will absolve you of your sins. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

2:272.qpc_hafs: لَّيۡسَ عَلَيۡكَ هُدَىٰهُمۡ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۗ
2:272.en_khattab: You are not responsible for people’s guidance ˹O Prophet˺—it is Allah Who guides whoever He wills.
Whatever you ˹believers˺ spend in charity, it is for your own good

2:272.qpc_hafs: وَمَا تُنفِقُونَ إِلَّا ٱبۡتِغَآءَ وَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِۚ
2:272.en_khattab: as long as you do so seeking the pleasure of Allah.

2:272.qpc_hafs: وَمَا تُنفِقُواْ مِنۡ خَيۡرٖ يُوَفَّ إِلَيۡكُمۡ وَأَنتُمۡ لَا تُظۡلَمُونَ
2:272.en_khattab: Whatever you donate will be paid back to you in full, and you will not be wronged.

2:273.qpc_hafs: لِلۡفُقَرَآءِ ٱلَّذِينَ أُحۡصِرُواْ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ
2:273.en_khattab: ˹Charity is˺ for the needy who are too engaged in the cause of Allah
to move about in the land ˹for work˺.
Those unfamiliar with their situation will think they are not in need ˹of charity˺
because they do not beg. You can recognize them by their appearance.
They do not beg people persistently.

2:273.qpc_hafs: وَمَا تُنفِقُواْ مِنۡ خَيۡرٖ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِهِۦ عَلِيمٌ
2:273.en_khattab: Whatever you give in charity is certainly well known to Allah.

2:274.qpc_hafs: ٱلَّذِينَ يُنفِقُونَ أَمۡوَٰلَهُم بِٱلَّيۡلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ سِرّٗا وَعَلَانِيَةٗ
2:274.en_khattab: Those who spend their wealth in charity day and night, secretly and openly
their reward is with their Lord
and there will be no fear for them

2:275.qpc_hafs: ٱلَّذِينَ يَأۡكُلُونَ ٱلرِّبَوٰاْ لَا يَقُومُونَ إِلَّا كَمَا يَقُومُ ٱلَّذِي يَتَخَبَّطُهُ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ مِنَ ٱلۡمَسِّۚ
2:275.en_khattab: Those who consume interest will stand ˹on Judgment Day˺ like those driven to madness by Satan’s touch

2:275.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمۡ قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّمَا ٱلۡبَيۡعُ مِثۡلُ ٱلرِّبَوٰاْۗ
2:275.en_khattab: That is because they say, “Trade is no different than interest”
But Allah has permitted trading and forbidden interest

2:275.qpc_hafs: فَمَن جَآءَهُۥ مَوۡعِظَةٞ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ فَٱنتَهَىٰ فَلَهُۥ مَا سَلَفَ وَأَمۡرُهُۥٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ
2:275.en_khattab: Whoever refrains— after having received warning from their Lord— may keep their previous gains, and their case is left to Allah

2:275.qpc_hafs: وَمَنۡ عَادَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِۖ هُمۡ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
2:275.en_khattab: As for those who persist, it is they who will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever

2:276.qpc_hafs: وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ أَثِيمٍ
2:276.en_khattab: And Allah does not like any ungrateful evildoer

2:277.en_khattab: Indeed, those who believe, do good
will receive their reward from their Lord
and there will be no fear for them

2:278.qpc_hafs: وَذَرُواْ مَا بَقِيَ مِنَ ٱلرِّبَوٰٓاْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
2:278.en_khattab: and give up outstanding interest if you are ˹true˺ believers

2:279.en_khattab: then beware of a war with Allah and His Messenger!

2:280.en_khattab: If it is difficult for someone
to repay a debt, postpone it until a time of ease.
And if you waive it as an act of charity, it will be better for you,

2:281.qpc_hafs: وَٱتَّقُواْ يَوۡمٗا تُرۡجَعُونَ فِيهِ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ
2:281.en_khattab: Be mindful of the Day when you will ˹all˺ be returned to Allah,

2:281.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ تُوَفَّىٰ كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ مَّا كَسَبَتۡ
2:281.en_khattab: then every soul will be paid in full for what it has done,

2:282.qpc_hafs: إِذَا تَدَايَنتُم بِدَيۡنٍ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٖ مُّسَمّٗى فَٱكۡتُبُوهُۚ
2:282.en_khattab: When you contract a loan for a fixed period of time, commit it to writing.
Let the scribe maintain justice between the parties.

2:282.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يَأۡبَ كَاتِبٌ أَن يَكۡتُبَ كَمَا عَلَّمَهُ ٱللَّهُۚ
2:282.en_khattab: The scribe should not refuse to write as Allah has taught them to write.

2:282.qpc_hafs: فَلۡيَكۡتُبۡ وَلۡيُمۡلِلِ ٱلَّذِي عَلَيۡهِ ٱلۡحَقُّ وَلۡيَتَّقِ ٱللَّهَ رَبَّهُۥ وَلَا يَبۡخَسۡ مِنۡهُ شَيۡـٔٗاۚ
2:282.en_khattab: They will write what the debtor dictates, bearing Allah in mind and not defrauding the debt.

2:282.qpc_hafs: فَإِن كَانَ ٱلَّذِي عَلَيۡهِ ٱلۡحَقُّ سَفِيهًا أَوۡ ضَعِيفًا أَوۡ لَا يَسۡتَطِيعُ أَن يُمِلَّ هُوَ فَلۡيُمۡلِلۡ وَلِيُّهُۥ بِٱلۡعَدۡلِۚ
2:282.en_khattab: If the debtor is incompetent, weak, or unable to dictate, let their guardian dictate for them with justice.
Call upon two of your men to witness.

2:282.qpc_hafs: فَإِن لَّمۡ يَكُونَا رَجُلَيۡنِ فَرَجُلٞ وَٱمۡرَأَتَانِ مِمَّن تَرۡضَوۡنَ مِنَ ٱلشُّهَدَآءِ
2:282.en_khattab: If two men cannot be found, then one man and two women of your choice will witness.

2:282.qpc_hafs: أَن تَضِلَّ إِحۡدَىٰهُمَا فَتُذَكِّرَ إِحۡدَىٰهُمَا ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰۚ
2:282.en_khattab: so if one of the women forgets the other may remind her.

2:282.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يَأۡبَ ٱلشُّهَدَآءُ إِذَا مَا دُعُواْۚ
2:282.en_khattab: The witnesses must not refuse when they are summoned.

2:282.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَسۡـَٔمُوٓاْ أَن تَكۡتُبُوهُ صَغِيرًا أَوۡ كَبِيرًا إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلِهِۦۚ
2:282.en_khattab: You must not be against writing ˹contracts˺ for a fixed period— whether the sum is small or great.

2:282.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكُمۡ أَقۡسَطُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَأَقۡوَمُ لِلشَّهَٰدَةِ وَأَدۡنَىٰٓ أَلَّا تَرۡتَابُوٓاْ
2:282.en_khattab: This is more just ˹for you˺ in the sight of Allah, and more convenient to establish evidence and remove doubts.

2:282.qpc_hafs: إِلَّآ أَن تَكُونَ تِجَٰرَةً حَاضِرَةٗ تُدِيرُونَهَا بَيۡنَكُمۡ فَلَيۡسَ عَلَيۡكُمۡ جُنَاحٌ أَلَّا تَكۡتُبُوهَاۗ
2:282.en_khattab: However, if you conduct an immediate transaction among yourselves, then there is no need for you to record it,
but call upon witnesses when a deal is finalized.
Let no harm come to the scribe or witnesses.
If you do, then you have gravely exceeded ˹your limits˺.
Be mindful of Allah, for Allah ˹is the One Who˺ teaches you.
And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of all things.

2:283.en_khattab: If you are on a journey
and a scribe cannot be found, then a security can be taken.
then ˹there is no need for a security, but˺ the debtor should honour this trust ˹by repaying the
debt˺—and let them fear Allah, their Lord.
And do not conceal the testimony,
for whoever conceals it, their hearts are indeed sinful.
And Allah ˹fully˺ knows what you do.

2:284.qpc_hafs: لِّلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۗ
2:284.en_khattab: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.

2:284.qpc_hafs: وَإِن تُبۡدُواْ مَا فِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡ أَوۡ تُخۡفُوهُ
2:284.en_khattab: Whether you reveal what is in your hearts or conceal it,
Allah will call you to account for it.

2:284.qpc_hafs: فَيَغۡفِرُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيُعَذِّبُ مَن يَشَآءُۗ
2:284.en_khattab: He forgives whoever He wills, and punishes whoever He wills.
And Allah is Most Capable of everything.

2:285.qpc_hafs: ءَامَنَ ٱلرَّسُولُ بِمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيۡهِ مِن رَّبِّهِۦ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَۚ
2:285.en_khattab: The Messenger ˹firmly˺ believes in what has been revealed to him from his Lord, and so do the believers.

2:285.qpc_hafs: كُلٌّ ءَامَنَ بِٱللَّهِ وَمَلَٰٓئِكَتِهِۦ وَكُتُبِهِۦ وَرُسُلِهِۦ
2:285.en_khattab: They ˹all˺ believe in Allah, His angels, His Books, and His messengers.

2:285.qpc_hafs: لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَيۡنَ أَحَدٖ مِّن رُّسُلِهِۦۚ
2:285.en_khattab: ˹They proclaim,˺ “We make no distinction between any of His messengers.
And they say, “We hear and obey.
˹We seek˺ Your forgiveness, our Lord! And to You ˹alone˺ is the final return.

2:286.qpc_hafs: لَا يُكَلِّفُ ٱللَّهُ نَفۡسًا إِلَّا وُسۡعَهَاۚ
2:286.en_khattab: Allah does not require of any soul more than what it can afford.

2:286.qpc_hafs: لَهَا مَا كَسَبَتۡ وَعَلَيۡهَا مَا ٱكۡتَسَبَتۡۗ
2:286.en_khattab: All good will be for its own benefit, and all evil will be to its own loss.

2:286.qpc_hafs: رَبَّنَا لَا تُؤَاخِذۡنَآ إِن نَّسِينَآ أَوۡ أَخۡطَأۡنَاۚ
2:286.en_khattab: ˹The believers pray,˺ “Our Lord! Do not punish us if we forget or make a mistake.

2:286.qpc_hafs: رَبَّنَا وَلَا تَحۡمِلۡ عَلَيۡنَآ إِصۡرٗا كَمَا حَمَلۡتَهُۥ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِنَاۚ
2:286.en_khattab: Our Lord! Do not place a burden on us like the one you placed on those before us.

2:286.qpc_hafs: رَبَّنَا وَلَا تُحَمِّلۡنَا مَا لَا طَاقَةَ لَنَا بِهِۦۖ
2:286.en_khattab: Our Lord! Do not burden us with what we cannot bear.
Pardon us, forgive us, and have mercy on us.

2:286.qpc_hafs: أَنتَ مَوۡلَىٰنَا فَٱنصُرۡنَا عَلَى ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
2:286.en_khattab: You are our ˹only˺ Guardian. So grant us victory over the disbelieving people.

3:2.en_khattab: There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him

3:3.en_khattab: He has revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ the Book

3:4.en_khattab: previously, as a guide for people
and ˹also˺ revealed the Standard ˹to distinguish between right and wrong˺

3:4.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ لَهُمۡ عَذَابٞ شَدِيدٞۗ
3:4.en_khattab: Surely those who reject Allah’s revelations will suffer a severe torment
For Allah is Almighty, capable of punishment

3:5.en_khattab: or in the heavens is hidden from
on earth or in the heavens

3:6.en_khattab: He is the One Who shapes you in the wombs
of your mothers as He wills.

3:6.qpc_hafs: لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ
3:6.en_khattab: There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him— the Almighty, All-Wise.

3:7.en_khattab: He is the One Who has revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ the Book,
of which some verses are precise— they are the foundation of the Book—
Those with deviant hearts follow the elusive verses
seeking ˹to spread˺ doubt through their ˹false˺ interpretations—

3:7.qpc_hafs: فَيَتَّبِعُونَ مَا تَشَٰبَهَ مِنۡهُ ٱبۡتِغَآءَ ٱلۡفِتۡنَةِ
3:7.en_khattab: but none grasps their ˹full˺ meaning except Allah.

3:7.qpc_hafs: وَٱبۡتِغَآءَ تَأۡوِيلِهِۦۖ وَمَا يَعۡلَمُ تَأۡوِيلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُۗ
3:7.en_khattab: As for those well-grounded in knowledge, they say, “We believe in this
˹Quran˺—it is all from our Lord.” But none will be mindful ˹of this˺

3:8.qpc_hafs: رَبَّنَا لَا تُزِغۡ قُلُوبَنَا بَعۡدَ إِذۡ هَدَيۡتَنَا
3:8.en_khattab: ˹They say,˺ “Our Lord! Do not let our hearts deviate after you have guided us.
You are indeed the Giver ˹of all bounties˺.

3:9.qpc_hafs: إِنَّكَ جَامِعُ ٱلنَّاسِ لِيَوۡمٖ لَّا رَيۡبَ فِيهِۚ
3:9.en_khattab: You will certainly gather all humanity for the promised Day— about which there is no doubt.
Surely Allah does not break His promise.

3:10.qpc_hafs: لَن تُغۡنِيَ عَنۡهُمۡ أَمۡوَٰلُهُمۡ وَلَآ أَوۡلَٰدُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيۡـٔٗاۖ
3:10.en_khattab: children of the disbelievers will be of any benefit to them against Allah—
and they will be the fuel for the Fire.

3:11.qpc_hafs: كَدَأۡبِ ءَالِ فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡۚ
3:11.en_khattab: Their fate will be like that of the people of Pharaoh and those before them—
they all rejected Our signs, so Allah seized them for their sins.
And Allah is severe in punishment.

3:12.en_khattab: “Soon you will be overpowered and driven
what an evil place to rest!”

3:13.en_khattab: Indeed, there was a sign for you
in the two armies that met in battle
one fighting for the cause of Allah
The believers saw their enemy twice their number
But Allah supports with His victory whoever He wills

3:13.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبۡرَةٗ لِّأُوْلِي ٱلۡأَبۡصَٰرِ
3:13.en_khattab: Surely in this is a lesson for people of insight

3:14.en_khattab: women, children, treasures of gold and silver,
made appealing to people. These are the pleasures of this worldly life,
but with Allah is the finest destination.

3:15.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Shall I inform you of what is better than ˹all of˺ this?

3:15.qpc_hafs: لِلَّذِينَ ٱتَّقَوۡاْ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّٰتٞ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ
3:15.en_khattab: Those mindful ˹of Allah˺ will have Gardens with their Lord under which rivers flow,

3:15.qpc_hafs: خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَا وَأَزۡوَٰجٞ مُّطَهَّرَةٞ وَرِضۡوَٰنٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِۗ
3:15.en_khattab: to stay there forever, and pure spouses, along with Allah’s pleasure.”
And Allah is All-Seeing of ˹His˺ servants,

3:16.en_khattab: and protect us from the torment of the Fire.

3:17.en_khattab: ˹It is they˺ who are patient, sincere, obedient, and charitable
and who pray for forgiveness before dawn.

3:18.en_khattab: that there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him
and so are the angels and people of knowledge
He is the Maintainer of justice

3:18.qpc_hafs: لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ
3:18.en_khattab: There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him— the Almighty, All-Wise

3:19.en_khattab: Certainly, Allah’s only Way is Islam.

3:19.qpc_hafs: وَمَا ٱخۡتَلَفَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلۡعِلۡمُ بَغۡيَۢا بَيۡنَهُمۡۗ
3:19.en_khattab: Those who were given the Scripture did not dispute ˹among themselves˺ out of mutual envy until knowledge came to them.

3:19.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يَكۡفُرۡ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَرِيعُ ٱلۡحِسَابِ
3:19.en_khattab: Whoever denies Allah’s signs, then surely Allah is swift in reckoning.

3:20.en_khattab: So if they argue with you ˹O Prophet˺,
say, “I have submitted myself to Allah

3:20.qpc_hafs: وَقُل لِّلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡأُمِّيِّـۧنَ ءَأَسۡلَمۡتُمۡۚ
3:20.en_khattab: And ask those who were given the Scripture and the illiterate ˹people˺,
If they submit, they will be ˹rightly˺ guided.
then your duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺.
And Allah is All-Seeing of ˹His˺ servants.

3:21.en_khattab: Indeed, those who deny Allah’s signs,

3:21.qpc_hafs: وَيَقۡتُلُونَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَأۡمُرُونَ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِ مِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ
3:21.en_khattab: and kill people who stand up for justice—
give them good news of a painful punishment.

3:22.en_khattab: They are the ones whose deeds are wasted
in this world and the Hereafter
And they will have no helpers.

3:23.en_khattab: who were given a portion of the Scriptures?
Yet when they are invited to the Book of Allah

3:23.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّىٰ فَرِيقٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ وَهُم مُّعۡرِضُونَ
3:23.en_khattab: some of them turn away heedlessly.

3:24.qpc_hafs: لَن تَمَسَّنَا ٱلنَّارُ إِلَّآ أَيَّامٗا مَّعۡدُودَٰتٖۖ
3:24.en_khattab: The Fire will not touch us except for a few days.
They have been deceived in their faith

3:25.en_khattab: But how ˹horrible˺ will it be when We gather them together
on the Day about which there is no doubt
when every soul will be paid in full for what it has done

3:26.qpc_hafs: تُؤۡتِي ٱلۡمُلۡكَ مَن تَشَآءُ وَتَنزِعُ ٱلۡمُلۡكَ مِمَّن تَشَآءُ وَتُعِزُّ مَن تَشَآءُ وَتُذِلُّ مَن تَشَآءُۖ
3:26.en_khattab: You give authority to whoever You please and remove it from who You please; You honour whoever You please and disgrace who You please

3:26.qpc_hafs: بِيَدِكَ ٱلۡخَيۡرُۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ
3:26.en_khattab: —all good is in Your Hands. Surely You ˹alone˺ are Most Capable of everything.

3:27.en_khattab: You cause the night to pass into the day
and the day into the night
You bring forth the living from the dead
and the dead from the living
And You provide for whoever You will without limit

3:28.qpc_hafs: لَّا يَتَّخِذِ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ أَوۡلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَۖ
3:28.en_khattab: Believers should not take disbelievers as guardians instead of the believers—

3:28.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يَفۡعَلۡ ذَٰلِكَ فَلَيۡسَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ فِي شَيۡءٍ إِلَّآ أَن تَتَّقُواْ مِنۡهُمۡ تُقَىٰةٗۗ
3:28.en_khattab: and whoever does so will have nothing to hope for from Allah— unless it is a precaution against their tyranny.
And Allah warns you about Himself.
And to Allah is the final return.

3:29.qpc_hafs: إِن تُخۡفُواْ مَا فِي صُدُورِكُمۡ أَوۡ تُبۡدُوهُ
3:29.en_khattab: Whether you conceal what is in your hearts or reveal it,

3:29.qpc_hafs: وَيَعۡلَمُ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۗ
3:29.en_khattab: For He knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.
And Allah is Most Capable of everything.

3:30.en_khattab: ˹Watch for˺ the Day when every soul will
be presented with whatever good it has done.
And it will wish that its misdeeds were

3:30.qpc_hafs: تَوَدُّ لَوۡ أَنَّ بَيۡنَهَا وَبَيۡنَهُۥٓ أَمَدَۢا بَعِيدٗاۗ

3:30.en_khattab: And Allah warns you about Himself.
And Allah is Ever Gracious to ˹His˺ servants.

3:31.en_khattab: For Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.”

3:32.qpc_hafs: فَإِن تَوَلَّوۡاْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
3:32.en_khattab: If they still turn away, then truly Allah does not like the disbelievers.

3:34.en_khattab: They are descendants of one another.

3:35.qpc_hafs: رَبِّ إِنِّي نَذَرۡتُ لَكَ مَا فِي بَطۡنِي مُحَرَّرٗا
3:35.en_khattab: “My Lord! I dedicate what is in my womb entirely to Your service,
You ˹alone˺ are truly the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

3:36.qpc_hafs: قَالَتۡ رَبِّ إِنِّي وَضَعۡتُهَآ أُنثَىٰ وَٱللَّهُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا وَضَعَتۡ وَلَيۡسَ ٱلذَّكَرُ كَٱلۡأُنثَىٰۖ
3:36.en_khattab: she said, “My Lord! I have given birth to a girl,”—and Allah fully knew what she had delivered—“and the male is not like the female.

3:36.qpc_hafs: وَإِنِّي سَمَّيۡتُهَا مَرۡيَمَ وَإِنِّيٓ أُعِيذُهَا بِكَ وَذُرِّيَّتَهَا مِنَ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنِ ٱلرَّجِيمِ
3:36.en_khattab: I have named her Mary, and I seek Your protection for her and her offspring from Satan, the accursed.

3:37.en_khattab: So her Lord accepted her graciously
and blessed her with a pleasant upbringing
entrusting her to the care of Zachariah
Whenever Zachariah visited her in the sanctuary
he found her supplied with provisions
He exclaimed, “O Mary! Where did this come from?”

3:37.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَرۡزُقُ مَن يَشَآءُ بِغَيۡرِ حِسَابٍ
3:37.en_khattab: Surely Allah provides for whoever He wills without limit.

3:38.en_khattab: Then and there Zachariah prayed to his Lord,

3:38.qpc_hafs: قَالَ رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي مِن لَّدُنكَ ذُرِّيَّةٗ طَيِّبَةًۖ
3:38.en_khattab: saying, “My Lord! Grant me— by your grace— righteous offspring.
You are certainly the Hearer of ˹all˺ prayers.

3:39.en_khattab: So the angels called out to him
while he stood praying in the sanctuary
Allah gives you good news of ˹the birth of˺ John
who will confirm the Word of Allah
and will be a great leader, chaste, and a prophet among the righteous.

3:40.en_khattab: “My Lord! How can I have a son
when I am very old and my wife is barren?”
“So will it be. Allah does what He wills.”

3:41.en_khattab: Zachariah said, “My Lord! Grant me a sign.”

3:41.qpc_hafs: قَالَ ءَايَتُكَ أَلَّا تُكَلِّمَ ٱلنَّاسَ ثَلَٰثَةَ أَيَّامٍ إِلَّا رَمۡزٗاۗ
3:41.en_khattab: He said, “Your sign is that you will not ˹be able to˺ speak to people for three days except through gestures.

3:42.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱصۡطَفَىٰكِ وَطَهَّرَكِ وَٱصۡطَفَىٰكِ عَلَىٰ نِسَآءِ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
3:42.en_khattab: Surely Allah has selected you, purified you, and chosen you over all women of the world.

3:43.en_khattab: along with those who bow down

3:44.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ مِنۡ أَنۢبَآءِ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ نُوحِيهِ إِلَيۡكَۚ
3:44.en_khattab: This is news of the unseen that We reveal to you ˹O Prophet˺.

3:44.qpc_hafs: وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيۡهِمۡ إِذۡ يُلۡقُونَ أَقۡلَٰمَهُمۡ
3:44.en_khattab: You were not with them when they cast lots to decide...
nor were you there when they argued ˹about it˺.

3:45.qpc_hafs: يَٰمَرۡيَمُ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُبَشِّرُكِ بِكَلِمَةٖ مِّنۡهُ
3:45.en_khattab: “O Mary! Allah gives you good news of a Word from Him,
his name will be the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary;
honoured in this world and the Hereafter,
and he will be one of those nearest ˹to Allah˺.

3:46.en_khattab: And he will speak to people
and will be one of the righteous.

3:47.en_khattab: “My Lord! How can I have a child
when no man has ever touched me?”

3:47.qpc_hafs: قَالَ كَذَٰلِكِ ٱللَّهُ يَخۡلُقُ مَا يَشَآءُۚ
3:47.en_khattab: An angel replied, “So will it be. Allah creates what He wills.
He simply tells it, ‘Be!’ And it is!

3:48.en_khattab: And Allah will teach him writing

3:49.en_khattab: and ˹make him˺ a messenger to the Children of Israel ˹to proclaim,˺

3:49.qpc_hafs: أَنِّي قَدۡ جِئۡتُكُم بِـَٔايَةٖ مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡ
3:49.en_khattab: ‘I have come to you with a sign from your Lord

3:49.qpc_hafs: أَنِّيٓ أَخۡلُقُ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلطِّينِ كَهَيۡـَٔةِ ٱلطَّيۡرِ
3:49.en_khattab: I will make for you a bird from clay

3:49.qpc_hafs: فَأَنفُخُ فِيهِ فَيَكُونُ طَيۡرَۢا بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِۖ
3:49.en_khattab: breathe into it, and it will become a ˹real˺ bird— by Allah’s Will
I will heal the blind and the leper and raise the dead to life
And I will prophesize what you eat
Surely in this is a sign for you

3:50.qpc_hafs: وَمُصَدِّقٗا لِّمَا بَيۡنَ يَدَيَّ مِنَ ٱلتَّوۡرَىٰةِ
3:50.en_khattab: And I will confirm the Torah revealed before me

3:50.qpc_hafs: وَلِأُحِلَّ لَكُم بَعۡضَ ٱلَّذِي حُرِّمَ عَلَيۡكُمۡۚ
3:50.en_khattab: and legalize some of what had been forbidden to you
I have come to you with a sign from your Lord
so be mindful of Allah and obey me

3:51.en_khattab: Surely Allah is my Lord and your Lord.

3:52.en_khattab: When Jesus sensed disbelief from his people
he asked, “Who will stand up with me for Allah?”
The disciples replied, “We will stand up for Allah.
We believe in Allah, so bear witness that we have submitted.”

3:53.en_khattab: ˹They prayed to Allah,˺ “Our Lord! We believe in Your revelations
so count us among those who bear witness.”

3:54.en_khattab: And the disbelievers made a plan ˹against Jesus˺,
and Allah is the best of planners

3:55.qpc_hafs: إِنِّي مُتَوَفِّيكَ وَرَافِعُكَ إِلَيَّ وَمُطَهِّرُكَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ
3:55.en_khattab: I will take you and raise you up to Myself. I will deliver you from those who disbelieve,

3:55.qpc_hafs: وَجَاعِلُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوكَ فَوۡقَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِۖ
3:55.en_khattab: and elevate your followers above the disbelievers until the Day of Judgment.

3:55.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ إِلَيَّ مَرۡجِعُكُمۡ فَأَحۡكُمُ بَيۡنَكُمۡ فِيمَا كُنتُمۡ فِيهِ تَخۡتَلِفُونَ
3:55.en_khattab: Then to Me you will ˹all˺ return, and I will settle all your disputes.

3:56.qpc_hafs: فَأُعَذِّبُهُمۡ عَذَابٗا شَدِيدٗا فِي ٱلدُّنۡيَا وَٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ
3:56.en_khattab: I will subject them to a severe punishment in this life and the Hereafter,
and they will have no helpers.

3:57.en_khattab: And as for those who believe and do good
they will be rewarded in full
And Allah does not like the wrongdoers

3:58.en_khattab: this to you ˹O Prophet˺ as one of the signs

3:59.en_khattab: Indeed, the example of Jesus in the sight of Allah
then said to him, “Be!” And he was!

3:60.en_khattab: This is the truth from your Lord,
so do not be one of those who doubt.

3:61.en_khattab: Now, whoever disputes with you ˹O Prophet˺

3:61.qpc_hafs: مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِ
3:61.en_khattab: concerning Jesus after full knowledge has come to you

3:61.qpc_hafs: تَعَالَوۡاْ نَدۡعُ أَبۡنَآءَنَا وَأَبۡنَآءَكُمۡ وَنِسَآءَنَا وَنِسَآءَكُمۡ وَأَنفُسَنَا وَأَنفُسَكُمۡ
3:61.en_khattab: “Come! Let us gather our children and your children, our women and your women, ourselves and yourselves

3:61.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ نَبۡتَهِلۡ فَنَجۡعَل لَّعۡنَتَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ
3:61.en_khattab: —then let us sincerely invoke Allah’s curse upon the liars.

3:62.en_khattab: Certainly, this is the true narrative,
and there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Allah.
And indeed, Allah ˹alone˺ is the Almighty, All-Wise.

3:63.en_khattab: then surely Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of the corruptors.

3:64.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O People of the Book!

3:64.qpc_hafs: تَعَالَوۡاْ إِلَىٰ كَلِمَةٖ سَوَآءِۭ بَيۡنَنَا وَبَيۡنَكُمۡ
3:64.en_khattab: Let us come to common terms:
that we will worship none but Allah,

3:64.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يَتَّخِذَ بَعۡضُنَا بَعۡضًا أَرۡبَابٗا مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِۚ
3:64.en_khattab: nor take one another as lords instead of Allah.”
then say, “Bear witness that we have submitted ˹to Allah alone˺.”

3:65.en_khattab: Why do you argue about Abraham,

3:65.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أُنزِلَتِ ٱلتَّوۡرَىٰةُ وَٱلۡإِنجِيلُ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِۦٓۚ
3:65.en_khattab: while the Torah and the Gospel were not revealed until long after him?

3:66.qpc_hafs: هَٰٓأَنتُمۡ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ حَٰجَجۡتُمۡ فِيمَا لَكُم بِهِۦ عِلۡمٞ
3:66.en_khattab: Here you are! You disputed about what you have ˹little˺ knowledge of

3:66.qpc_hafs: فَلِمَ تُحَآجُّونَ فِيمَا لَيۡسَ لَكُم بِهِۦ عِلۡمٞۚ
3:66.en_khattab: but why do you now argue about what you have no knowledge of?
Allah knows and you do not know.

3:68.en_khattab: Indeed, those who have the best claim to Abraham
And Allah is the Guardian of those who believe.

3:69.en_khattab: Some of the People of the Book wish
yet they fail to perceive it.

3:70.en_khattab: Why do you reject the signs of Allah
while you bear witness ˹to their truth˺

3:71.en_khattab: Why do you mix the truth with falsehood

3:72.en_khattab: A group among the People of the Book said ˹to one another˺,

3:72.qpc_hafs: ءَامِنُواْ بِٱلَّذِيٓ أُنزِلَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَجۡهَ ٱلنَّهَارِ
3:72.en_khattab: Believe in what has been revealed to the believers in the morning
and reject it in the evening
so they may abandon their faith.

3:73.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تُؤۡمِنُوٓاْ إِلَّا لِمَن تَبِعَ دِينَكُمۡ
3:73.en_khattab: And only believe those who follow your religion.”
Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Surely, ˹the only˺ true guidance is Allah’s guidance.” ˹They also said,˺

3:73.qpc_hafs: أَن يُؤۡتَىٰٓ أَحَدٞ مِّثۡلَ مَآ أُوتِيتُمۡ
3:73.en_khattab: “Do not believe that someone will receive ˹revealed˺ knowledge similar to yours
or argue against you before your Lord.”
Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Indeed, all bounty is in the Hands of Allah—
He grants it to whoever He wills.

3:74.en_khattab: He chooses whoever He wills to receive His mercy.
And Allah is the Lord of infinite bounty.

3:75.qpc_hafs: وَمِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ مَنۡ إِن تَأۡمَنۡهُ بِقِنطَارٖ يُؤَدِّهِۦٓ إِلَيۡكَ
3:75.en_khattab: There are some among the People of the Book who, if entrusted with a stack of gold, will readily return it.

3:75.qpc_hafs: وَمِنۡهُم مَّنۡ إِن تَأۡمَنۡهُ بِدِينَارٖ لَّا يُؤَدِّهِۦٓ إِلَيۡكَ إِلَّا مَا دُمۡتَ عَلَيۡهِ قَآئِمٗاۗ
3:75.en_khattab: Yet there are others who, if entrusted with a single coin, will not repay it unless you constantly demand it.

3:75.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمۡ قَالُواْ لَيۡسَ عَلَيۡنَا فِي ٱلۡأُمِّيِّـۧنَ سَبِيلٞ
3:75.en_khattab: This is because they say, “We are not accountable for ˹exploiting˺ the Gentiles.”

3:75.qpc_hafs: وَيَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡكَذِبَ وَهُمۡ يَعۡلَمُونَ
3:75.en_khattab: And ˹so˺ they attribute lies to Allah knowingly.

3:76.en_khattab: Those who honour their trusts and shun evil—
surely Allah loves those who are mindful ˹of Him˺.

3:77.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَشۡتَرُونَ بِعَهۡدِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَيۡمَٰنِهِمۡ ثَمَنٗا قَلِيلًا
3:77.en_khattab: Indeed, those who trade Allah’s covenant and their oaths for a fleeting gain

3:77.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ لَا خَلَٰقَ لَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ
3:77.en_khattab: will have no share in the Hereafter.

3:77.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يُكَلِّمُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ وَلَا يَنظُرُ إِلَيۡهِمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ
3:77.en_khattab: Allah will neither speak to them, nor look at them,
the Day of Judgment. And they will suffer a painful punishment.

3:78.en_khattab: who distort the Book with their tongues
to make you think this ˹distortion˺ is from the Book—
but it is not what the Book says.
Allah”—but it is not from Allah.
And ˹so˺ they attribute lies to Allah

3:79.qpc_hafs: مَا كَانَ لِبَشَرٍ أَن يُؤۡتِيَهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡحُكۡمَ وَٱلنُّبُوَّةَ
3:79.en_khattab: It is not appropriate for someone who Allah has blessed with the Scripture, wisdom, and prophethood

3:79.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ يَقُولَ لِلنَّاسِ كُونُواْ عِبَادٗا لِّي مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ
3:79.en_khattab: to say to people, “Worship me instead of Allah.”

3:79.qpc_hafs: وَلَٰكِن كُونُواْ رَبَّٰنِيِّـۧنَ بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تُعَلِّمُونَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَبِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَدۡرُسُونَ
3:79.en_khattab: Rather, he would say, “Be devoted to the worship of your Lord ˹alone˺”—in accordance with what these prophets read in the Scripture and what they taught.

3:80.en_khattab: And he would never ask you
to take angels and prophets as lords

3:80.qpc_hafs: أَيَأۡمُرُكُم بِٱلۡكُفۡرِ بَعۡدَ إِذۡ أَنتُم مُّسۡلِمُونَ
3:80.en_khattab: Would he ask you to disbelieve after you have submitted?

3:81.en_khattab: ˹Remember˺ when Allah made a covenant with the prophets, ˹saying,˺
Now that I have given you the Book and wisdom,

3:81.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ جَآءَكُمۡ رَسُولٞ مُّصَدِّقٞ لِّمَا مَعَكُمۡ
3:81.en_khattab: if there comes to you a messenger confirming what you have,
you must believe in him and support him.

3:81.qpc_hafs: قَالَ فَٱشۡهَدُواْ وَأَنَا۠ مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّٰهِدِينَ
3:81.en_khattab: Allah said, “Then bear witness, and I too am a Witness.”

3:83.en_khattab: Do they desire a way other than Allah’s

3:83.qpc_hafs: وَلَهُۥٓ أَسۡلَمَ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ
3:83.en_khattab: knowing that all those in the heavens and the earth submit to His Will
and to Him they will ˹all˺ be returned

3:84.qpc_hafs: ءَامَنَّا بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيۡنَا وَمَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَىٰٓ
3:84.en_khattab: We believe in Allah and what has been revealed to us
and what was revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and his descendants;

3:84.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أُوتِيَ مُوسَىٰ وَعِيسَىٰ وَٱلنَّبِيُّونَ مِن رَّبِّهِمۡ
3:84.en_khattab: and what was given to Moses, Jesus, and other prophets from their Lord

3:84.qpc_hafs: لَا نُفَرِّقُ بَيۡنَ أَحَدٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ وَنَحۡنُ لَهُۥ مُسۡلِمُونَ
3:84.en_khattab: we make no distinction between any of them, and to Him we ˹fully˺ submit.

3:85.en_khattab: Whoever seeks a way other than Islam
it will never be accepted from them
and in the Hereafter they will be among the losers

3:86.en_khattab: How will Allah guide a people

3:86.qpc_hafs: كَفَرُواْ بَعۡدَ إِيمَٰنِهِمۡ وَشَهِدُوٓاْ أَنَّ ٱلرَّسُولَ حَقّٞ
3:86.en_khattab: who chose to disbelieve after they had believed, acknowledged the Messenger to be true,
For Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

3:87.qpc_hafs: أَنَّ عَلَيۡهِمۡ لَعۡنَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ أَجۡمَعِينَ
3:87.en_khattab: that they will be condemned by Allah, the angels, and all of humanity

3:88.en_khattab: Hell forever. Their punishment will not be lightened,

3:89.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ تَابُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ ذَٰلِكَ
3:89.en_khattab: As for those who repent afterwards
then surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

3:90.en_khattab: Indeed, those who disbelieve after having believed
their repentance will never be accepted
It is they who are astray.

3:91.en_khattab: Indeed, if each of those who disbelieve
were to offer a ransom of enough
gold to fill the whole world,
it would never be accepted from them.
It is they who will suffer a painful punishment,
and they will have no helpers.

3:92.en_khattab: until you donate some of what you cherish.
is certainly well known to Allah.

3:93.qpc_hafs: كُلُّ ٱلطَّعَامِ كَانَ حِلّٗا لِّبَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
3:93.en_khattab: All food was lawful for the children of Israel,

3:93.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا مَا حَرَّمَ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلُ عَلَىٰ نَفۡسِهِۦ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن تُنَزَّلَ ٱلتَّوۡرَىٰةُۚ
3:93.en_khattab: except what Israel made unlawful for himself before the Torah was revealed.

3:93.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ فَأۡتُواْ بِٱلتَّوۡرَىٰةِ فَٱتۡلُوهَآ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ
3:93.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Bring the Torah and read it, if your claims are true.

3:95.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah has declared the truth.
So follow the Way of Abraham, the upright

3:96.en_khattab: is the one at Bakkah— a blessed sanctuary

3:97.en_khattab: Whoever enters it should be safe

3:97.qpc_hafs: وَلِلَّهِ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ حِجُّ ٱلۡبَيۡتِ مَنِ ٱسۡتَطَاعَ إِلَيۡهِ سَبِيلٗاۚ
3:97.en_khattab: Pilgrimage to this House is an obligation by Allah upon whoever is able among the people

3:97.qpc_hafs: وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَنِيٌّ عَنِ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
3:97.en_khattab: And whoever disbelieves, then surely Allah is not in need of ˹any of His˺ creation

3:98.en_khattab: Why do you deny the revelations of Allah,
when Allah is a Witness to what you do?

3:99.qpc_hafs: لِمَ تَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ مَنۡ ءَامَنَ
3:99.en_khattab: Why do you turn the believers away from the Way of Allah—
striving to make it ˹appear˺ crooked, while you are witnesses ˹to its truth˺?
And Allah is never unaware of what you do.

3:100.qpc_hafs: إِن تُطِيعُواْ فَرِيقٗا مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ
3:100.en_khattab: If you were to yield to a group of those who were given the Scripture,
they would turn you back from belief to disbelief.

3:101.en_khattab: when Allah’s revelations are recited to you
and His Messenger is in your midst

3:101.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يَعۡتَصِم بِٱللَّهِ فَقَدۡ هُدِيَ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطٖ مُّسۡتَقِيمٖ
3:101.en_khattab: Whoever holds firmly to Allah is surely guided to the Straight Path

3:102.en_khattab: Be mindful of Allah in the way He deserves,
and do not die except in ˹a state of full˺ submission ˹to Him˺.

3:103.en_khattab: And hold firmly to the rope of Allah

3:103.qpc_hafs: وَٱذۡكُرُواْ نِعۡمَتَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيۡكُمۡ إِذۡ كُنتُمۡ أَعۡدَآءٗ
3:103.en_khattab: Remember Allah’s favour upon you when you were enemies

3:103.qpc_hafs: فَأَلَّفَ بَيۡنَ قُلُوبِكُمۡ فَأَصۡبَحۡتُم بِنِعۡمَتِهِۦٓ إِخۡوَٰنٗا
3:103.en_khattab: then He united your hearts, so you— by His grace— became brothers

3:103.qpc_hafs: وَكُنتُمۡ عَلَىٰ شَفَا حُفۡرَةٖ مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ فَأَنقَذَكُم مِّنۡهَاۗ
3:103.en_khattab: And you were at the brink of a fiery pit and He saved you from it
This is how Allah makes His revelations clear to you
so that you may be ˹rightly˺ guided

3:104.en_khattab: Let there be a group among you who call
˹others˺ to goodness, encourage what is good,
it is they who will be successful.

3:105.en_khattab: And do not be like those who split

3:105.qpc_hafs: وَٱخۡتَلَفُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتُۚ
3:105.en_khattab: ˹into sects˺ and differed after clear proofs had come to them.
It is they who will suffer a tremendous punishment.

3:106.en_khattab: On that Day some faces will be bright
it will be said, “Did you disbelieve after having believed?
So taste the punishment for your disbelief.

3:107.en_khattab: they will be in Allah’s mercy,

3:108.en_khattab: We recite to you ˹O Prophet˺ in truth.

3:109.en_khattab: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs whatever is in the heavens
and whatever is on the earth
And to Allah ˹all˺ matters will be returned ˹for judgment˺.

3:110.qpc_hafs: تَأۡمُرُونَ بِٱلۡمَعۡرُوفِ وَتَنۡهَوۡنَ عَنِ ٱلۡمُنكَرِ وَتُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِۗ
3:110.en_khattab: —you encourage good, forbid evil, and believe in Allah

3:110.qpc_hafs: وَلَوۡ ءَامَنَ أَهۡلُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ لَكَانَ خَيۡرٗا لَّهُمۚ
3:110.en_khattab: Had the People of the Book believed, it would have been better for them
Some of them are faithful, but most are rebellious

3:111.en_khattab: They can never inflict harm on you, except a little annoyance.
But if they meet you in battle,
they will flee and they will have no helpers.

3:112.en_khattab: They will be stricken with disgrace

3:112.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا بِحَبۡلٖ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَحَبۡلٖ مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ
3:112.en_khattab: unless they are protected by a covenant with Allah or a treaty with the people.
They have invited the displeasure of Allah
and have been branded with misery

3:112.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ يَكۡفُرُونَ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ

3:112.en_khattab: This is ˹a fair reward˺ for their disobedience and violations.

3:113.en_khattab: Yet they are not all alike:
there are some among the People of the Book

3:114.en_khattab: and race with one another in doing good

3:115.qpc_hafs: وَمَا يَفۡعَلُواْ مِنۡ خَيۡرٖ فَلَن يُكۡفَرُوهُۗ
3:115.en_khattab: They will never be denied the reward for any good they have done.
And Allah has ˹perfect˺ knowledge of those mindful ˹of Him˺.

3:116.qpc_hafs: لَن تُغۡنِيَ عَنۡهُمۡ أَمۡوَٰلُهُمۡ وَلَآ أَوۡلَٰدُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيۡـٔٗاۖ
3:116.en_khattab: will not avail them their wealth nor their children against Allah.
It is they who will be the residents of the Fire.

3:117.qpc_hafs: مَثَلُ مَا يُنفِقُونَ فِي هَٰذِهِ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَا
3:117.en_khattab: The good they do in this worldly life is

3:117.qpc_hafs: كَمَثَلِ رِيحٖ فِيهَا صِرٌّ أَصَابَتۡ حَرۡثَ قَوۡمٖ ظَلَمُوٓاْ أَنفُسَهُمۡ
3:117.en_khattab: like the harvest of an evil people struck by a bitter wind,
destroying it ˹completely˺. Allah never wronged them,

3:118.en_khattab: Do not associate closely with others

3:118.qpc_hafs: لَا يَأۡلُونَكُمۡ خَبَالٗا وَدُّواْ مَا عَنِتُّمۡ
3:118.en_khattab: who would not miss a chance to harm you. Their only desire is to see you suffer.
Their prejudice has become evident from what they say
and what their hearts hide is far worse.
We have made Our revelations clear to you

3:119.en_khattab: Here you are! You love them but they do not love you,
and you believe in all Scriptures.
When they meet you they say, “We believe.”

3:119.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا خَلَوۡاْ عَضُّواْ عَلَيۡكُمُ ٱلۡأَنَامِلَ مِنَ ٱلۡغَيۡظِۚ
3:119.en_khattab: But when alone, they bite their fingertips in rage.

3:119.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ مُوتُواْ بِغَيۡظِكُمۡۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
3:119.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹May you˺ die of your rage!” Surely Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart.

3:120.en_khattab: When you ˹believers˺ are touched with good
but when you are afflicted with evil

3:120.qpc_hafs: وَإِن تَصۡبِرُواْ وَتَتَّقُواْ لَا يَضُرُّكُمۡ كَيۡدُهُمۡ شَيۡـًٔاۗ
3:120.en_khattab: if you are patient and mindful ˹of Allah˺, their schemes will not harm you in the least
Surely Allah is Fully Aware of what they do

3:121.en_khattab: in the early morning to position the believers in the battlefield.

3:122.en_khattab: were about to cower, then Allah reassured them.
So in Allah let the believers put their trust.

3:123.en_khattab: Indeed, Allah made you victorious at Badr

3:124.en_khattab: Remember, O  Prophet,˺ when you said to the believers,
your Lord will send down a reinforcement of three thousand

3:125.en_khattab: if you ˹believers˺ are firm and mindful ˹of Allah˺
and the enemy launches a sudden attack on you,

3:125.qpc_hafs: هَٰذَا يُمۡدِدۡكُمۡ رَبُّكُم بِخَمۡسَةِ ءَالَٰفٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ مُسَوِّمِينَ
3:125.en_khattab: Allah will reinforce you with five thousand angels designated ˹for battle˺.

3:126.qpc_hafs: وَمَا جَعَلَهُ ٱللَّهُ إِلَّا بُشۡرَىٰ لَكُمۡ
3:126.en_khattab: Allah ordained this ˹reinforcement˺ only as good news for you

3:126.qpc_hafs: وَمَا ٱلنَّصۡرُ إِلَّا مِنۡ عِندِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡحَكِيمِ
3:126.en_khattab: And victory comes only from Allah— the Almighty, All-Wise—

3:127.en_khattab: to destroy a group of the disbelievers
the rest, causing them to withdraw in disappointment.

3:128.en_khattab: You ˹O Prophet˺ have no say in the matter.
It is up to Allah to turn to them in mercy

3:129.en_khattab: and whatever is on the earth
And Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful

3:130.en_khattab: Do not consume interest, multiplying it many times over.

3:132.en_khattab: so you may be shown mercy.

3:133.en_khattab: And hasten towards forgiveness from your Lord
and a Paradise as vast as the heavens and the earth

3:134.en_khattab: ˹They are˺ those who donate in prosperity and adversity,
control their anger, and pardon others.

3:135.en_khattab: ˹They are˺ those who, upon committing an evil deed
knowingly persist in sin— and who forgives sins except Allah?

3:135.qpc_hafs: وَلَمۡ يُصِرُّواْ عَلَىٰ مَا فَعَلُواْ وَهُمۡ يَعۡلَمُونَ
3:135.en_khattab: and do not knowingly persist in sin— and who forgives sins except Allah?

3:136.en_khattab: and Gardens under which rivers flow
How excellent is the reward for those who work ˹righteousness˺!

3:137.en_khattab: Similar situations came to pass before you,
and see the fate of the deniers.

3:138.en_khattab: This is an insight to humanity
and a lesson to the God-fearing.

3:139.en_khattab: for you will have the upper hand

3:140.en_khattab: If you have suffered injuries ˹at Uḥud˺,
We alternate these days ˹of victory and defeat˺
among people so that Allah may reveal the ˹true˺ believers,
and Allah does not like the wrongdoers—

3:143.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدۡ كُنتُمۡ تَمَنَّوۡنَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَ مِن قَبۡلِ
3:143.en_khattab: You certainly wished ˹for the opportunity˺ for martyrdom before
encountering it, now you have seen it

3:144.en_khattab: Muḥammad is no more than a messenger;
other messengers have gone before him.
If he were to die or to be killed,
And Allah will reward those who are grateful.

3:145.qpc_hafs: وَمَا كَانَ لِنَفۡسٍ أَن تَمُوتَ إِلَّا بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِ
3:145.en_khattab: No soul can ever die without Allah’s Will

3:145.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يُرِدۡ ثَوَابَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا نُؤۡتِهِۦ مِنۡهَا
3:145.en_khattab: Those who desire worldly gain, We will let them have it,

3:145.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يُرِدۡ ثَوَابَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ نُؤۡتِهِۦ مِنۡهَاۚ
3:145.en_khattab: and those who desire heavenly reward, We will grant it to them.
And We will reward those who are grateful.

3:146.qpc_hafs: وَكَأَيِّن مِّن نَّبِيّٖ قَٰتَلَ مَعَهُۥ رِبِّيُّونَ كَثِيرٞ
3:146.en_khattab: ˹Imagine˺ how many devotees fought along with their prophets

3:146.qpc_hafs: فَمَا وَهَنُواْ لِمَآ أَصَابَهُمۡ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ
3:146.en_khattab: and never faltered despite whatever ˹losses˺ they suffered in the cause of Allah
nor did they weaken or give in!

3:147.qpc_hafs: أَن قَالُواْ رَبَّنَا ٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا

3:147.en_khattab: and grant us victory over the disbelieving people.

3:148.en_khattab: So Allah gave them the reward of this world
and the excellent reward of the Hereafter

3:149.en_khattab: If you yield to the disbelievers,
they will drag you back to disbelief

3:150.en_khattab: But no! Allah is your Guardian
and He is the best Helper.

3:151.qpc_hafs: سَنُلۡقِي فِي قُلُوبِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ ٱلرُّعۡبَ
3:151.en_khattab: We will cast horror into the hearts of the disbelievers

3:151.qpc_hafs: بِمَآ أَشۡرَكُواْ بِٱللَّهِ مَا لَمۡ يُنَزِّلۡ بِهِۦ سُلۡطَٰنٗاۖ
3:151.en_khattab: for associating ˹false gods˺ with Allah— a practice He has never authorized
The Fire will be their home
what an evil place for the wrongdoers to stay

3:152.en_khattab: Indeed, Allah fulfilled His promise to you
when you ˹initially˺ swept them away by His Will

3:152.qpc_hafs: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا فَشِلۡتُمۡ وَتَنَٰزَعۡتُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأَمۡرِ وَعَصَيۡتُم مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ مَآ أَرَىٰكُم مَّا تُحِبُّونَۚ
3:152.en_khattab: then your courage weakened and you disputed about the command and disobeyed, after Allah had brought victory within your reach.

3:152.qpc_hafs: مِنكُم مَّن يُرِيدُ ٱلدُّنۡيَا وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرِيدُ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَۚ
3:152.en_khattab: Some of you were after worldly gain while others desired a heavenly reward.
He denied you victory over them as a test,
And Allah is Gracious to the believers.

3:153.en_khattab: ˹Remember˺ when you were running far away
while the Messenger was calling to you from behind!
So Allah rewarded your disobedience with distress upon distress.
Now, do not grieve over the victory you were denied
And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

3:154.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ أَنزَلَ عَلَيۡكُم مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ ٱلۡغَمِّ
3:154.en_khattab: Then after distress, He sent down serenity

3:154.qpc_hafs: أَمَنَةٗ نُّعَاسٗا يَغۡشَىٰ طَآئِفَةٗ مِّنكُمۡۖ وَطَآئِفَةٞ قَدۡ أَهَمَّتۡهُمۡ أَنفُسُهُمۡ
3:154.en_khattab: in the form of drowsiness overcoming some of you, while others were disturbed

3:154.qpc_hafs: يَظُنُّونَ بِٱللَّهِ غَيۡرَ ٱلۡحَقِّ ظَنَّ ٱلۡجَٰهِلِيَّةِۖ يَقُولُونَ هَل لَّنَا مِنَ ٱلۡأَمۡرِ مِن شَيۡءٖۗ
3:154.en_khattab: by evil thoughts about Allah— the thoughts of ˹pre-Islamic˺ ignorance. They ask, “Do we have a say in the matter?”
Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “All matters are destined by Allah.”

3:154.qpc_hafs: يُخۡفُونَ فِيٓ أَنفُسِهِم مَّا لَا يُبۡدُونَ لَكَۖ يَقُولُونَ لَوۡ كَانَ لَنَا مِنَ ٱلۡأَمۡرِ شَيۡءٞ مَّا قُتِلۡنَا هَٰهُنَاۗ
3:154.en_khattab: They conceal in their hearts what they do not reveal to you. They say ˹to themselves˺, “If we had any say in the matter, none of us would have come to die here.”

3:154.qpc_hafs: قُل لَّوۡ كُنتُمۡ فِي بُيُوتِكُمۡ لَبَرَزَ ٱلَّذِينَ كُتِبَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡقَتۡلُ إِلَىٰ مَضَاجِعِهِمۡۖ
3:154.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Even if you were to remain in your homes, those among you who were destined to be killed would have met the same fate.”

3:154.qpc_hafs: وَلِيَبۡتَلِيَ ٱللَّهُ مَا فِي صُدُورِكُمۡ وَلِيُمَحِّصَ مَا فِي قُلُوبِكُمۡۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
3:154.en_khattab: Through this, Allah tests what is within you and purifies what is in your hearts. And Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart.

3:155.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ تَوَلَّوۡاْ مِنكُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡتَقَى ٱلۡجَمۡعَانِ
3:155.en_khattab: Indeed, those ˹believers˺ who fled on the day when the two armies met

3:155.qpc_hafs: إِنَّمَا ٱسۡتَزَلَّهُمُ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ بِبَعۡضِ مَا كَسَبُواْۖ
3:155.en_khattab: were made to slip by Satan because of their misdeeds.
Surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Forbearing.

3:156.qpc_hafs: لَا تَكُونُواْ كَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَقَالُواْ لِإِخۡوَٰنِهِمۡ إِذَا ضَرَبُواْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَوۡ كَانُواْ غُزّٗى
3:156.en_khattab: Do not be like the unfaithful who say about their brothers who travel throughout the land or engage in battle,

3:156.qpc_hafs: لَّوۡ كَانُواْ عِندَنَا مَا مَاتُواْ وَمَا قُتِلُواْ لِيَجۡعَلَ ٱللَّهُ ذَٰلِكَ حَسۡرَةٗ فِي قُلُوبِهِمۡۗ
3:156.en_khattab: “If they had stayed with us, they would not have died or been killed.” Allah makes such thinking a cause of agony in their hearts.
It is Allah who gives life and causes death.
And Allah is All-Seeing of what you do.

3:157.en_khattab: Should you be martyred or die in the cause of Allah,

3:157.qpc_hafs: لَمَغۡفِرَةٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرَحۡمَةٌ خَيۡرٞ مِّمَّا يَجۡمَعُونَ
3:157.en_khattab: then His forgiveness and mercy are far better than whatever ˹wealth˺ those

3:158.en_khattab: all of you will be gathered before Allah.

3:159.en_khattab: It is out of Allah’s mercy
that you ˹O Prophet˺ have been lenient with them
Had you been cruel or hard-hearted
they would have certainly abandoned you
and consult with them in ˹conducting˺ matters
Once you make a decision, put your trust in Allah
Surely Allah loves those who trust in Him

3:160.en_khattab: But if He denies you help,

3:160.qpc_hafs: فَمَن ذَا ٱلَّذِي يَنصُرُكُم مِّنۢ بَعۡدِهِۦۗ
3:160.en_khattab: then who else can help you?
So in Allah let the believers put their trust.

3:161.en_khattab: It is not appropriate for a prophet to illegally withhold spoils of war.

3:161.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يَغۡلُلۡ يَأۡتِ بِمَا غَلَّ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِۚ
3:161.en_khattab: And whoever does so, it will be held against them on the Day of Judgment.

3:161.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ تُوَفَّىٰ كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ مَّا كَسَبَتۡ وَهُمۡ لَا يُظۡلَمُونَ
3:161.en_khattab: Then every soul will be paid in full for what it has done, and none will be wronged.

3:162.en_khattab: Are those who seek Allah’s pleasure
like those who deserve Allah’s wrath?

3:163.en_khattab: They ˹each˺ have varying degrees in the sight of Allah.
And Allah is All-Seeing of what they do.

3:164.en_khattab: Indeed, Allah has done the believers a ˹great˺ favour

3:164.qpc_hafs: إِذۡ بَعَثَ فِيهِمۡ رَسُولٗا مِّنۡ أَنفُسِهِمۡ
3:164.en_khattab: by raising a messenger from among them
—reciting to them His revelations, purifying them
and teaching them the Book and wisdom

3:164.qpc_hafs: وَإِن كَانُواْ مِن قَبۡلُ لَفِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ
3:164.en_khattab: For indeed they had previously been clearly astray.

3:165.en_khattab: Why is it when you suffered casualties
˹at Uḥud˺—although you had made your enemy suffer twice as much
Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “It is because of your disobedience.”

3:165.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ
3:165.en_khattab: Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

3:166.en_khattab: on the day the two armies met
so that He might distinguish the ˹true˺ believers

3:167.qpc_hafs: وَقِيلَ لَهُمۡ تَعَالَوۡاْ قَٰتِلُواْ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ أَوِ ٱدۡفَعُواْۖ
3:167.en_khattab: When it was said to them, “Come fight in the cause of Allah or ˹at least˺ defend yourselves,”
they replied, “If we had known there was fighting, we would have definitely gone with you.”

3:167.qpc_hafs: هُمۡ لِلۡكُفۡرِ يَوۡمَئِذٍ أَقۡرَبُ مِنۡهُمۡ لِلۡإِيمَٰنِۚ
3:167.en_khattab: They were closer to disbelief than to belief on that day.

3:167.qpc_hafs: يَقُولُونَ بِأَفۡوَٰهِهِم مَّا لَيۡسَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمۡۚ
3:167.en_khattab: for saying with their mouths what was not in their hearts.
Allah is All-Knowing of what they hide.

3:168.en_khattab: Those who said to their brothers
If only they had followed what we were told, they would not have been killed!
Then avert from yourselves the death

3:169.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ قُتِلُواْ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ
3:169.en_khattab: Never think of those martyred in the cause of Allah
In fact, they are alive with their Lord

3:170.qpc_hafs: فَرِحِينَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ مِن فَضۡلِهِۦ
وَيَسۡتَبۡشِرُونَ بِٱلَّذِينَ لَمۡ يَلۡحَقُواْ بِهِم مِّنۡ خَلۡفِهِمۡ
3:170.en_khattab: and being delighted for those yet to join them

3:170.qpc_hafs: أَلَّا خَوۡفٌ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وَلَا هُمۡ يَحۡزَنُونَ
3:170.en_khattab: There will be no fear for them, nor will they grieve

3:171.en_khattab: They are joyful for receiving Allah’s grace
and that Allah does not deny

3:172.en_khattab: ˹As for˺ those who responded to the call of Allah and His Messenger
those of them who did good and were mindful ˹of Allah˺

3:173.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلنَّاسَ قَدۡ جَمَعُواْ لَكُمۡ فَٱخۡشَوۡهُمۡ
3:173.en_khattab: “Your enemies have mobilized their forces against you, so fear them,”
the warning only made them grow stronger in faith
and they replied, “Allah ˹alone˺ is sufficient ˹as an aid˺ for us and ˹He˺ is the best Protector.”

3:174.en_khattab: So they returned with Allah’s favours and grace
For they sought to please Allah
And surely Allah is ˹the˺ Lord of infinite bounty

3:175.en_khattab: That warning was only from Satan, trying to prompt you to fear his followers.
fear Me if you are true believers.

3:176.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يَحۡزُنكَ ٱلَّذِينَ يُسَٰرِعُونَ فِي ٱلۡكُفۡرِۚ
3:176.en_khattab: ˹O Prophet!˺ Do not grieve for those who race to disbelieve—
surely they will not harm Allah in the least.

3:176.qpc_hafs: يُرِيدُ ٱللَّهُ أَلَّا يَجۡعَلَ لَهُمۡ حَظّٗا فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِۖ
3:176.en_khattab: It is Allah’s Will to disallow them a share in the Hereafter,
and they will suffer a tremendous punishment.

3:177.en_khattab: Those who trade belief for disbelief
will never harm Allah in the least,
will never harm Allah in the least
and they will suffer a painful punishment.

3:178.en_khattab: Those who disbelieve should not think
that living longer is good for them.
They are only given more time to increase in sin,
and they will suffer a humiliating punishment.

3:179.qpc_hafs: مَّا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيَذَرَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ عَلَىٰ مَآ أَنتُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ حَتَّىٰ يَمِيزَ ٱلۡخَبِيثَ مِنَ ٱلطَّيِّبِۗ
3:179.en_khattab: Allah would not leave the believers in the condition you were in, until He distinguished the good from the evil ˹among you˺.

3:179.qpc_hafs: وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيُطۡلِعَكُمۡ عَلَى ٱلۡغَيۡبِ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَجۡتَبِي مِن رُّسُلِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُۖ
3:179.en_khattab: Nor would Allah ˹directly˺ reveal to you the unseen, but He chooses whoever He wills as a messenger.
So believe in Allah and His messengers.

3:179.qpc_hafs: وَإِن تُؤۡمِنُواْ وَتَتَّقُواْ فَلَكُمۡ أَجۡرٌ عَظِيمٞ
3:179.en_khattab: And if you are faithful and mindful ˹of Allah˺, you will receive a great reward.

3:180.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَبۡخَلُونَ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ مِن فَضۡلِهِۦ
3:180.en_khattab: And do not let those who ˹greedily˺ withhold Allah’s bounties

3:180.qpc_hafs: هُوَ خَيۡرٗا لَّهُمۖ بَلۡ هُوَ شَرّٞ لَّهُمۡۖ
3:180.en_khattab: think it is good for them— in fact, it is bad for them!

3:180.qpc_hafs: سَيُطَوَّقُونَ مَا بَخِلُواْ بِهِۦ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِۗ
3:180.en_khattab: They will be leashed ˹by their necks˺ on the Day of Judgment with whatever ˹wealth˺ they used to withhold.
And Allah is the ˹sole˺ inheritor of the heavens and the earth.
And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

3:181.qpc_hafs: لَّقَدۡ سَمِعَ ٱللَّهُ قَوۡلَ ٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوٓاْ
3:181.en_khattab: Indeed, Allah has heard those ˹among the Jews˺ who said,

3:181.qpc_hafs: سَنَكۡتُبُ مَا قَالُواْ وَقَتۡلَهُمُ ٱلۡأَنۢبِيَآءَ بِغَيۡرِ حَقّٖ
3:181.en_khattab: We have certainly recorded their slurs and their killing of prophets unjustly.
Then We will say, “Taste the torment of burning!

3:182.en_khattab: This is ˹the reward˺ for what your hands have done.

3:183.qpc_hafs: ٱلَّذِينَ قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَهِدَ إِلَيۡنَآ
3:183.en_khattab: Those ˹are the same people˺ who say,

3:183.qpc_hafs: أَلَّا نُؤۡمِنَ لِرَسُولٍ حَتَّىٰ يَأۡتِيَنَا بِقُرۡبَانٖ تَأۡكُلُهُ ٱلنَّارُۗ
3:183.en_khattab: “Allah has commanded us not to believe in any messenger unless he brings us an offering to be consumed by fire ˹from the sky˺.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺

3:183.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ قَدۡ جَآءَكُمۡ رُسُلٞ مِّن قَبۡلِي بِٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتِ وَبِٱلَّذِي قُلۡتُمۡ
3:183.en_khattab: “Other prophets did in fact come to you before me with clear proofs and ˹even˺ what you demanded—
why then did you kill them, if what you say is true?”

3:184.en_khattab: If you are rejected by them,
so too were messengers before you

3:185.en_khattab: And you will only receive your full reward on the Day of Judgment.

3:185.qpc_hafs: فَمَن زُحۡزِحَ عَنِ ٱلنَّارِ وَأُدۡخِلَ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ فَقَدۡ فَازَۗ
3:185.en_khattab: Whoever is spared from the Fire and is admitted into Paradise will ˹indeed˺ triumph.

3:185.qpc_hafs: وَمَا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنۡيَآ إِلَّا مَتَٰعُ ٱلۡغُرُورِ
3:185.en_khattab: Whereas the life of this world is no more than the delusion of enjoyment.

3:186.qpc_hafs: وَلَتَسۡمَعُنَّ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ مِن قَبۡلِكُمۡ وَمِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَشۡرَكُوٓاْ
3:186.en_khattab: hear many hurtful words from those who were given the Scripture before you and ˹from˺ the polytheists.
But if you are patient and mindful
˹of Allah˺—surely this is a resolve to aspire to.

3:187.qpc_hafs: وَإِذۡ أَخَذَ ٱللَّهُ مِيثَٰقَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ
3:187.en_khattab: ˹Remember, O  Prophet,˺ when Allah took the covenant of those who were given the Scripture
to make it known to people and not hide it
yet they cast it behind their backs
and traded it for a fleeting gain

3:188.qpc_hafs: لَا تَحۡسَبَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡرَحُونَ بِمَآ أَتَواْ
3:188.en_khattab: Do not let those who rejoice in their misdeeds

3:188.qpc_hafs: وَّيُحِبُّونَ أَن يُحۡمَدُواْ بِمَا لَمۡ يَفۡعَلُواْ
3:188.en_khattab: and love to take credit for what they have not done
They will suffer a painful punishment.

3:189.en_khattab: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth.
And Allah is Most Capable of everything.

3:190.en_khattab: Indeed, in the creation of the heavens and the earth
and the alternation of the day and night
there are signs for people of reason.

3:191.en_khattab: while standing, sitting, and lying on their sides,
and reflect on the creation of the heavens and the earth ˹and pray˺,

3:191.qpc_hafs: رَبَّنَا مَا خَلَقۡتَ هَٰذَا بَٰطِلٗا سُبۡحَٰنَكَ
3:191.en_khattab: “Our Lord! You have not created ˹all of˺ this without purpose. Glory be to You!
Protect us from the torment of the Fire.

3:192.qpc_hafs: إِنَّكَ مَن تُدۡخِلِ ٱلنَّارَ فَقَدۡ أَخۡزَيۡتَهُۥۖ
3:192.en_khattab: Indeed, those You commit to the Fire will be ˹completely˺ disgraced!
And the wrongdoers will have no helpers.

3:193.qpc_hafs: رَّبَّنَآ إِنَّنَا سَمِعۡنَا مُنَادِيٗا يُنَادِي لِلۡإِيمَٰنِ
3:193.en_khattab: Our Lord! We have heard the caller to ˹true˺ belief,
˹proclaiming,˺ ‘Believe in your Lord ˹alone˺,’ so we believed.

3:193.qpc_hafs: رَبَّنَا فَٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا ذُنُوبَنَا وَكَفِّرۡ عَنَّا سَيِّـَٔاتِنَا وَتَوَفَّنَا مَعَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ
3:193.en_khattab: Our Lord! Forgive our sins, absolve us of our misdeeds, and allow us ˹each˺ to die as one of the virtuous.

3:194.qpc_hafs: رَبَّنَا وَءَاتِنَا مَا وَعَدتَّنَا عَلَىٰ رُسُلِكَ
3:194.en_khattab: Our Lord! Grant us what You have promised us through Your messengers
and do not put us to shame on Judgment Day
for certainly You never fail in Your promise.

3:195.en_khattab: So their Lord responded to them:

3:195.qpc_hafs: أَنِّي لَآ أُضِيعُ عَمَلَ عَٰمِلٖ مِّنكُم مِّن ذَكَرٍ أَوۡ أُنثَىٰۖ بَعۡضُكُم مِّنۢ بَعۡضٖۖ
3:195.en_khattab: “I will never deny any of you— male or female— the reward of your deeds. Both are equal in reward.

3:195.qpc_hafs: فَٱلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُواْ وَأُخۡرِجُواْ مِن دِيَٰرِهِمۡ وَأُوذُواْ فِي سَبِيلِي وَقَٰتَلُواْ وَقُتِلُواْ
3:195.en_khattab: Those who migrated or were expelled from their homes, and were persecuted for My sake and fought and ˹some˺ were martyred

3:195.qpc_hafs: لَأُكَفِّرَنَّ عَنۡهُمۡ سَيِّـَٔاتِهِمۡ وَلَأُدۡخِلَنَّهُمۡ جَنَّٰتٖ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ ثَوَابٗا مِّنۡ عِندِ ٱللَّهِۚ
3:195.en_khattab: I will certainly forgive their sins and admit them into Gardens under which rivers flow, as a reward from Allah.
And with Allah is the finest reward!”

3:197.en_khattab: It is only a brief enjoyment.
Then Hell will be their home
what an evil place to rest!

3:198.en_khattab: of their Lord will be in Gardens
And what is with Allah is best for the virtuous.

3:199.en_khattab: Indeed, there are some among the People of the Book

3:199.qpc_hafs: لَمَن يُؤۡمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيۡكُمۡ وَمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيۡهِمۡ
3:199.en_khattab: who truly believe in Allah and what has been revealed to you ˹believers˺ and what was revealed to them

3:199.qpc_hafs: لَا يَشۡتَرُونَ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ ثَمَنٗا قَلِيلًاۚ
3:199.en_khattab: never trading Allah’s revelations for a fleeting gain
Their reward is with their Lord
Surely Allah is swift in reckoning

3:200.en_khattab: Patiently endure, persevere, stand on guard, and be mindful of Allah,

4:1.qpc_hafs: ٱتَّقُواْ رَبَّكُمُ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكُم مِّن نَّفۡسٖ وَٰحِدَةٖ
4:1.en_khattab: Be mindful of your Lord Who created you from a single soul,

4:1.qpc_hafs: وَخَلَقَ مِنۡهَا زَوۡجَهَا وَبَثَّ مِنۡهُمَا رِجَالٗا كَثِيرٗا وَنِسَآءٗۚ
4:1.en_khattab: and from it He created its mate, and through both He spread countless men and women.

4:1.qpc_hafs: وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِي تَسَآءَلُونَ بِهِۦ وَٱلۡأَرۡحَامَۚ
4:1.en_khattab: And be mindful of Allah— in Whose Name you appeal to one another— and ˹honour˺ family ties.
Surely Allah is ever Watchful over you.

4:2.en_khattab: Give orphans their wealth ˹when they reach maturity˺,
and do not exchange your worthless possessions for their valuables,
nor cheat them by mixing their wealth with your own.
For this would indeed be a great sin.

4:3.en_khattab: If you fear you might fail to give

4:3.qpc_hafs: فَٱنكِحُواْ مَا طَابَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلنِّسَآءِ مَثۡنَىٰ وَثُلَٰثَ وَرُبَٰعَۖ
4:3.en_khattab: were to marry them˺, then marry other women of your choice— two, three, or four.
But if you are afraid you will fail to maintain justice,
then ˹content yourselves with˺ one or those ˹bondwomen˺ in your possession.
This way you are less likely to commit injustice.

4:4.en_khattab: Give women ˹you wed˺ their due dowries

4:4.qpc_hafs: فَإِن طِبۡنَ لَكُمۡ عَن شَيۡءٖ مِّنۡهُ نَفۡسٗا
4:4.en_khattab: But if they waive some of it willingly,
then you may enjoy it freely with a clear conscience.

4:5.en_khattab: Do not entrust the incapable ˹among your dependants˺ with your wealth
which Allah has made a means of support for you
but feed and clothe them from it

4:6.en_khattab: until they reach a marriageable age.
Then if you feel they are capable of sound judgment,

4:6.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَأۡكُلُوهَآ إِسۡرَافٗا وَبِدَارًا أَن يَكۡبَرُواْۚ
4:6.en_khattab: And do not consume it wastefully and hastily before they grow up ˹to demand it˺.
If the guardian is well-off, they should not take compensation;
but if the guardian is poor, let them take a reasonable provision.

4:6.qpc_hafs: فَإِذَا دَفَعۡتُمۡ إِلَيۡهِمۡ أَمۡوَٰلَهُمۡ فَأَشۡهِدُواْ عَلَيۡهِمۡۚ
4:6.en_khattab: When you give orphans back their property, call in witnesses.
And sufficient is Allah as a ˹vigilant˺ Reckoner.

4:7.qpc_hafs: لِّلرِّجَالِ نَصِيبٞ مِّمَّا تَرَكَ ٱلۡوَٰلِدَانِ وَٱلۡأَقۡرَبُونَ
4:7.en_khattab: For men there is a share in what their parents and close relatives leave,

4:7.qpc_hafs: وَلِلنِّسَآءِ نَصِيبٞ مِّمَّا تَرَكَ ٱلۡوَٰلِدَانِ وَٱلۡأَقۡرَبُونَ
4:7.en_khattab: and for women there is a share in what their parents and close relatives leave—
whether it is little or much.

4:8.en_khattab: the time of distribution, offer them a ˹small˺ provision from it

4:9.en_khattab: Let the guardians be as concerned

4:9.qpc_hafs: لَوۡ تَرَكُواْ مِنۡ خَلۡفِهِمۡ ذُرِّيَّةٗ ضِعَٰفًا خَافُواْ عَلَيۡهِمۡ
4:9.en_khattab: ˹for the orphans˺ as they would if they were to ˹die and˺ leave ˹their own˺ helpless children behind.
So let them be mindful of Allah and speak equitably.

4:10.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَأۡكُلُونَ أَمۡوَٰلَ ٱلۡيَتَٰمَىٰ ظُلۡمًا
4:10.en_khattab: Indeed, those who unjustly consume orphans’ wealth
˹in fact˺ consume nothing but fire into their bellies
And they will be burned in a blazing Hell

4:11.en_khattab: Allah commands you regarding your children:
the share of the male will be twice that of the female.

4:11.qpc_hafs: فَإِن كُنَّ نِسَآءٗ فَوۡقَ ٱثۡنَتَيۡنِ فَلَهُنَّ ثُلُثَا مَا تَرَكَۖ
4:11.en_khattab: If you leave only two ˹or more˺ females, their share is two-thirds of the estate.
But if there is only one female, her share will be one-half.

4:11.qpc_hafs: وَلِأَبَوَيۡهِ لِكُلِّ وَٰحِدٖ مِّنۡهُمَا ٱلسُّدُسُ مِمَّا تَرَكَ
4:11.en_khattab: Each parent is entitled to one-sixth if you leave offspring.

4:11.qpc_hafs: إِن كَانَ لَهُۥ وَلَدٞۚ فَإِن لَّمۡ يَكُن لَّهُۥ وَلَدٞ وَوَرِثَهُۥٓ أَبَوَاهُ فَلِأُمِّهِ ٱلثُّلُثُۚ
4:11.en_khattab: But if you are childless and your parents are the only heirs, then your mother will receive one-third.

4:11.qpc_hafs: فَإِن كَانَ لَهُۥٓ إِخۡوَةٞ فَلِأُمِّهِ ٱلسُّدُسُۚ
4:11.en_khattab: But if you leave siblings, then your mother will receive one-sixth

4:11.qpc_hafs: مِنۢ بَعۡدِ وَصِيَّةٖ يُوصِي بِهَآ أَوۡ دَيۡنٍۗ
4:11.en_khattab: —after the fulfilment of bequests and debts.

4:11.qpc_hafs: ءَابَآؤُكُمۡ وَأَبۡنَآؤُكُمۡ لَا تَدۡرُونَ أَيُّهُمۡ أَقۡرَبُ لَكُمۡ نَفۡعٗاۚ
4:11.en_khattab: ˹Be fair to˺ your parents and children, as you do not ˹fully˺ know who is more beneficial to you.

4:12.qpc_hafs: وَلَكُمۡ نِصۡفُ مَا تَرَكَ أَزۡوَٰجُكُمۡ إِن لَّمۡ يَكُن لَّهُنَّ وَلَدٞۚ
4:12.en_khattab: You will inherit half of what your wives leave if they are childless.

4:12.qpc_hafs: فَإِن كَانَ لَهُنَّ وَلَدٞ فَلَكُمُ ٱلرُّبُعُ مِمَّا تَرَكۡنَۚ
4:12.en_khattab: But if they have children, then ˹your share is˺ one-fourth of the estate.

4:12.qpc_hafs: مِنۢ بَعۡدِ وَصِيَّةٖ يُوصِينَ بِهَآ أَوۡ دَيۡنٖۚ
4:12.en_khattab: After the fulfilment of bequests and debts.

4:12.qpc_hafs: وَلَهُنَّ ٱلرُّبُعُ مِمَّا تَرَكۡتُمۡ إِن لَّمۡ يَكُن لَّكُمۡ وَلَدٞۚ
4:12.en_khattab: And your wives will inherit one-fourth of what you leave if you are childless.

4:12.qpc_hafs: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمۡ وَلَدٞ فَلَهُنَّ ٱلثُّمُنُ مِمَّا تَرَكۡتُمۚ
4:12.en_khattab: But if you have children, then your wives will receive one-eighth of your estate.

4:12.qpc_hafs: مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ وَصِيَّةٖ تُوصُونَ بِهَآ أَوۡ دَيۡنٖۗ
4:12.en_khattab: After the fulfilment of bequests and debts.

4:12.qpc_hafs: وَإِن كَانَ رَجُلٞ يُورَثُ كَلَٰلَةً أَوِ ٱمۡرَأَةٞ وَلَهُۥٓ أَخٌ أَوۡ أُخۡتٞ فَلِكُلِّ وَٰحِدٖ مِّنۡهُمَا ٱلسُّدُسُۚ
4:12.en_khattab: And if a man or a woman leaves neither parents nor children but only a brother or a sister ˹from their mother’s side˺, they will each inherit one-sixth.

4:12.qpc_hafs: فَإِن كَانُوٓاْ أَكۡثَرَ مِن ذَٰلِكَ فَهُمۡ شُرَكَآءُ فِي ٱلثُّلُثِۚ
4:12.en_khattab: But if they are more than one, they ˹all˺ will share one-third of the estate.

4:12.qpc_hafs: مِنۢ بَعۡدِ وَصِيَّةٖ يُوصَىٰ بِهَآ أَوۡ دَيۡنٍ غَيۡرَ مُضَآرّٖۚ
4:12.en_khattab: After the fulfilment of bequests and debts without harm ˹to the heirs˺.

4:12.qpc_hafs: وَصِيَّةٗ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِۗ وَٱللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَلِيمٞ
4:12.en_khattab: ˹This is˺ a commandment from Allah. And Allah is All-Knowing, Most Forbearing.

4:13.en_khattab: These ˹entitlements˺ are the limits set by Allah.
Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger

4:13.qpc_hafs: يُدۡخِلۡهُ جَنَّٰتٖ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ
4:13.en_khattab: will be admitted into Gardens under which rivers flow,

4:14.en_khattab: But whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger
will be cast into Hell, to stay there forever
And they will suffer a humiliating punishment.

4:15.en_khattab: ˹As for˺ those of your women who commit illegal intercourse—
call four witnesses from among yourselves.

4:15.qpc_hafs: فَإِن شَهِدُواْ فَأَمۡسِكُوهُنَّ فِي ٱلۡبُيُوتِ حَتَّىٰ يَتَوَفَّىٰهُنَّ ٱلۡمَوۡتُ أَوۡ يَجۡعَلَ ٱللَّهُ لَهُنَّ سَبِيلٗا
4:15.en_khattab: If they testify, confine the offenders to their homes until they die or Allah ordains a ˹different˺ way for them.

4:16.en_khattab: And the two among you who commit this sin—
If they repent and mend their ways,
Surely Allah is ever Accepting of Repentance, Most Merciful.

4:17.en_khattab: of those who commit evil ignorantly ˹or recklessly˺

4:18.en_khattab: However, repentance is not accepted from those who knowingly persist in sin

4:18.qpc_hafs: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا حَضَرَ أَحَدَهُمُ ٱلۡمَوۡتُ قَالَ إِنِّي تُبۡتُ ٱلۡـَٰٔنَ
4:18.en_khattab: until they start dying, and then cry, “Now I repent!”
nor those who die as disbelievers.
For them We have prepared a painful punishment.

4:19.qpc_hafs: لَا يَحِلُّ لَكُمۡ أَن تَرِثُواْ ٱلنِّسَآءَ كَرۡهٗاۖ
4:19.en_khattab: It is not permissible for you to inherit women against their will
to make them return some of the dowry ˹as a ransom for
divorce˺—unless they are found guilty of adultery.
If you happen to dislike them,

4:19.qpc_hafs: فَعَسَىٰٓ أَن تَكۡرَهُواْ شَيۡـٔٗا وَيَجۡعَلَ ٱللَّهُ فِيهِ خَيۡرٗا كَثِيرٗا
4:19.en_khattab: you may hate something which Allah turns into a great blessing.

4:20.qpc_hafs: وَإِنۡ أَرَدتُّمُ ٱسۡتِبۡدَالَ زَوۡجٖ مَّكَانَ زَوۡجٖ
4:20.en_khattab: If you desire to replace a wife with another
and you have given the former ˹even˺ a stack of gold ˹as a dowry˺
do not take any of it back
Would you ˹still˺ take it unjustly and very sinfully?

4:21.en_khattab: And how could you take it back
after having enjoyed each other intimately
and she has taken from you a firm commitment

4:22.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَنكِحُواْ مَا نَكَحَ ءَابَآؤُكُم مِّنَ ٱلنِّسَآءِ
