10:22.en_khattab: to travel through land and sea. And it so happens that you are on ships

10:22.qpc_hafs: وَجَرَيۡنَ بِهِم بِرِيحٖ طَيِّبَةٖ وَفَرِحُواْ بِهَا
10:22.en_khattab: sailing with a favourable wind, to the passengers’ delight.
Suddenly, the ships are overcome by a gale wind
and those on board are overwhelmed by waves from every side
and they assume they are doomed
They cry out to Allah ˹alone˺ in sincere devotion

10:22.qpc_hafs: لَئِنۡ أَنجَيۡتَنَا مِنۡ هَٰذِهِۦ لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلشَّٰكِرِينَ
10:22.en_khattab: “If You save us from this, we will certainly be grateful.”

10:23.en_khattab: But as soon as He rescues them,

10:23.qpc_hafs: إِذَا هُمۡ يَبۡغُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ بِغَيۡرِ ٱلۡحَقِّۗ
10:23.en_khattab: they transgress in the land unjustly.
Your transgression is only against your own souls.
˹There is only˺ brief enjoyment in this worldly life,
then to Us is your return,
and then We will inform you of what you used to do.

10:24.en_khattab: The life of this world is just like
rain We send down from the sky,

10:24.qpc_hafs: فَٱخۡتَلَطَ بِهِۦ نَبَاتُ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مِمَّا يَأۡكُلُ ٱلنَّاسُ وَٱلۡأَنۡعَٰمُ
10:24.en_khattab: producing a mixture of plants which humans and animals consume.

10:24.qpc_hafs: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَخَذَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ زُخۡرُفَهَا وَٱزَّيَّنَتۡ وَظَنَّ أَهۡلُهَآ أَنَّهُمۡ قَٰدِرُونَ عَلَيۡهَآ
10:24.en_khattab: Then just as the earth looks its best, perfectly beautified, and its people think they have full control over it,
there comes to it Our command by night or by day,

10:24.qpc_hafs: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهَا حَصِيدٗا كَأَن لَّمۡ تَغۡنَ بِٱلۡأَمۡسِۚ
10:24.en_khattab: so We mow it down as if it never flourished yesterday!
This is how We make the signs clear for people who reflect.

10:25.en_khattab: And Allah invites ˹all˺ to the Home of Peace

10:26.en_khattab: Those who do good will have the finest reward

10:26.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يَرۡهَقُ وُجُوهَهُمۡ قَتَرٞ وَلَا ذِلَّةٌۚ
10:26.en_khattab: Neither gloom nor disgrace will cover their faces.
It is they who will be the residents of Paradise.

10:27.en_khattab: As for those who commit evil
the reward of an evil deed is its equivalent

10:27.qpc_hafs: مَّا لَهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِنۡ عَاصِمٖۖ
10:27.en_khattab: with no one to protect them from Allah

10:27.qpc_hafs: كَأَنَّمَآ أُغۡشِيَتۡ وُجُوهُهُمۡ قِطَعٗا مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ مُظۡلِمًاۚ
10:27.en_khattab: as if their faces were covered with patches of the night’s deep darkness

10:27.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِۖ هُمۡ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ
10:27.en_khattab: It is they who will be the residents of the Fire. They will be there forever

10:28.en_khattab: Consider the Day We will gather them all together

10:28.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ نَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ أَشۡرَكُواْ مَكَانَكُمۡ أَنتُمۡ وَشُرَكَآؤُكُمۡۚ
10:28.en_khattab: then say to those who associated others ˹with Allah in worship˺, “Stay in your places— you and your associate-gods.”
We will separate them from each other

10:28.qpc_hafs: وَقَالَ شُرَكَآؤُهُم مَّا كُنتُمۡ إِيَّانَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
10:28.en_khattab: and their associate-gods will say, “It was not us that you worshipped!

10:29.en_khattab: Allah is sufficient as a Witness
that we were totally unaware of your worship.”

10:30.qpc_hafs: هُنَالِكَ تَبۡلُواْ كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ مَّآ أَسۡلَفَتۡۚ
10:30.en_khattab: Then and there every soul will face ˹the consequences of˺ what it had done.
They all will be returned to Allah— their True Master.
And whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them.

10:31.en_khattab: “Who provides for you from heaven and earth?

10:31.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يُخۡرِجُ ٱلۡحَيَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمَيِّتِ وَيُخۡرِجُ ٱلۡمَيِّتَ مِنَ ٱلۡحَيِّ وَمَن يُدَبِّرُ ٱلۡأَمۡرَۚ
10:31.en_khattab: Who brings forth the living from the dead and the dead from the living? And who conducts every affair?”

10:32.en_khattab: That is Allah— your True Lord.
So what is beyond the truth except falsehood?
How can you then be turned away?

10:33.en_khattab: has been proven true against the rebellious—

10:34.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ هَلۡ مِن شُرَكَآئِكُم مَّن يَبۡدَؤُاْ ٱلۡخَلۡقَ
10:34.en_khattab: Ask ˹them, O  Prophet˺, “Can any of your associate-gods originate creation
How can you then be deluded ˹from the truth˺?

10:35.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ هَلۡ مِن شُرَكَآئِكُم مَّن يَهۡدِيٓ إِلَى ٱلۡحَقِّۚ
10:35.en_khattab: Ask ˹them, O  Prophet˺, “Can any of your associate-gods guide to the truth?”
Say, “˹Only˺ Allah guides to the truth.”

10:35.qpc_hafs: أَفَمَن يَهۡدِيٓ إِلَى ٱلۡحَقِّ أَحَقُّ أَن يُتَّبَعَ أَمَّن لَّا يَهِدِّيٓ إِلَّآ أَن يُهۡدَىٰۖ
10:35.en_khattab: Who then is more worthy to be followed: the One Who guides to the truth or those who cannot find the way unless guided?
What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

10:36.en_khattab: Most of them follow nothing but ˹inherited˺ assumptions.

10:36.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ شَيۡـًٔاۚ
10:36.en_khattab: ˹And˺ surely assumptions can in no way replace the truth.
Allah is indeed All-Knowing of what they do.

10:37.en_khattab: It is not ˹possible˺ for this Quran
to have been produced by anyone other than Allah.
In fact, it is a confirmation of what came before,
and an explanation of the Scripture.

10:37.qpc_hafs: لَا رَيۡبَ فِيهِ مِن رَّبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
10:37.en_khattab: It is, without a doubt, from the Lord of all worlds.

10:38.en_khattab: Or do they claim, “He made it up!”?
Tell them ˹O Prophet˺, “Produce one sûrah like it then

10:38.qpc_hafs: وَٱدۡعُواْ مَنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ
10:38.en_khattab: and seek help from whoever you can— other than Allah
if what you say is true!

10:39.qpc_hafs: بَلۡ كَذَّبُواْ بِمَا لَمۡ يُحِيطُواْ بِعِلۡمِهِۦ
10:39.en_khattab: In fact, they ˹hastily˺ rejected the Book without comprehending it
and before the fulfilment of its warnings
Similarly, those before them were in denial
See then what was the end of the wrongdoers!

10:40.en_khattab: Some of them will ˹eventually˺ believe in it
And your Lord knows best the corruptors

10:41.en_khattab: then say, “My deeds are mine and your deeds are yours.
You are free of what I do
and I am free of what you do!”

10:42.en_khattab: Some of them listen to what you say,
but can you make the deaf hear
even though they do not understand?

10:43.en_khattab: And some of them look at you,
but can you guide the blind

10:44.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَظۡلِمُ ٱلنَّاسَ شَيۡـٔٗا
10:44.en_khattab: Indeed, Allah does not wrong people in the least
but it is people who wrong themselves

10:45.en_khattab: On the Day He will gather them

10:45.qpc_hafs: كَأَن لَّمۡ يَلۡبَثُوٓاْ إِلَّا سَاعَةٗ مِّنَ ٱلنَّهَارِ
10:45.en_khattab: it will be as if they had not stayed ˹in the world˺ except for an hour of a day,
˹as though they were only˺ getting to know one another.
Lost indeed will be those who

10:46.en_khattab: Whether We show you ˹O Prophet˺ some of what We threaten them with,
or cause you to die ˹before that˺,

10:46.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ ٱللَّهُ شَهِيدٌ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفۡعَلُونَ
10:46.en_khattab: and Allah is a Witness over what they do.

10:47.en_khattab: And for every community there is a messenger.
judgment is passed on them in all fairness,

10:48.en_khattab: to pass if what you say is true?

10:49.qpc_hafs: قُل لَّآ أَمۡلِكُ لِنَفۡسِي ضَرّٗا وَلَا نَفۡعًا إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُۗ
10:49.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I have no power to benefit or protect myself, except by the Will of Allah.”

10:49.qpc_hafs: لِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلٌۚ إِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمۡ
10:49.en_khattab: For each community there is an appointed term. When their time arrives,
they cannot delay it for a moment, nor could they advance it.

10:50.qpc_hafs: أَرَءَيۡتُمۡ إِنۡ أَتَىٰكُمۡ عَذَابُهُۥ بَيَٰتًا أَوۡ نَهَارٗا
10:50.en_khattab: Imagine if His torment were to overcome you by night or day
do the wicked realize what they are ˹really˺ asking Him to hasten?

10:51.en_khattab: only after it has overtaken you? Now?
But you always wanted to hasten it!

10:52.en_khattab: Then the wrongdoers will be told,

10:52.qpc_hafs: هَلۡ تُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَكۡسِبُونَ
10:52.en_khattab: Are you not rewarded except for what you used to commit?

10:53.en_khattab: And you will have no escape.

10:54.qpc_hafs: وَلَوۡ أَنَّ لِكُلِّ نَفۡسٖ ظَلَمَتۡ مَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ
10:54.en_khattab: If every wrongdoer were to possess everything in the world
they would surely ransom themselves with it
And they will be judged in all fairness

10:55.qpc_hafs: أَلَآ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۗ
10:55.en_khattab: Surely to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth.
but most of them do not know.

10:56.en_khattab: He ˹is the One Who˺ gives life
and to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.

10:57.en_khattab: Indeed, there has come to you a warning from your Lord,
a cure for what is in the hearts,
and a mercy for the believers.

10:58.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “In Allah’s grace and mercy
That is far better than whatever ˹wealth˺ they amass.

10:59.qpc_hafs: مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ لَكُم مِّن رِّزۡقٖ
10:59.en_khattab: Have you seen that which Allah has sent down for you as a provision
Of which you have made some lawful and some unlawful
Say, Has Allah given you authorization
Or are you fabricating lies against Allah

10:60.en_khattab: What do those who fabricate lies
against Allah expect on Judgment Day?

10:60.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَذُو فَضۡلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ
10:60.en_khattab: Surely Allah is ever Bountiful to humanity,
but most of them are ungrateful.

10:61.en_khattab: There is no activity you may be engaged in ˹O Prophet˺
or portion of the Quran you may be reciting
nor any deed you ˹all˺ may be doing except

10:61.qpc_hafs: كُنَّا عَلَيۡكُمۡ شُهُودًا إِذۡ تُفِيضُونَ فِيهِۚ
10:61.en_khattab: that We are a Witness over you while doing it

10:61.qpc_hafs: وَمَا يَعۡزُبُ عَن رَّبِّكَ مِن مِّثۡقَالِ ذَرَّةٖ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا فِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ
10:61.en_khattab: Not ˹even˺ an atom’s weight is hidden from your Lord on earth or in heaven

10:61.qpc_hafs: وَلَآ أَصۡغَرَ مِن ذَٰلِكَ وَلَآ أَكۡبَرَ إِلَّا فِي كِتَٰبٖ مُّبِينٍ
10:61.en_khattab: nor anything smaller or larger than that, but is ˹written˺ in a perfect Record

10:62.en_khattab: There will certainly be no fear for the close servants of Allah,

10:64.en_khattab: There is no change in the promise of Allah

10:65.en_khattab: Do not let their words grieve you ˹O Prophet˺.
Surely all honour and power belongs to Allah.

10:66.qpc_hafs: أَلَآ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ
10:66.en_khattab: Certainly to Allah ˹alone˺ belong all those in the heavens
and all those on the earth

10:66.qpc_hafs: وَمَا يَتَّبِعُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدۡعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ شُرَكَآءَۚ
10:66.en_khattab: And what do those who associate others with Allah really follow?

10:67.en_khattab: has made the night for you to rest in

10:68.qpc_hafs: هُوَ ٱلۡغَنِيُّۖ لَهُۥ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ
10:68.en_khattab: He is the Self-Sufficient. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.
You have no proof of this!

10:68.qpc_hafs: أَتَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
10:68.en_khattab: Do you say about Allah what you do not know?

10:69.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡتَرُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡكَذِبَ
10:69.en_khattab: ˹O Prophet,˺ “Indeed, those who fabricate lies against Allah

10:70.en_khattab: ˹It is only˺ a brief enjoyment in this world
then to Us is their return
then We will make them taste the severe punishment

10:71.en_khattab: Relate to them ˹O Prophet˺ the story of Noah
when he said to his people, “O my People!

10:71.qpc_hafs: إِن كَانَ كَبُرَ عَلَيۡكُم مَّقَامِي وَتَذۡكِيرِي بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ
10:71.en_khattab: If my presence and my reminders to you of Allah’s signs are unbearable to you
then ˹know that˺ I have put my trust in Allah
So devise a plot along with your associate-gods

10:71.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ لَا يَكُنۡ أَمۡرُكُمۡ عَلَيۡكُمۡ غُمَّةٗ
10:71.en_khattab: and you do not have to be secretive about your plot
then carry it out against me without delay!

10:72.en_khattab: I have never demanded a reward from you ˹for delivering the message˺.
My reward is only from Allah.
And I have been commanded to be one of those who submit ˹to Allah˺.”

10:73.en_khattab: so We saved him and those with him in the Ark
and drowned those who rejected Our signs.
See then what was the end of those who had been warned!

10:74.en_khattab: Then after him We sent ˹other˺ messengers
and they came to them with clear proofs

10:74.qpc_hafs: فَمَا كَانُواْ لِيُؤۡمِنُواْ بِمَا كَذَّبُواْ بِهِۦ مِن قَبۡلُۚ
10:74.en_khattab: But they would not believe in what they had rejected before
This is how We seal the hearts of the transgressors

10:75.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ بَعَثۡنَا مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِم مُّوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ
10:75.en_khattab: Then after these ˹messengers˺ We sent Moses and Aaron
But they behaved arrogantly and were a wicked people.

10:76.en_khattab: When the truth came to them

10:77.en_khattab: “Is this what you say about the truth when it has come to you?

10:78.qpc_hafs: أَجِئۡتَنَا لِتَلۡفِتَنَا عَمَّا وَجَدۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ ءَابَآءَنَا
10:78.en_khattab: Have you come to turn us away from the faith of our forefathers
so that the two of you may become supreme in the land
We will never believe in you!

10:81.en_khattab: What you have produced is mere magic,
Allah will surely make it useless,

10:81.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُصۡلِحُ عَمَلَ ٱلۡمُفۡسِدِينَ
10:81.en_khattab: for Allah certainly does not set right the work of the corruptors.

10:82.en_khattab: And Allah establishes the truth by His Words
even to the dismay of the wicked

10:83.en_khattab: But no one believed in Moses
except a few youths of his people

10:83.qpc_hafs: عَلَىٰ خَوۡفٖ مِّن فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَمَلَإِيْهِمۡ أَن يَفۡتِنَهُمۡۚ
10:83.en_khattab: while fearing that Pharaoh and their own chiefs might persecute them
And certainly Pharaoh was a tyrant in the land
and he was truly a transgressor

10:84.en_khattab: If you do believe in Allah
and submit ˹to His Will˺, then put your trust in Him.

10:85.en_khattab: Our Lord! Do not subject us to
the persecution of the oppressive people.

10:86.en_khattab: and deliver us by Your mercy

10:87.en_khattab: We revealed to Moses and his brother,
Appoint houses for your people in Egypt.
Turn these houses into places of worship,
and give good news to the believers!

10:88.qpc_hafs: إِنَّكَ ءَاتَيۡتَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَمَلَأَهُۥ زِينَةٗ وَأَمۡوَٰلٗا فِي ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَا
10:88.en_khattab: Our Lord! You have granted Pharaoh and his chiefs luxuries and riches in this worldly life,
which they abused to lead people astray from Your Way!

10:88.qpc_hafs: فَلَا يُؤۡمِنُواْ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
10:88.en_khattab: so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment.

10:89.en_khattab: ˹to Moses and Aaron˺, “Your prayer is answered!
and do not follow the way of those

10:90.en_khattab: We brought the Children of Israel across the sea.
Then Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them unjustly and oppressively.

10:90.qpc_hafs: قَالَ ءَامَنتُ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِيٓ ءَامَنَتۡ بِهِۦ بَنُوٓاْ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
10:90.en_khattab: he cried out, “I believe that there is no god except that in whom the Children of Israel believe,
and I am ˹now˺ one of those who submit.

10:91.en_khattab: and were one of the corruptors.

10:92.en_khattab: Today We will preserve your corpse
so that you may become an example for those who come after you

10:92.qpc_hafs: وَإِنَّ كَثِيرٗا مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ عَنۡ ءَايَٰتِنَا لَغَٰفِلُونَ
10:92.en_khattab: And surely most people are heedless of Our examples!

10:93.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدۡ بَوَّأۡنَا بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ مُبَوَّأَ صِدۡقٖ
10:93.en_khattab: Indeed, We settled the Children of Israel in a blessed land
and granted them good, lawful provisions
They did not differ until knowledge came to them

10:93.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقۡضِي بَيۡنَهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ فِيمَا كَانُواْ فِيهِ يَخۡتَلِفُونَ
10:93.en_khattab: Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their differences

10:94.qpc_hafs: فَإِن كُنتَ فِي شَكّٖ مِّمَّآ أَنزَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكَ
10:94.en_khattab: If you ˹O Prophet˺ are in doubt about ˹these stories˺ that We have revealed to you

10:94.qpc_hafs: فَسۡـَٔلِ ٱلَّذِينَ يَقۡرَءُونَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ مِن قَبۡلِكَۚ
10:94.en_khattab: then ask those who read the Scripture before you
The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord
so do not be one of those who doubt

10:95.en_khattab: and do not be one of those
or you will be one of the losers.

10:97.en_khattab: even if every sign were to come to them
until they see the painful punishment

10:98.en_khattab: If only there had been a society which believed ˹before seeing the torment˺
and, therefore, benefited from its belief,

10:98.qpc_hafs: لَمَّآ ءَامَنُواْ كَشَفۡنَا عَنۡهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡخِزۡيِ
10:98.en_khattab: When they believed, We lifted from them the torment of disgrace
and allowed them enjoyment for a while.

10:99.en_khattab: Had your Lord so willed ˹O Prophet˺,

10:99.qpc_hafs: لَأٓمَنَ مَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كُلُّهُمۡ جَمِيعًاۚ
10:99.en_khattab: all ˹people˺ on earth would have certainly believed, every single one of them!

10:100.en_khattab: It is not for any soul to believe
and He will bring His wrath upon those who

10:101.qpc_hafs: قُلِ ٱنظُرُواْ مَاذَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ
10:101.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Consider all that is in the heavens and the earth!
Yet neither signs nor warners are of any benefit
to those who refuse to believe.

10:102.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا مِثۡلَ أَيَّامِ ٱلَّذِينَ خَلَوۡاْ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡۚ
10:102.en_khattab: for ˹anything˺ except the same torments that befell those before them
I too am waiting with you.

10:104.qpc_hafs: إِن كُنتُمۡ فِي شَكّٖ مِّن دِينِي
10:104.en_khattab: O humanity! If you are in doubt of my faith,

10:104.qpc_hafs: فَلَآ أَعۡبُدُ ٱلَّذِينَ تَعۡبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ
10:104.en_khattab: then ˹know that˺ I do not worship those ˹idols˺ you worship instead of Allah.
But I worship Allah, Who has the power to cause your death.
And I have been commanded, ‘Be one of the believers,’

10:105.en_khattab: and, ‘Be steadfast in faith in all uprightness
and do not be one of the polytheists,’

10:106.en_khattab: and ‘Do not invoke, instead of Allah,
what can neither benefit nor harm you
for if you do, then you will certainly

10:107.en_khattab: and ‘If Allah touches you with harm
none can undo it except Him.
And if He intends good for you,

10:107.qpc_hafs: يُصِيبُ بِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنۡ عِبَادِهِۦۚ
10:107.en_khattab: He grants it to whoever He wills of His servants.
And He is the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.’

10:108.en_khattab: “O humanity! The truth has surely come to you from your Lord.
So whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good.
And whoever chooses to stray, it is only to their own loss.
And I am not a keeper over you.”

10:109.en_khattab: And follow what is revealed to you
and be patient until Allah passes His judgment.
For He is the Best of Judges.

11:1.en_khattab: from the One ˹Who is˺ All-Wise, All-Aware.

11:2.en_khattab: ˹Tell them, O Prophet,˺ “Worship none but Allah.

11:3.en_khattab: and turn to Him in repentance.
He will grant you a good provision
and graciously reward the doers of good.

11:3.qpc_hafs: فَإِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٖ كَبِيرٍ
11:3.en_khattab: then I truly fear for you the torment of a formidable Day.

11:4.en_khattab: And He is Most Capable of everything.

11:5.en_khattab: Indeed, they enfold ˹what is in˺ their hearts
But even when they cover themselves with their clothes
He knows what they conceal and what they reveal
Surely He knows best what is ˹hidden˺ in the heart

11:6.en_khattab: There is no moving creature on earth
whose provision is not guaranteed by Allah
And He knows where it lives and where it is laid to rest
All is ˹written˺ in a perfect Record

11:7.qpc_hafs: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٖ
11:7.en_khattab: He is the One Who created the heavens and the earth in six Days
—and His Throne was upon the waters—
in order to test which of you is best in deeds

11:7.qpc_hafs: وَلَئِن قُلۡتَ إِنَّكُم مَّبۡعُوثُونَ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ ٱلۡمَوۡتِ
11:7.en_khattab: And if you ˹O Prophet˺ say, “Surely you will ˹all˺ be raised up after death,

11:7.qpc_hafs: لَيَقُولَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓاْ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ مُّبِينٞ
11:7.en_khattab: the disbelievers will certainly say, “That is nothing but pure magic!”

11:8.en_khattab: And if We delay their punishment
they will definitely say, what is holding it back

11:8.qpc_hafs: أَلَا يَوۡمَ يَأۡتِيهِمۡ لَيۡسَ مَصۡرُوفًا عَنۡهُمۡ
11:8.en_khattab: Indeed, on the Day it overtakes them, it will not be averted from them

11:8.qpc_hafs: وَحَاقَ بِهِم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
11:8.en_khattab: and they will be overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule

11:9.en_khattab: If We give people a taste of Our mercy
then take it away from them

11:10.qpc_hafs: وَلَئِنۡ أَذَقۡنَٰهُ نَعۡمَآءَ بَعۡدَ ضَرَّآءَ مَسَّتۡهُ
11:10.en_khattab: But if We give them a taste of prosperity after being touched with adversity,
and become totally prideful and boastful,

11:11.en_khattab: except those who patiently endure and do good.
It is they who will have forgiveness and a mighty reward.

11:12.qpc_hafs: فَلَعَلَّكَ تَارِكُۢ بَعۡضَ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَيۡكَ
11:12.en_khattab: Perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ may wish to give up some of what is revealed to you
and may be distressed by it because

11:12.qpc_hafs: أَن يَقُولُواْ لَوۡلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيۡهِ كَنزٌ أَوۡ جَآءَ مَعَهُۥ مَلَكٌۚ
11:12.en_khattab: they say, 'If only a treasure had been sent down to him or an angel had come with him!'
and Allah is the Trustee of All Affairs

11:13.en_khattab: Or do they say, “He has fabricated this ˹Quran˺!”?

11:13.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ فَأۡتُواْ بِعَشۡرِ سُوَرٖ مِّثۡلِهِۦ مُفۡتَرَيَٰتٖ
11:13.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Produce ten fabricated sûrahs like it

11:13.qpc_hafs: وَٱدۡعُواْ مَنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ
11:13.en_khattab: and seek help from whoever you can— other than Allah— if what you say is true!

11:14.en_khattab: But if your helpers fail you
then know that it has been revealed with the knowledge of Allah
and that there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him!

11:15.en_khattab: We will pay them in full for their deeds in this life

11:16.qpc_hafs: لَيۡسَ لَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ إِلَّا ٱلنَّارُۖ
11:16.en_khattab: will have nothing in the Hereafter except the Fire.
Their efforts in this life will be fruitless
and their deeds will be useless.

11:17.qpc_hafs: أَفَمَن كَانَ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٖ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ
11:17.en_khattab: ˹Can these people be compared to˺ those ˹believers˺ who stand on clear proof from their Lord
backed by ˹the Quran as˺ a witness from Him

11:17.qpc_hafs: وَمِن قَبۡلِهِۦ كِتَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِمَامٗا وَرَحۡمَةًۚ
11:17.en_khattab: and preceded by the Book of Moses ˹which was revealed˺ as a guide and mercy
It is those ˹believers˺ who have faith in it

11:17.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يَكۡفُرۡ بِهِۦ مِنَ ٱلۡأَحۡزَابِ فَٱلنَّارُ مَوۡعِدُهُۥۚ
11:17.en_khattab: But whoever from the ˹disbelieving˺ groups rejects it, the Fire will be their destiny
So do not be in doubt of it
It is certainly the truth from your Lord
but most people do not believe

11:18.qpc_hafs: وَمَنۡ أَظۡلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفۡتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًاۚ
11:18.en_khattab: Who does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah?
They will be brought before their Lord,

11:18.qpc_hafs: وَيَقُولُ ٱلۡأَشۡهَٰدُ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَبُواْ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِمۡۚ
11:18.en_khattab: and the witnesses will say, “These are the ones who lied against their Lord.”
Surely Allah’s condemnation is upon the wrongdoers,

11:20.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ لَمۡ يَكُونُواْ مُعۡجِزِينَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ
11:20.en_khattab: They will never frustrate Allah on earth

11:20.qpc_hafs: وَمَا كَانَ لَهُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِنۡ أَوۡلِيَآءَۘ
11:20.en_khattab: and they will have no protector besides Allah

11:20.qpc_hafs: مَا كَانُواْ يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ ٱلسَّمۡعَ وَمَا كَانُواْ يُبۡصِرُونَ
11:20.en_khattab: for they failed to hear or see ˹the truth˺

11:21.en_khattab: It is they who have ruined themselves,
and whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them.

11:23.en_khattab: and humble themselves before their Lord
will be the residents of Paradise.

11:24.en_khattab: The example of these two parties
is that of the blind and the deaf, compared to the seeing and the hearing.
Will you not then be mindful?

11:25.en_khattab: Surely We sent Noah to his people.
He said, 'Indeed, I am sent to you

11:26.en_khattab: that you should worship none but Allah.
I truly fear for you the torment

11:27.qpc_hafs: فَقَالَ ٱلۡمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن قَوۡمِهِۦ
11:27.en_khattab: The disbelieving chiefs of his people said,
We see you only as a human being like ourselves,

11:27.qpc_hafs: وَمَا نَرَىٰكَ ٱتَّبَعَكَ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ أَرَاذِلُنَا
11:27.en_khattab: and we see that no one follows you except the lowliest among us,

11:27.qpc_hafs: وَمَا نَرَىٰ لَكُمۡ عَلَيۡنَا مِن فَضۡلِۭ
11:27.en_khattab: We do not see anything that makes ˹all of˺ you any better than us.
In fact, we think you are liars.

11:28.qpc_hafs: أَرَءَيۡتُمۡ إِن كُنتُ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٖ مِّن رَّبِّي وَءَاتَىٰنِي رَحۡمَةٗ مِّنۡ عِندِهِۦ
11:28.en_khattab: Consider if I stand on a clear proof from my Lord and He has blessed me with a mercy from Himself,
Should we ˹then˺ force it on you

11:29.en_khattab: O my people! I do not ask you for a payment for this ˹message˺.
My reward is only from Allah.
And I will never dismiss the believers.
For they will surely meet their Lord.
But I can see that you are a people acting ignorantly.

11:30.en_khattab: Who would protect me from Allah
if I were to dismiss them
Will you not then be mindful?

11:31.en_khattab: I do not say to you
nor do I claim to be an angel,
grant goodness to those you look down upon.
Allah will never grant goodness to them
Allah knows best what is ˹hidden˺ within them. ˹If
I did,˺ then I would truly be one of the wrongdoers.”

11:32.en_khattab: You have argued with us far too much
so bring upon us what you threaten us with
if what you say is true.

11:33.en_khattab: He responded, 'It is Allah Who can bring it upon you

11:34.en_khattab: My advice will not benefit you—

11:34.qpc_hafs: إِن كَانَ ٱللَّهُ يُرِيدُ أَن يُغۡوِيَكُمۡۚ
11:34.en_khattab: try— if Allah wills ˹for˺ you to stray.
He is your Lord, and to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.”

11:35.en_khattab: Or do they say, “He has fabricated this ˹Quran˺!”?
Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If I have done so, then I bear the burden of that sin!
But I am free from your sinful accusation.

11:36.en_khattab: And it was revealed to Noah,

11:36.qpc_hafs: أَنَّهُۥ لَن يُؤۡمِنَ مِن قَوۡمِكَ إِلَّا مَن قَدۡ ءَامَنَ
11:36.en_khattab: “None of your people will believe except those who already have.
So do not be distressed by what they have been doing.

11:37.en_khattab: and do not plead with Me for those who have done wrong
for they will surely be drowned

11:38.en_khattab: So he began to build the Ark

11:38.qpc_hafs: وَكُلَّمَا مَرَّ عَلَيۡهِ مَلَأٞ مِّن قَوۡمِهِۦ
11:38.en_khattab: and whenever some of the chiefs of his people passed by
He said, “If you laugh at us

11:39.en_khattab: You will soon come to know
who will be visited by a humiliating torment ˹in this life˺
and overwhelmed by an everlasting punishment ˹in the next˺.”

11:40.en_khattab: and the oven burst with water
We said to Noah, “Take into the Ark
a pair from every species along with your family

11:40.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا مَن سَبَقَ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلۡقَوۡلُ وَمَنۡ ءَامَنَۚ
11:40.en_khattab: except those against whom the decree to drown has already been passed and those who believe
But none believed with him except for a few

11:41.en_khattab: In the Name of Allah it will sail and cast anchor.
Surely my Lord is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

11:42.qpc_hafs: وَهِيَ تَجۡرِي بِهِمۡ فِي مَوۡجٖ كَٱلۡجِبَالِ
11:42.en_khattab: And ˹so˺ the Ark sailed with them through waves like mountains.
Noah called out to his son
“O my dear son! Come aboard with us
and do not be with the disbelievers.

11:43.en_khattab: I will take refuge on a mountain, which will protect me from the water.

11:43.qpc_hafs: قَالَ لَا عَاصِمَ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ مِنۡ أَمۡرِ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا مَن رَّحِمَۚ
11:43.en_khattab: Noah cried, “Today no one is protected from Allah’s decree except those to whom He shows mercy!”

11:43.qpc_hafs: وَحَالَ بَيۡنَهُمَا ٱلۡمَوۡجُ فَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُغۡرَقِينَ
11:43.en_khattab: And the waves came between them, and his son was among the drowned.

11:44.en_khattab: And it was said, “O earth! Swallow up your water.
The floodwater receded and the decree was carried out.
The Ark rested on Mount Judi,
and it was said, “Away with the wrongdoing people!”

11:45.en_khattab: Noah called out to his Lord,
My Lord! Certainly my son is ˹also˺ of my family,
and You are the most just of all judges!

11:46.en_khattab: He is certainly not of your family—
he was entirely of unrighteous conduct.

11:46.qpc_hafs: فَلَا تَسۡـَٔلۡنِ مَا لَيۡسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلۡمٌۖ
11:46.en_khattab: So do not ask Me about what you have no knowledge of!

11:46.qpc_hafs: إِنِّيٓ أَعِظُكَ أَن تَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡجَٰهِلِينَ
11:46.en_khattab: I warn you so you do not fall into ignorance.

11:47.en_khattab: My Lord, I seek refuge in You

11:47.qpc_hafs: أَنۡ أَسۡـَٔلَكَ مَا لَيۡسَ لِي بِهِۦ عِلۡمٞۖ
11:47.en_khattab: from asking You about what I have no knowledge of,
and unless You forgive me and have mercy on me,
I will be one of the losers.

11:48.en_khattab: with Our peace and blessings on you
and some of the descendants of those with you.
As for the others, We will allow them ˹a brief˺ enjoyment,
then they will be touched with a painful punishment from Us.

11:49.en_khattab: This is one of the stories of the unseen,
which we reveal to you ˹O Prophet˺.

11:49.qpc_hafs: مَا كُنتَ تَعۡلَمُهَآ أَنتَ وَلَا قَوۡمُكَ مِن قَبۡلِ هَٰذَاۖ
11:49.en_khattab: Neither you nor your people knew it before this.
Surely the ultimate outcome belongs ˹only˺ to the righteous.

11:50.en_khattab: And to the people of ’Âd We sent their brother Hûd.
He said, “O my people! Worship Allah.
You have no god other than Him.
You do nothing but fabricate lies ˹against Allah˺.

11:51.en_khattab: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺.

11:51.qpc_hafs: إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱلَّذِي فَطَرَنِيٓۚ
11:51.en_khattab: My reward is only from the One Who created me.

11:52.en_khattab: Seek your Lord’s forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance.
He will shower you with rain in abundance.
And add strength to your strength.
So do not turn away, persisting in wickedness.

11:53.en_khattab: O Hûd! You have not given us any clear proof,

11:53.qpc_hafs: وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِتَارِكِيٓ ءَالِهَتِنَا عَن قَوۡلِكَ
11:53.en_khattab: and we will never abandon our gods upon your word,
nor will we believe in you.

11:54.qpc_hafs: إِن نَّقُولُ إِلَّا ٱعۡتَرَىٰكَ بَعۡضُ ءَالِهَتِنَا بِسُوٓءٖۗ
11:54.en_khattab: All we can say is that some of our gods have possessed you with evil.

11:54.qpc_hafs: قَالَ إِنِّيٓ أُشۡهِدُ ٱللَّهَ وَٱشۡهَدُوٓاْ أَنِّي بَرِيٓءٞ مِّمَّا تُشۡرِكُونَ
11:54.en_khattab: He said, “I call Allah to witness, and you too bear witness, that I ˹totally˺ reject whatever you associate

11:55.en_khattab: So let all of you plot against me

11:56.qpc_hafs: إِنِّي تَوَكَّلۡتُ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ رَبِّي وَرَبِّكُمۚ
11:56.en_khattab: I have put my trust in Allah— my Lord and your Lord.

11:56.qpc_hafs: مَّا مِن دَآبَّةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ ءَاخِذُۢ بِنَاصِيَتِهَآۚ
11:56.en_khattab: There is no living creature that is not completely under His control.
Surely my Lord’s Way is perfect justice.

11:57.qpc_hafs: فَقَدۡ أَبۡلَغۡتُكُم مَّآ أُرۡسِلۡتُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَيۡكُمۡۚ
11:57.en_khattab: I have already delivered to you what I have been sent with.
My Lord will replace you with others.
You are not harming Him in the least.

11:57.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ رَبِّي عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٍ حَفِيظٞ
11:57.en_khattab: Indeed, my Lord is a ˹vigilant˺ Keeper over all things.

11:58.qpc_hafs: نَجَّيۡنَا هُودٗا وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مَعَهُۥ بِرَحۡمَةٖ مِّنَّا
11:58.en_khattab: We rescued Hûd and those who believed with him by a mercy from Us
saving them from a harsh torment.

11:59.en_khattab: They denied the signs of their Lord,
and followed the command of every stubborn tyrant.

11:60.en_khattab: They were followed by a curse in this world,
as they will be on the Day of Judgment.
So away with ’Âd, the people of Hûd.

11:61.en_khattab: And to the people of Thamûd We sent their brother Ṣâliḥ.

11:61.qpc_hafs: قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنۡ إِلَٰهٍ غَيۡرُهُۥۖ
11:61.en_khattab: He said, “O my people! Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him.

11:61.qpc_hafs: هُوَ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَٱسۡتَعۡمَرَكُمۡ فِيهَا
11:61.en_khattab: He ˹is the One Who˺ produced you from the earth and settled you on it.
So seek His forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance.
Surely my Lord is Ever Near, All-Responsive ˹to prayers˺.

11:62.en_khattab: We truly had high hopes in you before this.
to worship what our forefathers had worshipped?

11:62.qpc_hafs: وَإِنَّنَا لَفِي شَكّٖ مِّمَّا تَدۡعُونَآ إِلَيۡهِ
11:62.en_khattab: We are certainly in alarming doubt about what you are inviting us to.”

11:63.qpc_hafs: أَرَءَيۡتُمۡ إِن كُنتُ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٖ مِّن رَّبِّي
11:63.en_khattab: Consider if I stand on a clear proof from my Lord
and He has blessed me with a mercy from Him

11:63.qpc_hafs: فَمَن يَنصُرُنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهِ إِنۡ عَصَيۡتُهُۥۖ
11:63.en_khattab: Who could help me against Allah if I were to disobey Him?
You would only contribute to my doom.

11:64.en_khattab: And O my people! This she-camel of Allah
So leave her to graze ˹freely˺ on Allah’s earth
or a swift punishment will overtake you!”

11:65.qpc_hafs: فَقَالَ تَمَتَّعُواْ فِي دَارِكُمۡ ثَلَٰثَةَ أَيَّامٖۖ
11:65.en_khattab: so he warned ˹them˺, “You have ˹only˺ three ˹more˺ days to enjoy life in your homes

11:66.en_khattab: We saved Ṣâliḥ and those who believed with him
and spared them the disgrace of that Day
Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ is the All-Powerful, Almighty.

11:67.en_khattab: And the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook the wrongdoers,
so they fell lifeless in their homes,

11:68.en_khattab: as if they had never lived there

11:69.en_khattab: And surely Our messenger-angels came to Abraham with good news ˹of a son˺.

11:69.qpc_hafs: فَمَا لَبِثَ أَن جَآءَ بِعِجۡلٍ حَنِيذٖ
11:69.en_khattab: Then it was not long before he brought ˹them˺ a ˹fat,˺ roasted calf.

11:70.en_khattab: And when he saw that their hands
the food, he became suspicious and fearful of them.
We are ˹angels˺ sent ˹only˺ against the people of Lot.

11:71.en_khattab: And his wife was standing by,
then We gave her good news of ˹the birth of˺ Isaac,

11:72.en_khattab: “Oh, my! How can I have a child in this old age,
and my husband here is an old man?
This is truly an astonishing thing!

11:73.en_khattab: They responded, “Are you astonished by Allah’s decree?

11:73.qpc_hafs: رَحۡمَتُ ٱللَّهِ وَبَرَكَٰتُهُۥ عَلَيۡكُمۡ أَهۡلَ ٱلۡبَيۡتِۚ
11:73.en_khattab: May Allah’s mercy and blessings be upon you, O people of this house.

11:74.en_khattab: Then after the fear had left Abraham
and the good news had reached him
he began to plead with Us for the people of Lot.

11:76.en_khattab: Your Lord’s decree has already come,
and they will certainly be afflicted with a punishment that cannot be averted!”

11:77.en_khattab: When Our messenger-angels came to Lot
he was distressed and worried by their arrival
He said, 'This is a terrible day.'

11:78.en_khattab: And ˹the men of˺ his people— who were used to shameful deeds— came to him rushing.
He pleaded, “O my people! Here are my daughters ˹for marriage˺—they are pure for you.

11:78.qpc_hafs: قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ بَنَاتِي هُنَّ أَطۡهَرُ لَكُمۡۖ فَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ
11:78.en_khattab: So fear Allah, and do not humiliate me by disrespecting my guests.

11:78.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تُخۡزُونِ فِي ضَيۡفِيٓۖ أَلَيۡسَ مِنكُمۡ رَجُلٞ رَّشِيدٞ
11:78.en_khattab: Is there not ˹even˺ a single right-minded man among you?

11:79.qpc_hafs: مَا لَنَا فِي بَنَاتِكَ مِنۡ حَقّٖ
11:79.en_khattab: You certainly know that we have no need for your daughters.

11:80.en_khattab: “If only I had the strength ˹to resist you˺
or could rely on a strong supporter.”

11:81.en_khattab: We are the messengers of your Lord.
So travel with your family in the dark of night,
and do not let any of you look back,
She will certainly suffer the fate of the others.
Their appointed time is the morning.

11:82.en_khattab: We turned the cities upside down

11:82.qpc_hafs: وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهَا حِجَارَةٗ مِّن سِجِّيلٖ مَّنضُودٖ
11:82.en_khattab: and rained down on them clustered stones of baked clay,

11:84.en_khattab: And to the people of Midian We sent their brother Shu’aib.

11:84.qpc_hafs: قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ ٱعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنۡ إِلَٰهٍ غَيۡرُهُۥۖ
11:84.en_khattab: He said, “O my people! Worship Allah. You have no god other than Him.
And do not give short measure and weight.
I do see you in prosperity now,

11:84.qpc_hafs: وَإِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٖ مُّحِيطٖ
11:84.en_khattab: but I truly fear for you the torment of an overwhelming Day.

11:85.en_khattab: Give full measure and weigh with justice.
Do not defraud people of their property,
nor go about spreading corruption in the land.

11:86.en_khattab: What is left ˹as a lawful gain˺ by Allah is far better for you
And I am not a keeper over you.

11:87.en_khattab: “O Shu’aib! Does your prayer command you
that we should abandon what our forefathers worshipped

11:87.qpc_hafs: أَوۡ أَن نَّفۡعَلَ فِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِنَا مَا نَشَٰٓؤُاْۖ
11:87.en_khattab: or give up managing our wealth as we please?
Indeed, you are such a tolerant, sensible man!

11:88.qpc_hafs: أَرَءَيۡتُمۡ إِن كُنتُ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَةٖ مِّن رَّبِّي وَرَزَقَنِي مِنۡهُ رِزۡقًا حَسَنٗاۚ
11:88.en_khattab: Consider if I stand on a clear proof from my Lord and He has blessed me with a good provision from Him.

11:88.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَنۡ أُخَالِفَكُمۡ إِلَىٰ مَآ أَنۡهَىٰكُمۡ عَنۡهُۚ
11:88.en_khattab: I do not want to do what I am forbidding you from.

11:88.qpc_hafs: إِنۡ أُرِيدُ إِلَّا ٱلۡإِصۡلَٰحَ مَا ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُۚ
11:88.en_khattab: I only intend reform to the best of my ability.
My success comes only through Allah.
In Him I trust and to Him I turn.

11:89.en_khattab: Do not let your opposition to me lead you

11:89.qpc_hafs: أَن يُصِيبَكُم مِّثۡلُ مَآ أَصَابَ قَوۡمَ نُوحٍ أَوۡ قَوۡمَ هُودٍ أَوۡ قَوۡمَ صَٰلِحٖۚ
11:89.en_khattab: to a fate similar to that of the people of Noah, or Hûd, or Ṣâliḥ.
And the people of Lot are not far from you.

11:90.en_khattab: and turn to Him in repentance
Surely my Lord is Most Merciful, All-Loving.

11:91.en_khattab: We do not comprehend much of what you say,
and surely we see you powerless among us.
Were it not for your clan, we would have certainly stoned you,
for you are nothing to us.

11:92.en_khattab: Do you have more regard for my clan than for Allah,
turning your back on Him entirely?
Surely my Lord is Fully Aware of what you do.

11:93.en_khattab: O my people! Persist in your ways,

11:93.qpc_hafs: إِنِّي عَٰمِلٞۖ سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ مَن يَأۡتِيهِ عَذَابٞ يُخۡزِيهِ وَمَنۡ هُوَ كَٰذِبٞۖ
11:93.en_khattab: for I ˹too˺ will persist in mine. You will soon come to know who will be visited by a humiliating torment and is a liar!
And watch! I too am watching with you!

11:94.qpc_hafs: وَلَمَّا جَآءَ أَمۡرُنَا نَجَّيۡنَا شُعَيۡبٗا وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مَعَهُۥ
11:94.en_khattab: When Our command came, We saved Shu’aib and those who believed with him
And the ˹mighty˺ blast overtook the wrongdoers
so they fell lifeless in their homes

11:95.en_khattab: as if they had never lived there.

11:97.en_khattab: but they followed the command of Pharaoh,
and Pharaoh’s command was not well guided.

11:98.en_khattab: He will be before his people on the Day of Judgment
and will lead them into the Fire.
What an evil place to be led into!

11:99.en_khattab: They were followed by a curse in this ˹life˺
and ˹will receive another˺ on the Day of Judgment.
What an evil gift to receive!

11:100.en_khattab: These are accounts, We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺, of the ˹destroyed˺ cities.
while others have been mowed down.

11:101.qpc_hafs: فَمَآ أَغۡنَتۡ عَنۡهُمۡ ءَالِهَتُهُمُ ٱلَّتِي يَدۡعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَيۡءٖ
11:101.en_khattab: The gods they invoked beside Allah were of no help at all
when the command of your Lord came
and only contributed to their ruin

11:102.en_khattab: Such is the ˹crushing˺ grip of your Lord
when He seizes the societies entrenched in wrongdoing.
Indeed, His grip is ˹terribly˺ painful and severe.

11:103.en_khattab: Surely in this is a sign
for those who fear the torment of the Hereafter.
That is a Day for which humanity will be gathered
and a Day ˹that will be˺ witnessed ˹by all˺.

11:105.en_khattab: no one will dare speak except with His permission.
Some of them will be miserable, others joyful.

11:106.en_khattab: As for those bound for misery,
they will be in the Fire,
where they will be sighing and gasping,

11:107.en_khattab: as long as the heavens and the earth will endure

11:108.en_khattab: And as for those destined to joy,
they will be in Paradise, staying there
forever, as long as the heavens and the earth will endure,

11:109.en_khattab: So do not be in doubt ˹O Prophet˺

11:109.qpc_hafs: مَا يَعۡبُدُونَ إِلَّا كَمَا يَعۡبُدُ ءَابَآؤُهُم مِّن قَبۡلُۚ
11:109.en_khattab: They worship nothing except what their forefathers worshipped before ˹them˺.
And We will certainly give them their share ˹of punishment˺ in full, without any reduction.

11:110.en_khattab: Indeed, We had given Moses the Scripture,
Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord,
their differences would have been settled ˹at once˺.
They are truly in alarming doubt about it.

11:111.en_khattab: your Lord will fully pay all for
He is certainly All-Aware of what they do.

11:112.en_khattab: So be steadfast as you are commanded ˹O Prophet˺
along with those who turn ˹in submission to Allah˺ with you.
Surely He is All-Seeing of what you ˹believers˺ do.

11:113.en_khattab: And do not be inclined to the wrongdoers
or you will be touched by the Fire.

11:113.qpc_hafs: وَمَا لَكُم مِّن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مِنۡ أَوۡلِيَآءَ
11:113.en_khattab: For then you would have no protectors other than Allah,

11:114.en_khattab: Establish prayer ˹O Prophet˺ at both ends of the day
and in the early part of the night.
Surely good deeds wipe out evil deeds.
That is a reminder for the mindful.

11:116.qpc_hafs: فَلَوۡلَا كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡقُرُونِ مِن قَبۡلِكُمۡ
11:116.en_khattab: If only there had been among the ˹destroyed˺ peoples before you

11:116.qpc_hafs: أُوْلُواْ بَقِيَّةٖ يَنۡهَوۡنَ عَنِ ٱلۡفَسَادِ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ
11:116.en_khattab: ˹O believers,˺ virtuous individuals who forbade corruption in the land
other than the few We had saved ˹from the torment˺

11:116.qpc_hafs: وَٱتَّبَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ مَآ أُتۡرِفُواْ فِيهِ وَكَانُواْ مُجۡرِمِينَ
11:116.en_khattab: But the wrongdoers ˹only˺ pursued their ˹worldly˺ pleasures, becoming wicked

11:117.en_khattab: would never destroy a society unjustly

11:118.en_khattab: He would have certainly made humanity one single community, ˹of believers˺,
but they will always ˹choose to˺ differ—

11:119.en_khattab: except those shown mercy by your Lord—
and so He created them ˹to choose freely˺.
And so the Word of your Lord will be fulfilled:

11:119.qpc_hafs: لَأَمۡلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ أَجۡمَعِينَ
11:119.en_khattab: “I will surely fill up Hell with jinn and humans all together.”

11:120.en_khattab: And We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺

11:120.qpc_hafs: مِنۡ أَنۢبَآءِ ٱلرُّسُلِ مَا نُثَبِّتُ بِهِۦ فُؤَادَكَۚ
11:120.en_khattab: the stories of the messengers to reassure your heart
And there has come to you in this ˹sûrah˺ the truth
and a reminder to the believers

11:121.en_khattab: we will certainly persist in ours.

11:123.en_khattab: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs the knowledge of what is hidden in the heavens and the earth.
And to Him all matters are returned.
So worship Him and put your trust in Him.
And your Lord is never unaware of what you do.

12:1.en_khattab: These are the verses of the clear Book.

12:2.en_khattab: Indeed, We have sent it down

12:3.en_khattab: We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ the best of stories
through Our revelation of this Quran

12:3.qpc_hafs: وَإِن كُنتَ مِن قَبۡلِهِۦ لَمِنَ ٱلۡغَٰفِلِينَ
12:3.en_khattab: though before this you were totally unaware ˹of them˺.

12:4.en_khattab: ˹Remember˺ when Joseph said to his father,

12:4.qpc_hafs: يَٰٓأَبَتِ إِنِّي رَأَيۡتُ أَحَدَ عَشَرَ كَوۡكَبٗا
12:4.en_khattab: “O my dear father! Indeed I dreamt of eleven stars,
and the sun, and the moon— I saw them prostrating to me!”

12:5.en_khattab: O my dear son! Do not relate your vision to your brothers,
or they will devise a plot against you.
Surely Satan is a sworn enemy to humankind.

12:6.en_khattab: And so will your Lord choose you ˹O Joseph˺,
and teach you the interpretation of dreams,

12:6.qpc_hafs: وَيُتِمُّ نِعۡمَتَهُۥ عَلَيۡكَ وَعَلَىٰٓ ءَالِ يَعۡقُوبَ
12:6.en_khattab: and perfect His favour upon you and the descendants of

12:6.qpc_hafs: كَمَآ أَتَمَّهَا عَلَىٰٓ أَبَوَيۡكَ مِن قَبۡلُ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسۡحَٰقَۚ
12:6.en_khattab: Jacob—˹just˺ as He once perfected it upon your forefathers, Abraham and Isaac.
Surely your Lord is All-Knowing, All-Wise.”

12:7.en_khattab: Indeed, in the story of Joseph and his brothers

12:8.en_khattab: ˹to one another˺, “Surely Joseph and his brother
˹Benjamin˺ are more beloved to our father
than we, even though we are a group of so many.
Indeed, our father is clearly mistaken.

12:9.en_khattab: or cast him out to some ˹distant˺ land
so that our father's attention will be only ours
then after that you may ˹repent and˺ become righteous people!

12:10.en_khattab: But if you must do something, throw him into the bottom of a well
so perhaps he may be picked up by some travellers.”

12:11.qpc_hafs: مَا لَكَ لَا تَأۡمَ۬نَّا عَلَىٰ يُوسُفَ
12:11.en_khattab: Why do you not trust us with Joseph,
although we truly wish him well?

12:12.en_khattab: Send him out with us tomorrow
so that he may enjoy himself and play
And we will really watch over him.

12:13.en_khattab: He responded, “It would truly sadden me
if you took him away with you
and I fear that a wolf may devour him
while you are negligent of him.

12:14.en_khattab: They said, “If a wolf were to devour him,
then we would certainly be losers!”

12:15.en_khattab: And so, when they took him away

12:15.qpc_hafs: وَأَجۡمَعُوٓاْ أَن يَجۡعَلُوهُ فِي غَيَٰبَتِ ٱلۡجُبِّۚ
12:15.en_khattab: and decided to throw him into the bottom of the well
We inspired him: “˹One day˺ you will remind them of this deed of theirs
while they are unaware ˹of who you are˺.

12:16.en_khattab: Then they returned to their father

12:17.qpc_hafs: إِنَّا ذَهَبۡنَا نَسۡتَبِقُ وَتَرَكۡنَا يُوسُفَ عِندَ مَتَٰعِنَا
12:17.en_khattab: We went racing and left Joseph with our belongings

12:17.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أَنتَ بِمُؤۡمِنٖ لَّنَا وَلَوۡ كُنَّا صَٰدِقِينَ
12:17.en_khattab: But you will not believe us, no matter how truthful we are.

12:18.en_khattab: And they brought his shirt, stained with false blood.

12:18.qpc_hafs: قَالَ بَلۡ سَوَّلَتۡ لَكُمۡ أَنفُسُكُمۡ أَمۡرٗاۖ
12:18.en_khattab: He responded, “No! Your souls must have tempted you to do something ˹evil˺.

12:18.qpc_hafs: فَصَبۡرٞ جَمِيلٞۖ وَٱللَّهُ ٱلۡمُسۡتَعَانُ عَلَىٰ مَا تَصِفُونَ
12:18.en_khattab: So ˹I can only endure with˺ beautiful patience! It is Allah’s help that I seek to bear your claims.

12:19.en_khattab: and they sent their water-boy who let down his bucket into the well.
He cried out, “Oh, what a great find! Here is a boy!”
And they took him secretly ˹to be sold˺ as merchandise,
but Allah is All-Knowing of what they did.

12:20.en_khattab: They ˹later˺ sold him for a cheap price
only wanting to get rid of him

12:21.qpc_hafs: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِي ٱشۡتَرَىٰهُ مِن مِّصۡرَ لِٱمۡرَأَتِهِۦٓ
12:21.en_khattab: The man from Egypt who bought him said to his wife,

12:21.qpc_hafs: أَكۡرِمِي مَثۡوَىٰهُ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَنفَعَنَآ أَوۡ نَتَّخِذَهُۥ وَلَدٗاۚ
12:21.en_khattab: "Take good care of him, perhaps he may be useful to us or we may adopt him as a son."
This is how We established Joseph in the land,
so that We might teach him the interpretation of dreams.
but most people do not know.

12:22.en_khattab: We gave him wisdom and knowledge
This is how We reward the good-doers

12:23.en_khattab: And the lady, in whose house he lived,

12:23.qpc_hafs: عَن نَّفۡسِهِۦ وَغَلَّقَتِ ٱلۡأَبۡوَٰبَ وَقَالَتۡ هَيۡتَ لَكَۚ
12:23.en_khattab: tried to seduce him. She locked the doors ˹firmly˺ and said, “Come to me!”

12:23.qpc_hafs: قَالَ مَعَاذَ ٱللَّهِۖ إِنَّهُۥ رَبِّيٓ أَحۡسَنَ مَثۡوَايَۖ
12:23.en_khattab: He replied, “Allah is my refuge! It is ˹not right to betray˺ my master, who has taken good care of me.

12:24.qpc_hafs: وَهَمَّ بِهَا لَوۡلَآ أَن رَّءَا بُرۡهَٰنَ رَبِّهِۦۚ
12:24.en_khattab: and he would have done likewise, had he not seen a sign from his Lord.
This is how We kept evil and indecency away from him,
for he was truly one of Our chosen servants.

12:25.en_khattab: and she tore his shirt from the back
only to find her husband at the door

12:25.qpc_hafs: قَالَتۡ مَا جَزَآءُ مَنۡ أَرَادَ بِأَهۡلِكَ سُوٓءًا
12:25.en_khattab: She cried, 'What is the penalty for someone who tried to violate your wife

12:25.qpc_hafs: إِلَّآ أَن يُسۡجَنَ أَوۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ
12:25.en_khattab: except imprisonment or a painful punishment?'

12:26.en_khattab: Joseph responded, “It was she who tried to seduce me.”
And a witness from her own family testified:

12:26.qpc_hafs: إِن كَانَ قَمِيصُهُۥ قُدَّ مِن قُبُلٖ فَصَدَقَتۡ وَهُوَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ
12:26.en_khattab: “If his shirt is torn from the front, then she has told the truth and he is a liar.

12:27.qpc_hafs: وَإِن كَانَ قَمِيصُهُۥ قُدَّ مِن دُبُرٖ
12:27.en_khattab: But if it is torn from the back

12:28.en_khattab: So when her husband saw that Joseph’s shirt
he said ˹to her˺, “This must be ˹an example˺ of the cunning of you ˹women˺!
Indeed, your cunning is so shrewd!

12:29.en_khattab: And you ˹O wife˺! Seek forgiveness for your sin.
It certainly has been your fault.

12:30.en_khattab: Some women of the city gossiped,

12:30.qpc_hafs: ٱمۡرَأَتُ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ تُرَٰوِدُ فَتَىٰهَا عَن نَّفۡسِهِۦۖ
12:30.en_khattab: “The Chief Minister’s wife is trying to seduce her slave-boy.
Love for him has plagued her heart.
Indeed, we see that she is clearly mistaken.

12:31.en_khattab: When she heard about their gossip,
she invited them and set a banquet for them.
She gave each one a knife,
then said ˹to Joseph˺, “Come out before them.”
When they saw him, they were so stunned ˹by his beauty˺ that they cut their hands,

12:31.qpc_hafs: وَقُلۡنَ حَٰشَ لِلَّهِ مَا هَٰذَا بَشَرًا إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا مَلَكٞ كَرِيمٞ
12:31.en_khattab: and exclaimed, “Good God! This cannot be human; this must be a noble angel!”

12:32.en_khattab: She said, “This is the one for whose love you criticized me!
I did try to seduce him but he ˹firmly˺ refused.

12:32.qpc_hafs: وَلَئِن لَّمۡ يَفۡعَلۡ مَآ ءَامُرُهُۥ لَيُسۡجَنَنَّ وَلَيَكُونٗا مِّنَ ٱلصَّٰغِرِينَ
12:32.en_khattab: And if he does not do what I order him to, he will certainly be imprisoned and ˹fully˺ disgraced.

12:33.en_khattab: My Lord! I would rather be in jail than do what they invite me to.
And if You do not turn their cunning away from me,

12:34.en_khattab: So his Lord responded to him
turning their cunning away from him
Surely He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing

12:35.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ بَدَا لَهُم مِّنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا رَأَوُاْ ٱلۡأٓيَٰتِ
12:35.en_khattab: And so it occurred to those in charge, despite seeing all the proofs ˹of his innocence˺,
that he should be imprisoned for a while.

12:36.en_khattab: And two other servants went to jail with Joseph.

12:36.qpc_hafs: فَتَيَانِۖ قَالَ أَحَدُهُمَآ إِنِّيٓ أَرَىٰنِيٓ أَعۡصِرُ خَمۡرٗاۖ
12:36.en_khattab: One of them said, “I dreamt I was pressing wine.”

12:36.qpc_hafs: وَقَالَ ٱلۡأٓخَرُ إِنِّيٓ أَرَىٰنِيٓ أَحۡمِلُ فَوۡقَ رَأۡسِي خُبۡزٗا تَأۡكُلُ ٱلطَّيۡرُ مِنۡهُۖ
12:36.en_khattab: The other said, “I dreamt I was carrying ˹some˺ bread on my head, from which birds were eating.” ˹Then both said,˺
for we surely see you as one of the good-doers.”

12:37.en_khattab: Joseph replied, “I can even tell you what kind of meal you will be served

12:37.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا نَبَّأۡتُكُمَا بِتَأۡوِيلِهِۦ قَبۡلَ أَن يَأۡتِيَكُمَاۚ
12:37.en_khattab: This ˹knowledge˺ is from what my Lord has taught me.

12:37.qpc_hafs: لَّا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَهُم بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ هُمۡ كَٰفِرُونَ
12:37.en_khattab: who disbelieve in Allah and deny the Hereafter.

12:38.qpc_hafs: وَٱتَّبَعۡتُ مِلَّةَ ءَابَآءِيٓ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَإِسۡحَٰقَ وَيَعۡقُوبَۚ
12:38.en_khattab: I follow the faith of my fathers: Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

12:38.qpc_hafs: مَا كَانَ لَنَآ أَن نُّشۡرِكَ بِٱللَّهِ مِن شَيۡءٖۚ
12:38.en_khattab: It is not ˹right˺ for us to associate anything with Allah ˹in worship˺.

12:38.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ مِن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيۡنَا وَعَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ
12:38.en_khattab: This is part of Allah’s grace upon us and humanity.
but most people are not grateful.

12:39.en_khattab: Which is far better: many different lords
or Allah— the One, the Supreme?

12:40.en_khattab: Whatever ˹idols˺ you worship instead of Him
are mere names which you and your forefathers have made up

12:40.qpc_hafs: مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلۡطَٰنٍۚ
12:40.en_khattab: a practice Allah has never authorized
It is only Allah Who decides
He has commanded that you worship none but Him
but most people do not know

12:41.en_khattab: The first one of you will serve wine to his master,
and the other will be crucified
and the birds will eat from his head.
The matter about which you inquired has been decided.

12:42.qpc_hafs: وَقَالَ لِلَّذِي ظَنَّ أَنَّهُۥ نَاجٖ مِّنۡهُمَا
12:42.en_khattab: Then he said to the one he knew would survive
“Mention me in the presence of your master.”
But Satan made him forget to mention Joseph to his master
so he remained in prison for several years.

12:43.qpc_hafs: إِنِّيٓ أَرَىٰ سَبۡعَ بَقَرَٰتٖ سِمَانٖ يَأۡكُلُهُنَّ سَبۡعٌ عِجَافٞ
12:43.en_khattab: “I dreamt of seven fat cows eaten up by seven skinny ones;
and seven green ears of grain and ˹seven˺ others dry.

12:43.qpc_hafs: فِي رُءۡيَٰيَ إِن كُنتُمۡ لِلرُّءۡيَا تَعۡبُرُونَ
12:43.en_khattab: the meaning of my dream if you can interpret dreams.”

12:44.en_khattab: and we do not know the interpretation of such dreams.

12:45.en_khattab: and said, “I will tell you its interpretation,

12:46.qpc_hafs: أَفۡتِنَا فِي سَبۡعِ بَقَرَٰتٖ سِمَانٖ يَأۡكُلُهُنَّ سَبۡعٌ عِجَافٞ
12:46.en_khattab: Interpret for us ˹the dream of˺ seven fat cows eaten up by seven skinny ones;
and seven green ears of grain and ˹seven˺ others dry,

12:46.qpc_hafs: لَّعَلِّيٓ أَرۡجِعُ إِلَى ٱلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمۡ يَعۡلَمُونَ
12:46.en_khattab: so that I may return to the people and let them know.”

12:47.en_khattab: Joseph replied, “You will plant ˹grain˺ for seven consecutive years,
leaving in the ear whatever you will harvest,
except for the little you will eat.

12:48.en_khattab: will come seven years of great hardship
which will consume whatever you have saved
except the little you will store ˹for seed˺

12:49.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ يَأۡتِي مِنۢ بَعۡدِ ذَٰلِكَ عَامٞ
12:49.en_khattab: Then after that will come a year
in which people will receive abundant rain
and they will press ˹oil and wine˺.

12:50.en_khattab: The King then said, 'Bring him to me.'
When the messenger came to him,
Joseph said, 'Go back to your master and ask him

12:50.qpc_hafs: مَا بَالُ ٱلنِّسۡوَةِ ٱلَّٰتِي قَطَّعۡنَ أَيۡدِيَهُنَّۚ
12:50.en_khattab: about the case of the women who cut their hands.
Surely my Lord has full knowledge of their cunning.'

12:51.en_khattab: "What did you get when you tried to seduce Joseph?"

12:51.qpc_hafs: قُلۡنَ حَٰشَ لِلَّهِ مَا عَلِمۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ مِن سُوٓءٖۚ
12:51.en_khattab: They replied, "Allah forbid! We know nothing indecent about him."

12:51.qpc_hafs: قَالَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتُ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡـَٰٔنَ حَصۡحَصَ ٱلۡحَقُّ
12:51.en_khattab: Then the Chief Minister’s wife admitted, "Now the truth has come to light.

12:51.qpc_hafs: أَنَا۠ رَٰوَدتُّهُۥ عَن نَّفۡسِهِۦ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
12:51.en_khattab: It was I who tried to seduce him, and he is surely truthful.

12:52.en_khattab: Joseph should know that I did not speak dishonestly about him in his absence,

12:52.qpc_hafs: وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهۡدِي كَيۡدَ ٱلۡخَآئِنِينَ
12:52.en_khattab: for Allah certainly does not guide the scheming of the dishonest.

12:53.en_khattab: And I do not seek to free myself from blame,

12:54.en_khattab: The King said, “Bring him to me.

12:55.en_khattab: Put me in charge of the store-houses of the land,

We shower Our mercy on whoever We will,

12:58.en_khattab: but they were unaware of who he really was

12:59.en_khattab: he demanded, “Bring me your brother on your father’s side.

12:59.en_khattab: Do you not see that I give full measure and I am the best of hosts?

12:61.en_khattab: They promised, “We will try to convince his father to let him come.

12:62.qpc_hafs: وَقَالَ لِفِتۡيَٰنِهِ ٱجۡعَلُواْ بِضَٰعَتَهُمۡ فِي رِحَالِهِمۡ
12:62.en_khattab: Joseph ordered his servants to put his brothers’ money back into their saddlebags

12:62.qpc_hafs: لَعَلَّهُمۡ يَعۡرِفُونَهَآ إِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓاْ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِمۡ
12:62.en_khattab: so that they would find it when they returned to their family
and perhaps they would come back.

12:63.en_khattab: When Joseph’s brothers returned to their father,
they pleaded, “O our father! We have been denied ˹further˺ supplies.
So send our brother with us
so that we may receive our measure, and we will definitely watch over him.

12:64.en_khattab: He responded, “Should I trust you with him
But ˹only˺ Allah is the best Protector,
and He is the Most Merciful of the merciful.

12:65.en_khattab: they discovered that their money had been returned to them.
They argued, “O our father! What more can we ask for?
Here is our money, fully returned to us.
Now we can buy more food for our family. We will watch over our brother,
and obtain an extra camel-load of grain.
That load can be easily secured.

12:66.en_khattab: I will not send him with you until you give me a solemn oath by Allah
that you will certainly bring him back to me,
Then after they had given him their oaths,

12:66.qpc_hafs: قَالَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ مَا نَقُولُ وَكِيلٞ
12:66.en_khattab: he concluded, 'Allah is a Witness to what we have said.'

12:67.en_khattab: “O my sons! Do not enter ˹the city˺ all through one gate,

12:67.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أُغۡنِي عَنكُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَيۡءٍۖ
12:67.en_khattab: I cannot help you against ˹what is destined by˺ Allah in the least.
It is only Allah Who decides.
In Him I put my trust.
And in Him let the faithful put their trust.”

12:68.qpc_hafs: وَلَمَّا دَخَلُواْ مِنۡ حَيۡثُ أَمَرَهُمۡ أَبُوهُم
12:68.en_khattab: Then when they entered as their father had instructed them

12:68.qpc_hafs: مَّا كَانَ يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن شَيۡءٍ إِلَّا حَاجَةٗ فِي نَفۡسِ يَعۡقُوبَ قَضَىٰهَاۚ
12:68.en_khattab: this did not help them against ˹the Will of˺ Allah whatsoever. It was just a desire in Jacob’s heart which he satisfied

12:68.qpc_hafs: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَذُو عِلۡمٖ لِّمَا عَلَّمۡنَٰهُ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
12:68.en_khattab: He was truly blessed with ˹great˺ knowledge because of what We had taught him, but most people have no knowledge

12:69.en_khattab: and confided ˹to him˺, “I am indeed your brother ˹Joseph˺
So do not feel distressed about what they have been doing.

12:70.en_khattab: When Joseph had provided them with supplies

“O people of the caravan! You must be thieves!”

12:72.en_khattab: The herald ˹along with the guards˺ replied, “We have lost the King’s measuring cup.
And whoever brings it will be awarded a camel-load ˹of grain˺.

12:73.qpc_hafs: لَقَدۡ عَلِمۡتُم مَّا جِئۡنَا لِنُفۡسِدَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ
12:73.en_khattab: “By Allah! You know well that we did not come to cause trouble in the land,

12:74.en_khattab: What should be the price for theft, if you are lying?

12:75.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ جَزَٰٓؤُهُۥ مَن وُجِدَ فِي رَحۡلِهِۦ
12:75.en_khattab: Joseph’s brothers responded, “The price will be ˹the enslavement of˺
the one in whose bag the cup is found.
That is how we punish the wrongdoers.

12:76.en_khattab: Joseph began searching their bags before that of his brother ˹Benjamin˺
then brought it out of Benjamin’s bag
This is how We inspired Joseph to plan

12:76.qpc_hafs: مَا كَانَ لِيَأۡخُذَ أَخَاهُ فِي دِينِ ٱلۡمَلِكِ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ
12:76.en_khattab: He could not have taken his brother under the King’s law, but Allah had so willed
We elevate in rank whoever We will
But above those ranking in knowledge is the One All-Knowing

12:77.qpc_hafs: فَقَدۡ سَرَقَ أَخٞ لَّهُۥ مِن قَبۡلُۚ
12:77.en_khattab: “If he has stolen, so did his ˹full˺ brother before.”

12:77.qpc_hafs: فَأَسَرَّهَا يُوسُفُ فِي نَفۡسِهِۦ وَلَمۡ يُبۡدِهَا لَهُمۡۚ
12:77.en_khattab: But Joseph suppressed his outrage— revealing nothing to them— and
said ˹to himself˺, “You are in such an evil position,
and Allah knows best ˹the truth of˺ what you claim.”

12:78.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ لَهُۥٓ أَبٗا شَيۡخٗا كَبِيرٗا فَخُذۡ أَحَدَنَا مَكَانَهُۥٓۖ
12:78.en_khattab: He has a very old father, so take one of us instead.
We surely see you as one of the good-doers.

12:79.qpc_hafs: أَن نَّأۡخُذَ إِلَّا مَن وَجَدۡنَا مَتَٰعَنَا عِندَهُۥٓ
12:79.en_khattab: “Allah forbid that we should take other than the one with whom we found our property.

12:80.en_khattab: When they lost all hope in him, they spoke privately.

12:80.qpc_hafs: أَلَمۡ تَعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّ أَبَاكُمۡ قَدۡ أَخَذَ عَلَيۡكُم مَّوۡثِقٗا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَمِن قَبۡلُ مَا فَرَّطتُمۡ فِي يُوسُفَۖ
12:80.en_khattab: Do you not know that your father had taken a solemn oath by Allah from you, nor how you failed him regarding Joseph before?

12:80.qpc_hafs: فَلَنۡ أَبۡرَحَ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ حَتَّىٰ يَأۡذَنَ لِيٓ أَبِيٓ أَوۡ يَحۡكُمَ ٱللَّهُ لِيۖ وَهُوَ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡحَٰكِمِينَ
12:80.en_khattab: So I am not leaving this land until my father allows me to, or Allah decides for me. For He is the Best of Judges.

12:81.en_khattab: We testify only to what we know.
We could not guard against the unforeseen.

12:82.en_khattab: Ask ˹the people of˺ the land where we were
and the caravan we travelled with.
We are certainly telling the truth.’

12:83.en_khattab: “No! Your souls must have tempted you to do something ˹evil˺.
So ˹I am left with nothing but˺ beautiful patience!

12:83.qpc_hafs: عَسَى ٱللَّهُ أَن يَأۡتِيَنِي بِهِمۡ جَمِيعًاۚ
12:83.en_khattab: I trust Allah will return them all to me.
Surely He ˹alone˺ is the All-Knowing, All-Wise.

12:84.en_khattab: And his eyes turned white out of the grief

12:85.en_khattab: You will not cease to remember Joseph until

12:87.en_khattab: and search diligently for Joseph and his brother.
And do not lose hope in the mercy of Allah,

12:87.qpc_hafs: إِنَّهُۥ لَا يَاْيۡـَٔسُ مِن رَّوۡحِ ٱللَّهِ
12:87.en_khattab: for no one loses hope in Allah’s mercy

12:88.en_khattab: When they entered Joseph’s presence, they pleaded,
“O Chief Minister! We and our family have been touched with hardship,

but ˹please˺ give us our supplies in full and be charitable to us.

12:89.en_khattab: Do you remember what you did to Joseph and his brother

12:90.en_khattab: They replied ˹in shock˺, “Are you really Joseph?”
He said, “I am Joseph, and here is my brother ˹Benjamin˺!
Allah has truly been gracious to us.
Surely whoever is mindful ˹of Allah˺ and patient

12:90.qpc_hafs: فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُضِيعُ أَجۡرَ ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ
12:90.en_khattab: then certainly Allah never discounts the reward of the good-doers.

12:91.en_khattab: “By Allah! Allah has truly preferred you over us,
and we have surely been sinful.

12:92.en_khattab: Joseph said, “There is no blame on you today.
He is the Most Merciful of the merciful!

12:93.en_khattab: Go with this shirt of mine
and cast it over my father’s face,
and he will regain his sight.
Then come back to me with your whole family.

12:94.en_khattab: their father said ˹to those around him˺,
I am senile, but I certainly sense the smell of Joseph.”
You may think I am senile,

12:95.en_khattab: You are definitely still in your old delusion.

12:96.en_khattab: But when the bearer of the good news arrived
he cast the shirt over Jacob’s face, so he regained his sight

12:96.qpc_hafs: قَالَ أَلَمۡ أَقُل لَّكُمۡ إِنِّيٓ أَعۡلَمُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
12:96.en_khattab: Jacob then said ˹to his children˺, “Did I not tell you that I truly know from Allah what you do not know?”

12:97.en_khattab: “O our father! Pray for the forgiveness of our sins.

12:98.en_khattab: He said, “I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness.
He ˹alone˺ is indeed the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

12:100.en_khattab: Then he raised his parents to the throne,
and they all fell down in prostration to Joseph,

12:100.qpc_hafs: وَقَالَ يَٰٓأَبَتِ هَٰذَا تَأۡوِيلُ رُءۡيَٰيَ مِن قَبۡلُ
12:100.en_khattab: who then said, “O my dear father! This is the interpretation of my old dream.
My Lord has made it come true.

12:100.qpc_hafs: وَقَدۡ أَحۡسَنَ بِيٓ إِذۡ أَخۡرَجَنِي مِنَ ٱلسِّجۡنِ
12:100.en_khattab: He was truly kind to me when He freed me from prison,

12:100.qpc_hafs: وَجَآءَ بِكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡبَدۡوِ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ أَن نَّزَغَ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ بَيۡنِي وَبَيۡنَ إِخۡوَتِيٓۚ
12:100.en_khattab: and brought you all from the desert after Satan had ignited rivalry between me and my siblings.
Indeed my Lord is subtle in fulfilling what He wills.
Surely He ˹alone˺ is the All-Knowing, All-Wise.

12:101.en_khattab: My Lord! You have surely granted me authority
and taught me the interpretation of dreams.
˹O˺ Originator of the heavens and the earth!
You are my Guardian in this world and the Hereafter.
Allow me to die as one who submits
and join me with the righteous.

12:102.en_khattab: That is from the stories of the unseen
which We reveal to you ˹O Prophet˺

12:102.qpc_hafs: وَمَا كُنتَ لَدَيۡهِمۡ إِذۡ أَجۡمَعُوٓاْ أَمۡرَهُمۡ
12:102.en_khattab: You were not present when they ˹all˺ made up their minds

12:103.en_khattab: will not believe— no matter how keen you are—

12:104.en_khattab: even though you are not asking them for a reward
for this ˹Quran˺. It is only a reminder

12:105.en_khattab: How many signs in the heavens and the earth

without associating others with Him ˹in worship˺

12:107.qpc_hafs: أَن تَأۡتِيَهُمۡ غَٰشِيَةٞ مِّنۡ عَذَابِ ٱللَّهِ
12:107.en_khattab: that an overwhelming torment from Allah will not overtake them
or that the Hour will not take them by surprise

12:108.en_khattab: with insight— I and those who follow me.
and I am not one of the polytheists.”

12:109.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا مِن قَبۡلِكَ إِلَّا رِجَالٗا نُّوحِيٓ إِلَيۡهِم مِّنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡقُرَىٰٓۗ
12:109.en_khattab: We only sent before you ˹O Prophet˺ men inspired by Us from among the people of each society.

12:109.qpc_hafs: أَفَلَمۡ يَسِيرُواْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَيَنظُرُواْ كَيۡفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡۗ
12:109.en_khattab: Have the deniers not travelled through the land to see what was the end of those ˹destroyed˺ before them?
And surely the ˹eternal˺ Home of the Hereafter is far better for those mindful ˹of Allah˺.

12:110.en_khattab: and their people thought the messengers had been denied help
Our help came to them ˹at last˺
We then saved whoever We willed

12:110.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يُرَدُّ بَأۡسُنَا عَنِ ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ
12:110.en_khattab: and Our punishment is never averted from the wicked people

12:111.en_khattab: In their stories there is truly a lesson
This message cannot be a fabrication,
rather ˹it is˺ a confirmation of previous revelation,
a detailed explanation of all things,

13:1.en_khattab: These are the verses of the Book.

13:1.qpc_hafs: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أُنزِلَ إِلَيۡكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ ٱلۡحَقُّ
13:1.en_khattab: What has been revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺ from your Lord is the truth,
but most people do not believe.

13:2.qpc_hafs: ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِي رَفَعَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ بِغَيۡرِ عَمَدٖ تَرَوۡنَهَاۖ
13:2.en_khattab: It is Allah Who has raised the heavens without pillars— as you can see—
then established Himself on the Throne.
He has subjected the sun and the moon,
each orbiting for an appointed term.

13:2.qpc_hafs: يُفَصِّلُ ٱلۡأٓيَٰتِ لَعَلَّكُم بِلِقَآءِ رَبِّكُمۡ تُوقِنُونَ
13:2.en_khattab: He makes the signs clear so that you may be certain of the meeting with your Lord.

13:3.en_khattab: And He is the One Who spread out the earth
and placed firm mountains and rivers upon it

13:3.qpc_hafs: وَمِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ جَعَلَ فِيهَا زَوۡجَيۡنِ ٱثۡنَيۡنِۖ
13:3.en_khattab: and created fruits of every kind in pairs
He covers the day with night

13:3.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَٰتٖ لِّقَوۡمٖ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
13:3.en_khattab: Surely in this are signs for those who reflect

13:4.en_khattab: And on the earth there are ˹different˺ neighbouring tracts,
˹various˺ crops, palm trees— some stemming from the same root,
others standing alone. They are all irrigated with the same water,

13:4.qpc_hafs: وَٰحِدٖ وَنُفَضِّلُ بَعۡضَهَا عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ فِي ٱلۡأُكُلِۚ
13:4.en_khattab: yet We make some taste better than others. Surely in this are signs for those

13:4.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَٰتٖ لِّقَوۡمٖ يَعۡقِلُونَ

13:5.en_khattab: ˹Now,˺ if anything should amaze you ˹O Prophet˺
then it is their question: “When we are reduced to dust
will we really be raised as a new creation?”
It is they who have disbelieved in their Lord.
It is they who will have shackles around their necks.
And it is they who will be the residents of the Fire.

13:6.en_khattab: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ to hasten the torment rather than grace
though there have ˹already˺ been ˹many˺ torments before them

13:6.qpc_hafs: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو مَغۡفِرَةٖ لِّلنَّاسِ عَلَىٰ ظُلۡمِهِمۡۖ
13:6.en_khattab: Surely your Lord is full of forgiveness for people, despite their wrongdoing
and your Lord is truly severe in punishment

13:7.qpc_hafs: لَوۡلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيۡهِ ءَايَةٞ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦٓۗ
13:7.en_khattab: If only a sign could be sent down to him from his Lord.
You ˹O Prophet˺ are only a warner.
And every people had a guide.

13:8.qpc_hafs: ٱللَّهُ يَعۡلَمُ مَا تَحۡمِلُ كُلُّ أُنثَىٰ
13:8.en_khattab: Allah knows what every female bears
and what increases and decreases in the wombs
And with Him everything is determined

13:9.en_khattab: ˹He is the˺ Knower of the seen and the unseen—

13:10.en_khattab: whether any of you speaks secretly
whether one hides in the darkness of night
