13:11.en_khattab: For each one there are successive angels before

13:11.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُغَيِّرُ مَا بِقَوۡمٍ حَتَّىٰ يُغَيِّرُواْ مَا بِأَنفُسِهِمۡۗ
13:11.en_khattab: Indeed, Allah would never change a people’s state ˹of favour˺ until they change their own state ˹of faith˺.
And if it is Allah’s Will to torment a people,

13:11.qpc_hafs: وَمَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ مِن وَالٍ
13:11.en_khattab: nor can they find a protector other than Him.

13:13.en_khattab: as do the angels in awe of Him.

13:13.qpc_hafs: وَيُرۡسِلُ ٱلصَّوَٰعِقَ فَيُصِيبُ بِهَا مَن يَشَآءُ
13:13.en_khattab: He sends thunderbolts, striking with them whoever He wills.
And He is tremendous in might.

13:14.en_khattab: Calling upon Him ˹alone˺ is the truth. But those ˹idols˺

13:14.qpc_hafs: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَدۡعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ لَا يَسۡتَجِيبُونَ لَهُم بِشَيۡءٍ
13:14.en_khattab: the pagans invoke besides Him ˹can˺ never respond to them in any way.

13:14.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا كَبَٰسِطِ كَفَّيۡهِ إِلَى ٱلۡمَآءِ لِيَبۡلُغَ فَاهُ وَمَا هُوَ بِبَٰلِغِهِۦۚ
13:14.en_khattab: ˹It is˺ just like someone who stretches out their hands to water, ˹asking it˺ to reach their mouths, but it can never do so.

13:14.qpc_hafs: وَمَا دُعَآءُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَٰلٖ
13:14.en_khattab: The calls of the disbelievers are only in vain.

13:15.qpc_hafs: وَلِلَّهِۤ يَسۡجُدُۤ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ
13:15.en_khattab: To Allah ˹alone˺ bow down ˹in submission˺ all those in the heavens and the earth
as do their shadows, morning and evening

13:16.en_khattab: Ask ˹them, O  Prophet˺, “Who is the Lord of the heavens and the earth?”

13:16.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ أَفَٱتَّخَذۡتُم مِّن دُونِهِۦٓ أَوۡلِيَآءَ لَا يَمۡلِكُونَ لِأَنفُسِهِمۡ نَفۡعٗا وَلَا ضَرّٗاۚ
13:16.en_khattab: Ask ˹them˺, “Why ˹then˺ have you taken besides Him lords who cannot even benefit or protect themselves?”

13:16.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ هَلۡ يَسۡتَوِي ٱلۡأَعۡمَىٰ وَٱلۡبَصِيرُ أَمۡ هَلۡ تَسۡتَوِي ٱلظُّلُمَٰتُ وَٱلنُّورُۗ
13:16.en_khattab: Say, “Can the blind and the sighted be equal? Or can darkness and light be equal?”

13:16.qpc_hafs: أَمۡ جَعَلُواْ لِلَّهِ شُرَكَآءَ خَلَقُواْ كَخَلۡقِهِۦ فَتَشَٰبَهَ ٱلۡخَلۡقُ عَلَيۡهِمۡۚ
13:16.en_khattab: Or have they associated with Allah partners who ˹supposedly˺ produced a creation like His, leaving them confused between the two creations?

13:16.qpc_hafs: قُلِ ٱللَّهُ خَٰلِقُ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ وَهُوَ ٱلۡوَٰحِدُ ٱلۡقَهَّٰرُ
13:16.en_khattab: Say, “Allah is the Creator of all things, and He is the One, the Supreme.”

13:17.en_khattab: He sends down rain from the sky,
causing the valleys to flow, each according to its capacity.
The currents then carry along rising foam,

13:17.qpc_hafs: وَمِمَّا يُوقِدُونَ عَلَيۡهِ فِي ٱلنَّارِ ٱبۡتِغَآءَ حِلۡيَةٍ أَوۡ مَتَٰعٖ
13:17.en_khattab: similar to the slag produced from metal that people melt in the fire for ornaments or tools.

13:17.qpc_hafs: زَبَدٞ مِّثۡلُهُۥۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَضۡرِبُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡحَقَّ وَٱلۡبَٰطِلَۚ
13:17.en_khattab: This is how Allah compares truth to falsehood.
The ˹worthless˺ residue is then cast away,

13:17.qpc_hafs: وَأَمَّا مَا يَنفَعُ ٱلنَّاسَ فَيَمۡكُثُ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ
13:17.en_khattab: but what benefits people remains on the earth.
This is how Allah sets forth parables.

13:18.en_khattab: Those who respond to ˹the call of˺ their Lord will have the finest reward.

13:18.qpc_hafs: وَٱلَّذِينَ لَمۡ يَسۡتَجِيبُواْ لَهُۥ لَوۡ أَنَّ لَهُم مَّا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا وَمِثۡلَهُۥ مَعَهُۥ لَٱفۡتَدَوۡاْ بِهِۦٓۚ
13:18.en_khattab: As for those who do not respond to Him, even if they were to possess everything in the world twice over, they would certainly offer it to ransom themselves.

13:18.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ لَهُمۡ سُوٓءُ ٱلۡحِسَابِ وَمَأۡوَىٰهُمۡ جَهَنَّمُۖ وَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمِهَادُ
13:18.en_khattab: They will face strict judgment, and Hell will be their home. What an evil place to rest!

13:19.qpc_hafs: أَنَّمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيۡكَ مِن رَّبِّكَ ٱلۡحَقُّ
13:19.en_khattab: that your Lord’s revelation to you ˹O Prophet˺ is the truth
be like the one who is blind?
None will be mindful ˹of this˺ except people of reason.

13:20.en_khattab: ˹They are˺ those who honour Allah’s covenant,

13:21.qpc_hafs: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَصِلُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ
13:21.en_khattab: and those who maintain whatever ˹ties˺ Allah has ordered to be maintained
stand in awe of their Lord

13:22.en_khattab: And ˹they are˺ those who endure patiently,
donate from what We have provided for them— secretly and openly—
and respond to evil with good.
It is they who will have the ultimate abode:

13:23.en_khattab: the Gardens of Eternity, which they will enter

13:23.qpc_hafs: وَمَن صَلَحَ مِنۡ ءَابَآئِهِمۡ وَأَزۡوَٰجِهِمۡ وَذُرِّيَّٰتِهِمۡۖ
13:23.en_khattab: along with the righteous among their parents, spouses, and descendants

13:23.qpc_hafs: وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ يَدۡخُلُونَ عَلَيۡهِم مِّن كُلِّ بَابٖ
13:23.en_khattab: And the angels will enter upon them from every gate ˹saying,˺

13:24.en_khattab: How excellent is the ultimate abode!”

13:25.qpc_hafs: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَنقُضُونَ عَهۡدَ ٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مِيثَٰقِهِۦ
13:25.en_khattab: And those who violate Allah’s covenant after it has been affirmed,

13:25.qpc_hafs: وَيَقۡطَعُونَ مَآ أَمَرَ ٱللَّهُ بِهِۦٓ أَن يُوصَلَ
13:25.en_khattab: break whatever ˹ties˺ Allah has ordered to be maintained,
and spread corruption in the land
it is they who will be condemned
and will have the worst abode

13:26.qpc_hafs: ٱللَّهُ يَبۡسُطُ ٱلرِّزۡقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَقۡدِرُۚ
13:26.en_khattab: Allah gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills.
And the disbelievers become prideful of ˹the pleasures of˺ this worldly life.

13:26.qpc_hafs: وَمَا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنۡيَا فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ إِلَّا مَتَٰعٞ
13:26.en_khattab: But the life of this world, compared to the Hereafter, is nothing but a fleeting enjoyment.

13:27.qpc_hafs: لَوۡلَآ أُنزِلَ عَلَيۡهِ ءَايَةٞ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦۚ
13:27.en_khattab: If only a sign could be sent down to him from his Lord.

13:27.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَآءُ
13:27.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Indeed, Allah leaves to stray whoever He wills
and guides to Himself whoever turns to Him—

13:28.en_khattab: and whose hearts find comfort in the remembrance of Allah
Surely in the remembrance of Allah do hearts find comfort

13:30.en_khattab: And so We have sent you

13:30.qpc_hafs: فِيٓ أُمَّةٖ قَدۡ خَلَتۡ مِن قَبۡلِهَآ أُمَمٞ
13:30.en_khattab: ˹O Prophet˺ to a community, like ˹We did with˺ earlier communities,
so that you may recite to them what We have revealed to you.
Yet they deny the Most Compassionate.
There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him.
In Him I put my trust,
and to Him I turn ˹in repentance˺.

13:31.qpc_hafs: وَلَوۡ أَنَّ قُرۡءَانٗا سُيِّرَتۡ بِهِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ أَوۡ قُطِّعَتۡ بِهِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ أَوۡ كُلِّمَ بِهِ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰۗ
13:31.en_khattab: If there were a recitation that could cause mountains to move, or the earth to split, or the dead to speak,
it would have been this Quran˺. But all matters are by Allah’s Will.

13:31.qpc_hafs: أَفَلَمۡ يَاْيۡـَٔسِ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ أَن لَّوۡ يَشَآءُ ٱللَّهُ لَهَدَى ٱلنَّاسَ جَمِيعٗاۗ
13:31.en_khattab: Have the believers not yet realized that had Allah willed, He could have guided all of humanity?

13:31.qpc_hafs: وَلَا يَزَالُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ تُصِيبُهُم بِمَا صَنَعُواْ قَارِعَةٌ أَوۡ تَحُلُّ قَرِيبٗا مِّن دَارِهِمۡ حَتَّىٰ يَأۡتِيَ وَعۡدُ ٱللَّهِۚ
13:31.en_khattab: And disasters will continue to afflict the disbelievers or strike close to their homes for their misdeeds, until Allah’s promise comes to pass.
Surely Allah never fails in His promise.

13:32.en_khattab: Other messengers had already been ridiculed before you
but I delayed the disbelievers ˹for a while˺ then seized them

13:33.qpc_hafs: أَفَمَنۡ هُوَ قَآئِمٌ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ نَفۡسِۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتۡۗ
13:33.en_khattab: Is ˹there any equal to˺ the Vigilant One Who knows what every soul commits?
Yet the pagans have associated others with Allah ˹in worship˺. Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Name them!

13:33.qpc_hafs: أَمۡ تُنَبِّـُٔونَهُۥ بِمَا لَا يَعۡلَمُ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ
13:33.en_khattab: Or do you ˹mean to˺ inform Him of something He does not know on the earth?

13:33.qpc_hafs: أَم بِظَٰهِرٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡقَوۡلِۗ بَلۡ زُيِّنَ لِلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مَكۡرُهُمۡ
13:33.en_khattab: Or are these ˹gods˺ just empty words? In fact, the disbelievers’ falsehood has been made so appealing to them

13:33.qpc_hafs: وَصُدُّواْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِۗ وَمَن يُضۡلِلِ ٱللَّهُ فَمَا لَهُۥ مِنۡ هَادٖ
13:33.en_khattab: that they have been turned away from the Path. And whoever Allah leaves to stray will be left with no guide.

13:34.en_khattab: For them is punishment in this worldly life,
but the punishment of the Hereafter is truly far worse.

13:34.qpc_hafs: وَمَا لَهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَاقٖ
13:34.en_khattab: And none can shield them from Allah.

13:35.en_khattab: The description of the Paradise promised to the righteous
is that under it rivers flow
eternal is its fruit as well as its shade
That is the ˹ultimate˺ outcome for the righteous
But the outcome for the disbelievers is the Fire!

13:36.qpc_hafs: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَاتَيۡنَٰهُمُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ يَفۡرَحُونَ بِمَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيۡكَۖ
13:36.en_khattab: The believers among those who were given the Scripture rejoice at what has been revealed to you, O Prophet,
while some disbelieving factions deny a portion of it.

13:36.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أُمِرۡتُ أَنۡ أَعۡبُدَ ٱللَّهَ وَلَآ أُشۡرِكَ بِهِۦٓۚ
13:36.en_khattab: Say, “I have only been commanded to worship Allah, associating none with Him in worship.
To Him I invite all, and to Him is my return.

13:37.en_khattab: And so We have revealed it as an authority in Arabic.

13:37.qpc_hafs: وَلَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعۡتَ أَهۡوَآءَهُم بَعۡدَ مَا جَآءَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِ
13:37.en_khattab: And if you were to follow their desires after ˹all˺ the knowledge that has come to you,

13:37.qpc_hafs: مَا لَكَ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مِن وَلِيّٖ وَلَا وَاقٖ
13:37.en_khattab: there would be none to protect or shield you from Allah.

13:38.en_khattab: We have certainly sent messengers before you ˹O Prophet˺
and blessed them with wives and offspring

13:38.qpc_hafs: وَمَا كَانَ لِرَسُولٍ أَن يَأۡتِيَ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِلَّا بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِۗ
13:38.en_khattab: It was not for any messenger to bring a sign without Allah’s permission
Every destined matter has a ˹set˺ time

13:39.en_khattab: Allah eliminates and confirms what He wills,
with Him is the Master Record.

13:40.qpc_hafs: وَإِن مَّا نُرِيَنَّكَ بَعۡضَ ٱلَّذِي نَعِدُهُمۡ
13:40.en_khattab: Whether We show you ˹O Prophet˺ some of what We threaten them with
or cause you to die ˹before that˺
your duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺

13:41.en_khattab: Do they not see that We gradually reduce their land
Allah decides— none can reverse His decision.
And He is swift in reckoning.

13:42.en_khattab: but Allah has the ultimate plan.
He knows what every soul commits.
And the disbelievers will soon know who will have the ultimate outcome.

13:43.en_khattab: The disbelievers say, “You ˹Muḥammad˺ are no messenger.”

13:43.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ كَفَىٰ بِٱللَّهِ شَهِيدَۢا بَيۡنِي وَبَيۡنَكُمۡ
13:43.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah is sufficient as a Witness between me and you
as is whoever has knowledge of the Scripture.

14:1.en_khattab: a Book which We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺

14:1.qpc_hafs: لِتُخۡرِجَ ٱلنَّاسَ مِنَ ٱلظُّلُمَٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِ
14:1.en_khattab: so that you may lead people out of darkness and into light
by the Will of their Lord
to the Path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy—

14:2.qpc_hafs: ٱلَّذِي لَهُۥ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۗ
14:2.en_khattab: to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth.

14:3.en_khattab: ˹They are˺ the ones who favour the life of this world

14:3.qpc_hafs: عَلَى ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ وَيَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ
14:3.en_khattab: over the Hereafter and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah
It is they who have gone far astray.

14:4.en_khattab: We have not sent a messenger
except in the language of his people
Then Allah leaves whoever He wills to stray
And He is the Almighty, All-Wise.

14:5.en_khattab: Indeed, We sent Moses with Our signs,

14:5.qpc_hafs: أَنۡ أَخۡرِجۡ قَوۡمَكَ مِنَ ٱلظُّلُمَٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِ
14:5.en_khattab: [ordering him,] 'Lead your people out of darkness and into light,
and remind them of Allah’s days [of favour].'

14:6.en_khattab: ˹Consider˺ when Moses said to his people,
when He rescued you from the people of Pharaoh,
who afflicted you with dreadful torment— slaughtering
your sons and keeping your women.

14:6.qpc_hafs: وَفِي ذَٰلِكُم بَلَآءٞ مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡ عَظِيمٞ
14:6.en_khattab: That was a severe test from your Lord.

14:7.en_khattab: ‘If you are grateful, I will certainly give you more
But if you are ungrateful, surely My punishment is severe’

14:8.qpc_hafs: إِن تَكۡفُرُوٓاْ أَنتُمۡ وَمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَمِيعٗا
14:8.en_khattab: If you along with everyone on earth were to be ungrateful,

14:9.qpc_hafs: أَلَمۡ يَأۡتِكُمۡ نَبَؤُاْ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِكُمۡ
14:9.en_khattab: Have you not ˹already˺ received the stories of those who were before you:

14:9.qpc_hafs: قَوۡمِ نُوحٖ وَعَادٖ وَثَمُودَ وَٱلَّذِينَ مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِمۡ
14:9.en_khattab: the people of Noah, ’Âd, Thamûd, and those after them
Only Allah knows how many they were.
Their messengers came to them with clear proofs,
but they put their hands over their mouths

14:9.qpc_hafs: وَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا كَفَرۡنَا بِمَآ أُرۡسِلۡتُم بِهِۦ
14:9.en_khattab: and said, “We totally reject what you have been sent with,

14:9.qpc_hafs: وَإِنَّا لَفِي شَكّٖ مِّمَّا تَدۡعُونَنَآ إِلَيۡهِ مُرِيبٖ
14:9.en_khattab: and we are certainly in alarming doubt about what you are inviting us to.

14:10.qpc_hafs: أَفِي ٱللَّهِ شَكّٞ فَاطِرِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ
14:10.en_khattab: Is there any doubt about Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth?

14:10.qpc_hafs: يَدۡعُوكُمۡ لِيَغۡفِرَ لَكُم مِّن ذُنُوبِكُمۡ وَيُؤَخِّرَكُمۡ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٖ مُّسَمّٗىۚ
14:10.en_khattab: He is inviting you in order to forgive your sins, and delay your end until your appointed term.

14:10.qpc_hafs: قَالُوٓاْ إِنۡ أَنتُمۡ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا
14:10.en_khattab: They argued, “You are no more than humans like us!

14:10.qpc_hafs: تُرِيدُونَ أَن تَصُدُّونَا عَمَّا كَانَ يَعۡبُدُ ءَابَآؤُنَا
14:10.en_khattab: You ˹only˺ wish to turn us away from what our forefathers worshipped.
So bring us some compelling proof.

14:11.qpc_hafs: إِن نَّحۡنُ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُكُمۡ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَمُنُّ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنۡ عِبَادِهِۦۖ
14:11.en_khattab: We are ˹indeed˺ only humans like you, but Allah favours whoever He chooses of His servants.

16:25.en_khattab: Let them bear their burdens in full

16:25.qpc_hafs: وَمِنۡ أَوۡزَارِ ٱلَّذِينَ يُضِلُّونَهُم بِغَيۡرِ عِلۡمٍۗ
16:25.en_khattab: as well as some of the burdens of those they mislead without knowledge
Evil indeed is what they will bear!

16:26.en_khattab: Indeed, those before them had plotted,
but Allah struck at the ˹very˺ foundation of their structure,
so the roof collapsed on top of them,

16:26.qpc_hafs: وَأَتَىٰهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُ مِنۡ حَيۡثُ لَا يَشۡعُرُونَ
16:26.en_khattab: and the torment came upon them from where they did not expect.

16:27.en_khattab: Then on the Day of Judgment
He will humiliate them and say,
for whose sake you used to oppose ˹the believers˺?”
Those gifted with knowledge will say,

16:28.en_khattab: Those whose souls the angels seize while they wrong themselves

16:28.qpc_hafs: فَأَلۡقَوُاْ ٱلسَّلَمَ مَا كُنَّا نَعۡمَلُ مِن سُوٓءِۭۚ
16:28.en_khattab: will then offer ˹full˺ submission ˹and say falsely,˺ “We did not do any evil.” ˹The angels will say,˺

16:28.qpc_hafs: بَلَىٰٓۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمُۢ بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ
16:28.en_khattab: “No! Surely Allah fully knows what you used to do.

16:29.en_khattab: So enter the gates of Hell,
Indeed, what an evil home for the arrogant!”

16:30.en_khattab: And ˹when˺ it is said to those mindful ˹of Allah˺,

16:30.qpc_hafs: لِّلَّذِينَ أَحۡسَنُواْ فِي هَٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنۡيَا حَسَنَةٞۚ
16:30.en_khattab: For those who do good in this world, there is goodness.
But far better is the ˹eternal˺ Home of the Hereafter.
How excellent indeed is the home of the righteous:

16:31.en_khattab: the Gardens of Eternity which they will enter,
In it they will have whatever they desire.
This is how Allah rewards the righteous—

16:32.en_khattab: those whose souls the angels take while they are virtuous
Enter Paradise for what you used to do.

16:33.en_khattab: or the command of your Lord ˹O Prophet˺?
but it was they who wronged themselves.

16:34.en_khattab: Then the evil ˹consequences˺ of their deeds overtook them

16:34.qpc_hafs: وَحَاقَ بِهِم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
16:34.en_khattab: and they were overwhelmed by what they used to ridicule

16:35.qpc_hafs: لَوۡ شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مَا عَبَدۡنَا مِن دُونِهِۦ مِن شَيۡءٖ نَّحۡنُ وَلَآ ءَابَآؤُنَا وَلَا حَرَّمۡنَا مِن دُونِهِۦ مِن شَيۡءٖۚ
16:35.en_khattab: Had Allah willed, neither we nor our forefathers would have worshipped anything other than Him, nor prohibited anything without His command.

16:35.qpc_hafs: فَهَلۡ عَلَى ٱلرُّسُلِ إِلَّا ٱلۡبَلَٰغُ ٱلۡمُبِينُ
16:35.en_khattab: Is not the messengers’ duty only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly?

16:36.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدۡ بَعَثۡنَا فِي كُلِّ أُمَّةٖ رَّسُولًا
16:36.en_khattab: We surely sent a messenger to every community,
saying, “Worship Allah and shun false gods.”

16:36.qpc_hafs: فَمِنۡهُم مَّنۡ هَدَى ٱللَّهُ وَمِنۡهُم مَّنۡ حَقَّتۡ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلضَّلَٰلَةُۚ
16:36.en_khattab: But some of them were guided by Allah, while others were destined to stray.
So travel throughout the land and see

16:37.en_khattab: Even though you ˹O Prophet˺ are keen on their guidance

16:37.qpc_hafs: فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهۡدِي مَن يُضِلُّۖ
16:37.en_khattab: Allah certainly does not guide those He leaves to stray
and they will have no helpers.

16:38.en_khattab: They swear by Allah their most solemn oaths
that Allah will never raise the dead to life
Yes ˹He will˺! It is a true promise binding on Him
but most people do not know

16:39.en_khattab: ˹He will do that˺ to make clear to them what they disagreed on,
and for the disbelievers to know

16:41.en_khattab: As for those who emigrated in ˹the cause of˺ Allah
We will surely bless them with a good home in this world.
But the reward of the Hereafter is far better,

16:42.en_khattab: ˹It is˺ they who have patiently endured,

16:43.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا مِن قَبۡلِكَ إِلَّا رِجَالٗا نُّوحِيٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡۖ
16:43.en_khattab: We did not send ˹messengers˺ before you ˹O Prophet˺ except mere men inspired by Us.

16:43.qpc_hafs: فَسۡـَٔلُوٓاْ أَهۡلَ ٱلذِّكۡرِ إِن كُنتُمۡ لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
16:43.en_khattab: If you ˹polytheists˺ do not know ˹this already˺, then ask those who have knowledge ˹of the Scriptures˺.

16:44.en_khattab: ˹We sent them˺ with clear proofs and divine Books.
And We have sent down to you ˹O Prophet˺ the Reminder,
so that you may explain to people what has been revealed for them,

16:45.en_khattab: Do those who devise evil plots
feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them
Or that the torment will not come upon them

16:46.en_khattab: Or that He will not seize them
for then they will have no escape?

16:47.en_khattab: Or that He will not destroy them gradually?
is truly Ever Gracious, Most Merciful.

16:48.en_khattab: how the shadows of everything Allah has created
incline to the right and the left ˹as the sun moves˺

16:49.en_khattab: And to Allah ˹alone˺ bows down ˹in submission˺

16:49.qpc_hafs: مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مِن دَآبَّةٖ
16:49.en_khattab: whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of living creatures
who are not too proud ˹to do so˺

16:50.en_khattab: They fear their Lord above them

16:51.en_khattab: So be in awe of Me

16:52.en_khattab: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth,
and to Him ˹alone˺ is the everlasting devotion.
Will you then fear any other than Allah?

16:53.qpc_hafs: وَمَا بِكُم مِّن نِّعۡمَةٖ فَمِنَ ٱللَّهِۖ
16:53.en_khattab: Whatever blessings you have are from Allah.

16:54.en_khattab: Then as soon as He removes the hardship from you,
a group of you associates ˹others˺ with their Lord ˹in worship˺,

16:55.en_khattab: only returning Our favours with ingratitude.

16:56.en_khattab: And they ˹even˺ assign to those ˹idols˺—who know nothing— a share
of what We have provided for them
By Allah! You will certainly be questioned about whatever ˹lies˺ you used to fabricate ˹against Allah˺.

16:57.en_khattab: And they attribute ˹angels as˺ daughters to Allah—
Him!—the opposite of what they desire for themselves.

16:58.en_khattab: Whenever one of them is given the good news of a baby girl

16:59.en_khattab: He hides himself from the people
because of the bad news he has received
Should he keep her in disgrace
or bury her ˹alive˺ in the ground

16:60.en_khattab: To those who disbelieve in the Hereafter
whereas to Allah belong the finest attributes.
And He is the Almighty, All-Wise.

16:61.en_khattab: If Allah were to punish people ˹immediately˺ for their wrongdoing
He would not have left a single living being on earth
But He delays them for an appointed term

16:61.qpc_hafs: فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمۡ لَا يَسۡتَـٔۡخِرُونَ سَاعَةٗ وَلَا يَسۡتَقۡدِمُونَ
16:61.en_khattab: And when their time arrives, they cannot delay it for a moment, nor could they advance it

16:62.en_khattab: They attribute to Allah what they hate ˹for themselves˺,
and their tongues utter the lie
that they will have the finest reward. Without a doubt,
for them is the Fire, where they will be abandoned.

16:63.qpc_hafs: تَٱللَّهِ لَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَىٰٓ أُمَمٖ مِّن قَبۡلِكَ
16:63.en_khattab: By Allah! We have surely sent messengers to communities before you ˹O Prophet˺

16:63.qpc_hafs: فَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ أَعۡمَٰلَهُمۡ فَهُوَ وَلِيُّهُمُ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ
16:63.en_khattab: but Satan made their misdeeds appealing to them. So he is their patron today
and they will suffer a painful punishment.

16:64.en_khattab: We have revealed to you the Book

16:64.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا لِتُبَيِّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلَّذِي ٱخۡتَلَفُواْ فِيهِ
16:64.en_khattab: only to clarify for them what they differed about
and as a guide and mercy

16:65.en_khattab: And Allah sends down rain from the sky
giving life to the earth after its death
Surely in this is a sign

16:66.en_khattab: And there is certainly a lesson for you in cattle:

16:66.qpc_hafs: نُّسۡقِيكُم مِّمَّا فِي بُطُونِهِۦ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ فَرۡثٖ وَدَمٖ
16:66.en_khattab: We give you to drink of what is in their bellies, from between digested food and blood:

16:67.en_khattab: And from the fruits of palm trees and grapevines
you derive intoxicants as well as wholesome provision

16:67.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗ لِّقَوۡمٖ يَعۡقِلُونَ
16:67.en_khattab: Surely in this is a sign for those who understand

16:69.en_khattab: and feed from ˹the flower of˺ any fruit ˹you please˺
and follow the ways your Lord has made easy for you.

16:69.qpc_hafs: يَخۡرُجُ مِنۢ بُطُونِهَا شَرَابٞ مُّخۡتَلِفٌ أَلۡوَٰنُهُۥ
16:69.en_khattab: From their bellies comes forth liquid of varying colours
in which there is healing for people.

16:69.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗ لِّقَوۡمٖ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ
16:69.en_khattab: Surely in this is a sign for those who reflect.

16:70.en_khattab: and then causes you to die.

16:70.qpc_hafs: وَمِنكُم مَّن يُرَدُّ إِلَىٰٓ أَرۡذَلِ ٱلۡعُمُرِ
16:70.en_khattab: And some of you are left to reach the most feeble stage of life

16:70.qpc_hafs: لِكَيۡ لَا يَعۡلَمَ بَعۡدَ عِلۡمٖ شَيۡـًٔاۚ
16:70.en_khattab: so that they may know nothing after having known much.
Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, Most Capable.

16:71.qpc_hafs: وَٱللَّهُ فَضَّلَ بَعۡضَكُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ فِي ٱلرِّزۡقِۚ
16:71.en_khattab: And Allah has favoured some of you over others in provision.

16:71.qpc_hafs: فَمَا ٱلَّذِينَ فُضِّلُواْ بِرَآدِّي رِزۡقِهِمۡ عَلَىٰ مَا مَلَكَتۡ أَيۡمَٰنُهُمۡ فَهُمۡ فِيهِ سَوَآءٌۚ
16:71.en_khattab: But those who have been much favoured would not share their wealth with those ˹bondspeople˺ in their possession, making them their equals.
Do they then deny Allah’s favours?

16:72.qpc_hafs: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنۡ أَنفُسِكُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗا
16:72.en_khattab: And Allah has made for you spouses of your own kind

16:72.qpc_hafs: وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِكُم بَنِينَ وَحَفَدَةٗ
16:72.en_khattab: and given you through your spouses children and grandchildren
And He has granted you good, lawful provisions

16:72.qpc_hafs: أَفَبِٱلۡبَٰطِلِ يُؤۡمِنُونَ وَبِنِعۡمَتِ ٱللَّهِ هُمۡ يَكۡفُرُونَ
16:72.en_khattab: Are they then faithful to falsehood and ungrateful for Allah's favours?

16:73.en_khattab: those ˹idols˺ who do not afford them any provision
from the heavens and the earth
nor do they have the power to.

16:74.en_khattab: So do not set up equals to Allah,

16:75.qpc_hafs: عَبۡدٗا مَّمۡلُوكٗا لَّا يَقۡدِرُ عَلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ
16:75.en_khattab: a slave who lacks all means,
to a ˹free˺ man to whom We granted a good provision,
of which he donates ˹freely,˺ openly and secretly.
In fact, most of them do not know.

16:76.en_khattab: And Allah sets forth a parable

16:76.qpc_hafs: أَحَدُهُمَآ أَبۡكَمُ لَا يَقۡدِرُ عَلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ
16:76.en_khattab: one of them is dumb, incapable of anything.
He is a burden on his master.
Wherever he is sent, he brings no good.

16:76.qpc_hafs: هَلۡ يَسۡتَوِي هُوَ وَمَن يَأۡمُرُ بِٱلۡعَدۡلِ
16:76.en_khattab: Can such a person be equal to the one who commands justice
and is on the Straight Path?

16:77.en_khattab: To Allah ˹alone˺ belongs ˹the knowledge of˺ the unseen in the heavens and the earth.

16:77.qpc_hafs: وَمَآ أَمۡرُ ٱلسَّاعَةِ إِلَّا كَلَمۡحِ ٱلۡبَصَرِ أَوۡ هُوَ أَقۡرَبُۚ
16:77.en_khattab: Bringing about the Hour would only take the blink of an eye, or even less.

16:77.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ
16:77.en_khattab: Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

16:78.en_khattab: And Allah brought you out of the wombs of your mothers
and gave you hearing, sight, and intellect
so perhaps you would be thankful

16:79.en_khattab: None holds them up except Allah

16:80.qpc_hafs: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنۢ بُيُوتِكُمۡ سَكَنٗا
16:80.en_khattab: And Allah has made your homes a place to rest

16:80.qpc_hafs: وَجَعَلَ لَكُم مِّن جُلُودِ ٱلۡأَنۡعَٰمِ بُيُوتٗا تَسۡتَخِفُّونَهَا
16:80.en_khattab: and has given you tents from the hide of animals, light to handle
when you travel and when you camp
And out of their wool, fur, and hair He has given you furnishings

16:81.qpc_hafs: وَٱللَّهُ جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّمَّا خَلَقَ ظِلَٰلٗا
16:81.en_khattab: And Allah has provided you shade out of what He created,
and has given you shelter in the mountains.

16:81.qpc_hafs: وَجَعَلَ لَكُمۡ سَرَٰبِيلَ تَقِيكُمُ ٱلۡحَرَّ وَسَرَٰبِيلَ تَقِيكُم بَأۡسَكُمۡۚ
16:81.en_khattab: He has also provided you with clothes protecting you from the heat ˹and cold˺, and armour shielding you in battle.

16:81.qpc_hafs: كَذَٰلِكَ يُتِمُّ نِعۡمَتَهُۥ عَلَيۡكُمۡ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تُسۡلِمُونَ
16:81.en_khattab: This is how He perfects His favour upon you, so perhaps you will ˹fully˺ submit ˹to Him˺.

16:82.en_khattab: then your duty ˹O Prophet˺ is only to deliver

16:83.en_khattab: They are aware of Allah’s favours,
And most of them are ˹truly˺ ungrateful.

16:84.qpc_hafs: وَيَوۡمَ نَبۡعَثُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٖ شَهِيدٗا
16:84.en_khattab: ˹Consider, O  Prophet,˺ the Day We will call ˹a prophet as˺ a witness from every faith-community.
Then the disbelievers will neither be allowed to plead

16:85.en_khattab: And when the wrongdoers face the punishment
it will not be lightened for them
nor will they be delayed ˹from it˺

16:86.en_khattab: And when the polytheists see their associate-gods,

16:86.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ رَبَّنَا هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ شُرَكَآؤُنَا ٱلَّذِينَ كُنَّا نَدۡعُواْ مِن دُونِكَۖ
16:86.en_khattab: they will say, “Our Lord! These are our associate-gods that we used to invoke besides You.”
Their gods will throw a rebuttal at them,

16:87.en_khattab: They will offer ˹full˺ submission to Allah on that Day,
and whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them.

16:88.en_khattab: and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah
We will add more punishment to their punishment
for all the corruption they spread

16:89.qpc_hafs: وَيَوۡمَ نَبۡعَثُ فِي كُلِّ أُمَّةٖ شَهِيدًا عَلَيۡهِم مِّنۡ أَنفُسِهِمۡۖ
16:89.en_khattab: Consider, O  Prophet, the Day We will call against every faith-community a witness of their own.
And We will call you to be a witness against these ˹people of yours˺.

16:89.qpc_hafs: وَنَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ تِبۡيَٰنٗا لِّكُلِّ شَيۡءٖ
16:89.en_khattab: We have revealed to you the Book as an explanation of all things.
A guide, a mercy, and good news for those who ˹fully˺ submit.

16:90.en_khattab: as well as courtesy to close relatives.
He instructs you so perhaps you will be mindful.

16:91.en_khattab: Honour Allah’s covenant when you make a pledge
and do not break your oaths after confirming them
Surely Allah knows all you do

16:92.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَكُونُواْ كَٱلَّتِي نَقَضَتۡ غَزۡلَهَا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ قُوَّةٍ
16:92.en_khattab: Do not be like the woman who ˹foolishly˺ unravels her yarn after it is firmly spun

16:92.qpc_hafs: أَنكَٰثٗا تَتَّخِذُونَ أَيۡمَٰنَكُمۡ دَخَلَۢا بَيۡنَكُمۡ أَن تَكُونَ أُمَّةٌ هِيَ أَرۡبَىٰ مِنۡ أُمَّةٍۚ
16:92.en_khattab: by taking your oaths as a means of deceiving one another in favour of a stronger group
Surely Allah tests you through this

16:92.qpc_hafs: وَلَيُبَيِّنَنَّ لَكُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ مَا كُنتُمۡ فِيهِ تَخۡتَلِفُونَ
16:92.en_khattab: And on the Day of Judgment He will certainly make your differences clear to you

16:93.en_khattab: He could have easily made you one community ˹of believers˺,

16:93.qpc_hafs: وَلَٰكِن يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۚ
16:93.en_khattab: but He leaves to stray whoever He wills and guides whoever He wills.
And you will certainly be questioned about what you used to do.

16:94.en_khattab: And do not take your oaths as a means of deceiving one another
or your feet will slip after they have been firm

16:94.qpc_hafs: وَتَذُوقُواْ ٱلسُّوٓءَ بِمَا صَدَدتُّمۡ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ
16:94.en_khattab: Then you will taste the evil consequences of hindering others from the Way of Allah
and you will suffer a tremendous punishment

16:95.en_khattab: And do not trade Allah’s covenant

16:95.qpc_hafs: إِنَّمَا عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيۡرٞ لَّكُمۡ
16:95.en_khattab: What is with Allah is certainly far better for you

16:96.en_khattab: but whatever Allah has is everlasting.
And We will certainly reward the steadfast
according to the best of their deeds.

16:97.en_khattab: We will surely bless them with a good life

16:97.qpc_hafs: وَلَنَجۡزِيَنَّهُمۡ أَجۡرَهُم بِأَحۡسَنِ مَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ
16:97.en_khattab: and We will certainly reward them according to the best of their deeds

16:99.en_khattab: and put their trust in their Lord.

16:100.en_khattab: over those who take him as a patron
and who— under his influence— associate ˹others˺ with Allah ˹in worship˺.

16:101.en_khattab: When We replace a verse with another
and Allah knows best what He reveals
they say, “You ˹Muḥammad˺ are just a fabricator.”
In fact, most of them do not know.

16:102.en_khattab: Say, “The holy spirit has brought it down
with the truth from your Lord
and good news for those who submit ˹to Allah˺.”

16:103.en_khattab: And We surely know that they say,
“No one is teaching him except a human.”
But the man they refer to speaks a foreign tongue,

16:104.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ
16:104.en_khattab: Surely those who do not believe in Allah’s revelations
will never be guided by Allah
and they will suffer a painful punishment.

16:105.en_khattab: those who disbelieve in Allah’s revelations,
and it is they who are the ˹true˺ liars.

16:106.qpc_hafs: مَن كَفَرَ بِٱللَّهِ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ إِيمَٰنِهِۦٓ
16:106.en_khattab: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after their belief

16:106.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا مَنۡ أُكۡرِهَ وَقَلۡبُهُۥ مُطۡمَئِنُّۢ بِٱلۡإِيمَٰنِ
16:106.en_khattab: not those who are forced while their hearts are firm in faith
but those who embrace disbelief wholeheartedly

16:106.qpc_hafs: فَعَلَيۡهِمۡ غَضَبٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٞ
16:106.en_khattab: they will be condemned by Allah and suffer a tremendous punishment

16:107.en_khattab: This is because they prefer the life of this world

16:107.qpc_hafs: وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَهۡدِي ٱلۡقَوۡمَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
16:107.en_khattab: Surely Allah never guides those who ˹choose to˺ disbelieve.

16:108.qpc_hafs: طَبَعَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمۡ وَسَمۡعِهِمۡ وَأَبۡصَٰرِهِمۡۖ
16:108.en_khattab: the ones whose hearts, ears, and eyes are sealed by Allah,
and it is they who are ˹truly˺ heedless.

16:109.en_khattab: they will be the losers in the Hereafter.

16:110.qpc_hafs: لِلَّذِينَ هَاجَرُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا فُتِنُواْ
16:110.en_khattab: emigrated after being compelled ˹to renounce Islam˺,
then struggled ˹in Allah’s cause˺, and persevered,

16:110.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعۡدِهَا لَغَفُورٞ رَّحِيمٞ
16:110.en_khattab: your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ is truly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful after all.

16:111.en_khattab: ˹Consider˺ the Day ˹when˺ every soul will come
and each will be paid in full for what it did,

16:112.en_khattab: And Allah sets forth the example
of a society which was safe and at ease

16:112.qpc_hafs: يَأۡتِيهَا رِزۡقُهَا رَغَدٗا مِّن كُلِّ مَكَانٖ
16:112.en_khattab: receiving its provision in abundance from all directions
But its people met Allah’s favours with ingratitude
so Allah made them taste the clutches of hunger and fear

16:113.en_khattab: A messenger of their own actually did come to them,

16:114.qpc_hafs: فَكُلُواْ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ حَلَٰلٗا طَيِّبٗا
16:114.en_khattab: So eat from the good, lawful things
has provided for you, and be grateful for Allah’s favours,

16:115.en_khattab: He has only forbidden you ˹to eat˺ carrion
and what is slaughtered in the name of any other than Allah

16:115.qpc_hafs: فَمَنِ ٱضۡطُرَّ غَيۡرَ بَاغٖ وَلَا عَادٖ
16:115.en_khattab: But if someone is compelled by necessity— neither driven by desire nor exceeding immediate need
then surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful

16:116.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَقُولُواْ لِمَا تَصِفُ أَلۡسِنَتُكُمُ ٱلۡكَذِبَ
16:116.en_khattab: Do not falsely declare with your tongues,
“This is lawful, and that is unlawful,” ˹only˺

16:116.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَفۡتَرُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡكَذِبَ
16:116.en_khattab: Indeed, those who fabricate lies against Allah

16:117.en_khattab: then they will suffer a painful punishment

16:118.qpc_hafs: حَرَّمۡنَا مَا قَصَصۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ مِن قَبۡلُۖ
16:118.en_khattab: We have forbidden what We related to you before.
but it was they who wronged themselves.

16:119.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لِلَّذِينَ عَمِلُواْ ٱلسُّوٓءَ بِجَهَٰلَةٖ
16:119.en_khattab: As for those who commit evil ignorantly ˹or recklessly˺,

16:119.qpc_hafs: ثُمَّ تَابُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ ذَٰلِكَ وَأَصۡلَحُوٓاْ
16:119.en_khattab: then repent afterwards and mend their ways,

16:119.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعۡدِهَا لَغَفُورٞ رَّحِيمٌ
16:119.en_khattab: then your Lord is surely All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

16:120.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ كَانَ أُمَّةٗ قَانِتٗا لِّلَّهِ
16:120.en_khattab: Indeed, Abraham was a model of excellence: devoted to Allah

16:121.en_khattab: So He chose him and guided him

16:122.en_khattab: We blessed him with all goodness in this world,
and in the Hereafter he will certainly be among the righteous.

16:123.en_khattab: ˹O Prophet, saying˺: “Follow the faith of Abraham, the upright
who was not one of the polytheists.

16:124.qpc_hafs: إِنَّمَا جُعِلَ ٱلسَّبۡتُ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ ٱخۡتَلَفُواْ فِيهِۚ
16:124.en_khattab: ˹Honouring˺ the Sabbath was ordained only for those who disputed about Abraham.

16:124.qpc_hafs: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَحۡكُمُ بَيۡنَهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ
16:124.en_khattab: And surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment

16:125.en_khattab: Invite ˹all˺ to the Way of your Lord
and only debate with them in the best manner.

16:125.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ
16:125.en_khattab: Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ knows best who has strayed from His Way

16:126.en_khattab: then let it be equivalent to what you have suffered.
it is certainly best for those who are patient.

16:127.en_khattab: ˹O Prophet˺, for your patience is only with Allah’s help.
Do not grieve over those ˹who disbelieve˺,

16:127.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَكُ فِي ضَيۡقٖ مِّمَّا يَمۡكُرُونَ
16:127.en_khattab: nor be distressed by their schemes.

16:128.en_khattab: is with those who shun evil

17:1.en_khattab: Glory be to the One Who
so that We may show him some of Our signs
Indeed, He alone is the All-Hearing, All-Seeing

17:2.en_khattab: And We gave Moses the Scripture
and made it a guide for the Children of Israel
˹stating:˺ 'Do not take besides Me any other Trustee of Affairs

17:3.en_khattab: ˹O˺ descendants of those We carried with Noah ˹in the Ark˺!
He was indeed a grateful servant.”

17:4.en_khattab: And We warned the Children of Israel
You will certainly cause corruption in the land twice,
and you will become extremely arrogant.

17:5.en_khattab: When the first of the two warnings would come to pass,

17:5.qpc_hafs: بَعَثۡنَا عَلَيۡكُمۡ عِبَادٗا لَّنَآ أُوْلِي بَأۡسٖ شَدِيدٖ
17:5.en_khattab: We would send against you some of Our servants of great might,
This would be a warning fulfilled.

17:6.en_khattab: Then ˹after your repentance˺ We would give you the upper hand over them
and aid you with wealth and offspring,

17:7.en_khattab: If you act rightly, it is for your own good
but if you do wrong, it is to your own loss.

17:7.qpc_hafs: فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعۡدُ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ لِيَسُـُٔواْ وُجُوهَكُمۡ
17:7.en_khattab: "And when the second warning would come to pass, your enemies would ˹be left to˺ totally disgrace you

17:7.qpc_hafs: وَلِيَدۡخُلُواْ ٱلۡمَسۡجِدَ كَمَا دَخَلُوهُ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٖ
17:7.en_khattab: and enter the Temple ˹of Jerusalem˺ as they entered it the first time
and utterly destroy whatever would fall into their hands.

17:8.en_khattab: you repent˺, but if you return ˹to sin˺, We will return
˹to punishment˺. And We have made Hell

17:9.qpc_hafs: يَهۡدِي لِلَّتِي هِيَ أَقۡوَمُ وَيُبَشِّرُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَعۡمَلُونَ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ
17:9.en_khattab: guides to what is most upright, and gives good news to the believers— who do good
that they will have a mighty reward.

17:10.en_khattab: And ˹it warns˺ those who do not believe in the Hereafter ˹that˺
We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

17:12.en_khattab: We made the day and night as two signs.
So We made the sign of the night devoid of light,
and We made the sign of the day ˹perfectly˺ bright,

17:12.qpc_hafs: لِّتَبۡتَغُواْ فَضۡلٗا مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡ وَلِتَعۡلَمُواْ عَدَدَ ٱلسِّنِينَ وَٱلۡحِسَابَۚ
17:12.en_khattab: so that you may seek the bounty of your Lord and know the number of years and calculation ˹of time˺.
And We have explained everything in detail.

17:13.qpc_hafs: وَكُلَّ إِنسَٰنٍ أَلۡزَمۡنَٰهُ طَٰٓئِرَهُۥ فِي عُنُقِهِۦۖ
17:13.en_khattab: We have bound every human’s destiny to their neck.

17:13.qpc_hafs: وَنُخۡرِجُ لَهُۥ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ كِتَٰبٗا يَلۡقَىٰهُ مَنشُورًا
17:13.en_khattab: And on the Day of Judgment We will bring forth to each ˹person˺ a record which they will find laid open.

17:14.en_khattab: ˹And it will be said,˺ “Read your record.
this Day to take account of yourself.

17:15.en_khattab: it is only for their own good
it is only to their own loss
No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another

17:15.qpc_hafs: وَمَا كُنَّا مُعَذِّبِينَ حَتَّىٰ نَبۡعَثَ رَسُولٗا
17:15.en_khattab: And We would never punish ˹a people˺ until We have sent a messenger ˹to warn them˺

17:16.en_khattab: Whenever We intend to destroy a society
We command its elite ˹to obey Allah˺ but they act rebelliously in it
So the decree ˹of punishment˺ is justified

17:17.qpc_hafs: وَكَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِنَ ٱلۡقُرُونِ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ نُوحٖۗ
17:17.en_khattab: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We have destroyed after Noah!
And sufficient is your Lord as All-Aware and All-Seeing of the sins of His servants.

17:18.qpc_hafs: عَجَّلۡنَا لَهُۥ فِيهَا مَا نَشَآءُ لِمَن نُّرِيدُ
17:18.en_khattab: ˹alone˺, We hasten in it whatever We please to whoever We will
then We destine them for Hell
where they will burn, condemned and rejected

17:19.en_khattab: it is they whose striving will be appreciated

17:20.en_khattab: the former and the latter from the bounty of your Lord.
And the bounty of your Lord can never be withheld.

17:21.en_khattab: but the Hereafter is certainly far greater in rank

17:22.en_khattab: Do not set up any other god with Allah
or you will end up condemned

17:23.qpc_hafs: وَقَضَىٰ رَبُّكَ أَلَّا تَعۡبُدُوٓاْ إِلَّآ إِيَّاهُ
17:23.en_khattab: For your Lord has decreed that you worship none but Him.

17:23.qpc_hafs: إِمَّا يَبۡلُغَنَّ عِندَكَ ٱلۡكِبَرَ أَحَدُهُمَآ أَوۡ كِلَاهُمَا
17:23.en_khattab: If one or both of them reach old age in your care,

17:23.qpc_hafs: فَلَا تَقُل لَّهُمَآ أُفّٖ وَلَا تَنۡهَرۡهُمَا
17:23.en_khattab: never say to them ˹even˺ ‘ugh,’ nor yell at them.

17:24.en_khattab: My Lord! Be merciful to them
as they raised me when I was young.

17:25.en_khattab: Your Lord knows best what is within yourselves.
He is certainly All-Forgiving to those who ˹constantly˺ turn to Him.

17:26.en_khattab: Give to close relatives their due,
as well as the poor and ˹needy˺ travellers.

17:28.en_khattab: But if you must turn them down ˹because you lack the means
to give˺—while hoping to receive your Lord’s bounty—
then ˹at least˺ give them a kind word.

17:29.en_khattab: for you will be blameworthy; nor so open-handed,
for you will end up in poverty.

17:30.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَبۡسُطُ ٱلرِّزۡقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ
17:30.en_khattab: Surely your Lord gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills.

17:31.en_khattab: We provide for them and for you
Surely killing them is a heinous sin

17:32.en_khattab: It is truly a shameful deed

17:33.en_khattab: We have given their heirs the authority,
but do not let them exceed limits in retaliation,
for they are already supported ˹by law˺.

17:34.en_khattab: Do not come near the wealth of the orphan

17:34.qpc_hafs: إِلَّا بِٱلَّتِي هِيَ أَحۡسَنُ حَتَّىٰ يَبۡلُغَ أَشُدَّهُۥۚ
17:34.en_khattab: unless intending to enhance it until they attain maturity
for you will surely be accountable for them

17:35.en_khattab: Give in full when you measure,
and weigh with an even balance.
That is fairest and best in the end.

17:36.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَقۡفُ مَا لَيۡسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلۡمٌۚ
17:36.en_khattab: Do not follow what you have no ˹sure˺ knowledge of.
Indeed, all will be called to account for ˹their˺ hearing, sight, and intellect.

17:37.en_khattab: And do not walk on the earth arrogantly.
Surely you can neither crack the earth
nor stretch to the height of the mountains.

17:38.en_khattab: The violation of any of these

17:39.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ مِمَّآ أَوۡحَىٰٓ إِلَيۡكَ رَبُّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡحِكۡمَةِۗ
17:39.en_khattab: This is part of the wisdom which your Lord has revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺.

17:39.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَجۡعَلۡ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ
17:39.en_khattab: And do not set up any other god with Allah ˹O humanity˺,
or you will be cast into Hell, blameworthy, rejected.

17:40.en_khattab: Has your Lord favoured you ˹pagans˺ with sons
You are truly making an outrageous claim.

17:41.en_khattab: so perhaps they may be mindful,
but it only drives them farther away.

17:42.en_khattab: Had there been other gods besides Him,

17:42.qpc_hafs: إِذٗا لَّٱبۡتَغَوۡاْ إِلَىٰ ذِي ٱلۡعَرۡشِ سَبِيلٗا
17:42.en_khattab: then they would have certainly sought a way to ˹challenge˺ the Lord of the Throne.

17:43.en_khattab: is He above what they claim!
He is above any imperfection and exalted greatly.

17:44.qpc_hafs: تُسَبِّحُ لَهُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتُ ٱلسَّبۡعُ وَٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَمَن فِيهِنَّۚ
17:44.en_khattab: The seven heavens, the earth, and all those in them glorify Him.

17:44.qpc_hafs: وَإِن مِّن شَيۡءٍ إِلَّا يُسَبِّحُ بِحَمۡدِهِۦ
17:44.en_khattab: There is not a single thing that does not glorify His praises
but you ˹simply˺ cannot comprehend their glorification
He is indeed Most Forbearing, All-Forgiving

17:45.en_khattab: When you ˹O Prophet˺ recite the Quran,

17:45.qpc_hafs: جَعَلۡنَا بَيۡنَكَ وَبَيۡنَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ حِجَابٗا مَّسۡتُورٗا
17:45.en_khattab: We put a hidden barrier between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter.

17:46.en_khattab: We have cast veils over their hearts
leaving them unable to comprehend it, and deafness in their ears

17:46.qpc_hafs: وَإِذَا ذَكَرۡتَ رَبَّكَ فِي ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ وَحۡدَهُۥ
17:46.en_khattab: And when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran
they turn their backs in aversion

17:47.en_khattab: We know best how they listen to your recitation
and what they say privately— when

17:47.qpc_hafs: إِذۡ يَقُولُ ٱلظَّٰلِمُونَ إِن تَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا رَجُلٗا مَّسۡحُورًا
17:47.en_khattab: the wrongdoers say, “You would only be following a bewitched man.”

17:48.en_khattab: See how they call you names ˹O Prophet˺!
So they have gone so ˹far˺ astray that they cannot find the ˹Right˺ Way.

17:49.en_khattab: When we are reduced to bones and ashes
will we really be raised as a new creation?

17:50.en_khattab: ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹Yes, even if˺ you become stones, or iron,

17:51.qpc_hafs: أَوۡ خَلۡقٗا مِّمَّا يَكۡبُرُ فِي صُدُورِكُمۡۚ
17:51.en_khattab: or whatever you think is harder to bring to life!
Then they will ask ˹you˺, “Who will bring us back ˹to life˺?”
Say, “The One Who created you the first time.
They will then shake their heads at you

17:52.en_khattab: On the Day He will call you,
you will ˹instantly˺ respond by praising Him,
thinking you had remained ˹in the world˺ only for a little while.

17:53.en_khattab: to say only what is best
Satan certainly seeks to sow discord among them

17:53.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنَ كَانَ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ عَدُوّٗا مُّبِينٗا
17:53.en_khattab: Satan is indeed a sworn enemy to humankind

17:54.qpc_hafs: إِن يَشَأۡ يَرۡحَمۡكُمۡ أَوۡ إِن يَشَأۡ يُعَذِّبۡكُمۡۚ
17:54.en_khattab: He may have mercy on you if He wills, or punish you if He wills.
We have not sent you ˹O Prophet˺ as a keeper over them.

17:55.qpc_hafs: وَرَبُّكَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۗ
17:55.en_khattab: Your Lord knows best all those in the heavens and the earth.

17:55.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدۡ فَضَّلۡنَا بَعۡضَ ٱلنَّبِيِّـۧنَ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖۖ
17:55.en_khattab: And We have surely favoured some prophets above others,
and to David We gave the Psalms.

17:56.en_khattab: they do not have the power to undo harm from you or transfer it ˹to someone else˺.

17:57.en_khattab: of those invoked would be seeking a way to their Lord,
Indeed, your Lord’s torment is fearsome.

17:58.qpc_hafs: وَإِن مِّن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا نَحۡنُ مُهۡلِكُوهَا
17:58.en_khattab: There is not a ˹wicked˺ society that We will not destroy

That is written in the Record.

17:59.en_khattab: Nothing keeps Us from sending the ˹demanded˺ signs

17:60.qpc_hafs: وَإِذۡ قُلۡنَا لَكَ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ أَحَاطَ بِٱلنَّاسِۚ
17:60.en_khattab: And ˹remember, O Prophet˺ when We told you, “Certainly your Lord encompasses the people.”

17:60.qpc_hafs: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا ٱلرُّءۡيَا ٱلَّتِيٓ أَرَيۡنَٰكَ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلنَّاسِ
17:60.en_khattab: And We have made what We brought you to see as well as the

17:60.qpc_hafs: وَنُخَوِّفُهُمۡ فَمَا يَزِيدُهُمۡ إِلَّا طُغۡيَٰنٗا كَبِيرٗا

17:62.en_khattab: Adding, “Do you see this one you honoured above me?

17:88.en_khattab: they could not produce its equal, no matter how they supported each other.

17:89.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدۡ صَرَّفۡنَا لِلنَّاسِ فِي هَٰذَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ
17:89.en_khattab: And We have truly set forth
humanity in this Quran, yet most people persist

17:90.qpc_hafs: حَتَّىٰ تَفۡجُرَ لَنَا مِنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ يَنۢبُوعًا
17:90.en_khattab: We will never believe in you until you cause a spring to gush forth from the earth for us,

17:91.qpc_hafs: أَوۡ تَكُونَ لَكَ جَنَّةٞ مِّن نَّخِيلٖ وَعِنَبٖ
17:91.en_khattab: or until you have a garden of palm trees and vineyards,

17:92.en_khattab: or cause the sky to fall upon us in pieces,

17:93.qpc_hafs: أَوۡ يَكُونَ لَكَ بَيۡتٞ مِّن زُخۡرُفٍ
17:93.en_khattab: or until you have a house of gold,

17:93.qpc_hafs: وَلَن نُّؤۡمِنَ لِرُقِيِّكَ حَتَّىٰ تُنَزِّلَ عَلَيۡنَا كِتَٰبٗا نَّقۡرَؤُهُۥۗ
17:93.en_khattab: and even then we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book that we can read.

17:93.qpc_hafs: قُلۡ سُبۡحَانَ رَبِّي هَلۡ كُنتُ إِلَّا بَشَرٗا رَّسُولٗا
17:93.en_khattab: Say, “Glory be to my Lord! Am I not only a human messenger?”

17:94.en_khattab: from believing when guidance comes to them

17:95.en_khattab: Had there been angels walking the earth, well settled,

17:95.qpc_hafs: لَنَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَلَكٗا رَّسُولٗا
17:95.en_khattab: We would have surely sent down for them an angel from heaven as a messenger.

17:96.en_khattab: Say, “Sufficient is Allah as a Witness
He is certainly All-Knowing, All-Seeing of His servants.

17:97.en_khattab: Whoever Allah guides is truly guided.

17:97.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يُضۡلِلۡ فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُمۡ أَوۡلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِهِۦۖ
17:97.en_khattab: And whoever He leaves to stray, you will find no guardians for them besides Him.

17:97.qpc_hafs: وَنَحۡشُرُهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمۡ عُمۡيٗا وَبُكۡمٗا وَصُمّٗاۖ
17:97.en_khattab: And We will drag them on their faces on the Day of Judgment— deaf, dumb, and blind.

17:97.qpc_hafs: مَّأۡوَىٰهُمۡ جَهَنَّمُۖ كُلَّمَا خَبَتۡ زِدۡنَٰهُمۡ سَعِيرٗا
17:97.en_khattab: Hell will be their home. Whenever it dies down, We will flare it up for them.

17:98.en_khattab: That is their reward for rejecting Our signs.
And asking ˹mockingly˺, “When we are reduced to bones and ashes,
Will we really be raised as a new creation?”

17:99.qpc_hafs: أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ
17:99.en_khattab: that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth

17:99.qpc_hafs: وَجَعَلَ لَهُمۡ أَجَلٗا لَّا رَيۡبَ فِيهِ
17:99.en_khattab: He has ˹already˺ set for them a time, about which there is no doubt
But the wrongdoers persist in denial

17:100.en_khattab: “Even if you were to possess the ˹infinite˺ treasuries of my Lord’s mercy,

17:101.qpc_hafs: وَلَقَدۡ ءَاتَيۡنَا مُوسَىٰ تِسۡعَ ءَايَٰتِۭ بَيِّنَٰتٖۖ
17:101.en_khattab: We surely gave Moses nine clear signs.

17:102.qpc_hafs: لَقَدۡ عَلِمۡتَ مَآ أَنزَلَ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِلَّا رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ بَصَآئِرَ
17:102.en_khattab: You know well that none has sent these ˹signs˺ down except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as insights.

17:110.en_khattab: whichever you call, He has the Most Beautiful Names.

17:111.en_khattab: nor is He pathetic, needing a protector.

18:14.en_khattab: when they stood up and declared,

18:15.en_khattab: Who then does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah?

Whoever Allah guides is truly guided

18:17.qpc_hafs: وَمَن يُضۡلِلۡ فَلَن تَجِدَ لَهُۥ وَلِيّٗا مُّرۡشِدٗا

you would have certainly fled away from them,

18:19.en_khattab: And so We awakened them so that they might question one another.

18:19.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ لَبِثۡنَا يَوۡمًا أَوۡ بَعۡضَ يَوۡمٖۚ
18:19.en_khattab: Some replied, “Perhaps a day, or part of a day.”

18:19.qpc_hafs: قَالُواْ رَبُّكُمۡ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا لَبِثۡتُمۡ فَٱبۡعَثُوٓاْ
18:19.en_khattab: They said ˹to one another˺, “Your Lord knows best how long you have remained. So send

18:22.en_khattab: ˹only˺ guessing blindly. And others will say, “They were seven and their dog was the eighth.”

18:22.qpc_hafs: قُل رَّبِّيٓ أَعۡلَمُ بِعِدَّتِهِم مَّا يَعۡلَمُهُمۡ إِلَّا قَلِيلٞۗ فَلَا تُمَارِ فِيهِمۡ إِلَّا مِرَآءٗ ظَٰهِرٗا وَلَا تَسۡتَفۡتِ فِيهِم مِّنۡهُمۡ أَحَدٗا
18:22.en_khattab: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord knows best their ˹exact˺ number. Only a few people know as well.” So do not argue about them except with sure knowledge, nor consult any of those ˹who debate˺ about them.

With Him ˹alone˺ is ˹the knowledge of˺ the unseen of the heavens and the earth.
How perfectly He hears and sees!

18:26.qpc_hafs: مَا لَهُم مِّن دُونِهِۦ مِن وَلِيّٖ
18:26.en_khattab: They have no guardian besides Him,
and He shares His command with none.

18:27.en_khattab: Recite what has been revealed to you
from the Book of your Lord
nor can you find any refuge besides Him.

18:28.qpc_hafs: وَٱصۡبِرۡ نَفۡسَكَ مَعَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَدۡعُونَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلۡغَدَوٰةِ وَٱلۡعَشِيِّ يُرِيدُونَ وَجۡهَهُۥۖ
18:28.en_khattab: And patiently stick with those who call upon their Lord morning and evening, seeking His pleasure.

18:28.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تَعۡدُ عَيۡنَاكَ عَنۡهُمۡ تُرِيدُ زِينَةَ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَاۖ
18:28.en_khattab: Do not let your eyes look beyond them, desiring the luxuries of this worldly life.

18:28.qpc_hafs: وَلَا تُطِعۡ مَنۡ أَغۡفَلۡنَا قَلۡبَهُۥ عَن ذِكۡرِنَا وَٱتَّبَعَ هَوَىٰهُ وَكَانَ أَمۡرُهُۥ فُرُطٗا
18:28.en_khattab: And do not obey those whose hearts We have made heedless of Our remembrance, who follow ˹only˺ their desires and whose state is ˹total˺ loss.

18:29.en_khattab: And say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹This is˺ the truth from your Lord.

18:29.qpc_hafs: فَمَن شَآءَ فَلۡيُؤۡمِن وَمَن شَآءَ فَلۡيَكۡفُرۡۚ
18:29.en_khattab: Whoever wills let them believe, and whoever wills let them disbelieve.

18:29.qpc_hafs: إِنَّآ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ نَارًا أَحَاطَ بِهِمۡ سُرَادِقُهَاۚ
18:29.en_khattab: Surely We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose walls will ˹completely˺ surround them.

18:29.qpc_hafs: وَإِن يَسۡتَغِيثُواْ يُغَاثُواْ بِمَآءٖ كَٱلۡمُهۡلِ يَشۡوِي ٱلۡوُجُوهَۚ
18:29.en_khattab: When they cry for aid, they will be aided with water like molten metal, which will burn ˹their˺ faces.
What a horrible drink! And what a terrible place to rest!

18:30.en_khattab: As for those who believe and do good

18:30.qpc_hafs: إِنَّا لَا نُضِيعُ أَجۡرَ مَنۡ أَحۡسَنَ عَمَلًا
18:30.en_khattab: We certainly never deny the reward of those who are best in deeds

18:31.en_khattab: It is they who will have the Gardens of Eternity,
with rivers flowing under their feet.

18:31.qpc_hafs: يُحَلَّوۡنَ فِيهَا مِنۡ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٖ
18:31.en_khattab: There they will be adorned with bracelets of gold,

18:31.qpc_hafs: وَيَلۡبَسُونَ ثِيَابًا خُضۡرٗا مِّن سُندُسٖ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٖ
18:31.en_khattab: and wear green garments of fine silk and rich brocade,
And what a fabulous place to rest!

18:32.en_khattab: To ˹the disbelieving˺ one We gave two gardens of grapevines,
which We surrounded with palm trees

18:33.en_khattab: And We caused a river to flow between them.

18:34.en_khattab: And he had other resources ˹as well˺.
So he boasted to a ˹poor˺ companion of his

18:34.qpc_hafs: أَنَا۠ أَكۡثَرُ مِنكَ مَالٗا وَأَعَزُّ نَفَرٗا
18:34.en_khattab: “I am greater than you in wealth and superior in manpower.”

18:35.qpc_hafs: مَآ أَظُنُّ أَن تَبِيدَ هَٰذِهِۦٓ أَبَدٗا
18:35.en_khattab: I do not think this will ever perish,

18:36.en_khattab: nor do I think the Hour will ˹ever˺ come.
And if in fact I am returned to my Lord,
I will definitely get a far better outcome than ˹all˺ this.

18:37.en_khattab: Do you disbelieve in the One Who created you from dust
then formed you into a man?

18:38.en_khattab: But as for me: He is Allah, my Lord
and I will never associate anyone with my Lord ˹in worship˺.

18:39.en_khattab: If only you had said, upon entering your property,

18:39.qpc_hafs: قُلۡتَ مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ لَا قُوَّةَ إِلَّا بِٱللَّهِۚ
18:39.en_khattab: ‘This is what Allah has willed! There is no power except with Allah!’

18:39.qpc_hafs: إِن تَرَنِ أَنَا۠ أَقَلَّ مِنكَ مَالٗا وَوَلَدٗا
18:39.en_khattab: Even though you see me inferior to you in wealth and offspring,

18:40.en_khattab: will grant me ˹something˺ better than your garden
and send down upon your garden a thunderbolt from the sky
turning it into a barren waste

18:41.en_khattab: Or its water may sink ˹into the earth˺,
and then you will never be able to seek it out.”

18:42.qpc_hafs: فَأَصۡبَحَ يُقَلِّبُ كَفَّيۡهِ عَلَىٰ مَآ أَنفَقَ فِيهَا وَهِيَ خَاوِيَةٌ عَلَىٰ عُرُوشِهَا
18:42.en_khattab: was ˹totally˺ ruined, so he started to wring his hands for all he had spent on it, while it had collapsed on its trellises

18:42.qpc_hafs: وَيَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي لَمۡ أُشۡرِكۡ بِرَبِّيٓ أَحَدٗا
18:42.en_khattab: He cried, “Alas! I wish I had never associated anyone with my Lord ˹in worship˺!”

18:43.en_khattab: And he had no manpower to help him against Allah,

18:44.en_khattab: At this time, support comes ˹only˺ from Allah— the True ˹Lord˺.
He is best in reward and best in outcome.

18:45.en_khattab: And give them a parable of this worldly life.
˹It is˺ like the rain We send down from the sky, ˹It
˹It is˺ like the plants of the earth,
then they ˹soon˺ turn into chaff scattered by the wind.

18:45.qpc_hafs: وَكَانَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ مُّقۡتَدِرًا
18:45.en_khattab: And Allah is fully capable of ˹doing˺ all things.

18:46.en_khattab: are the adornment of this worldly life
are far better with your Lord in reward

18:47.en_khattab: ˹Beware of˺ the Day We will blow the mountains away
and you will see the earth laid bare
And We will gather all ˹humankind˺, leaving none behind

18:48.en_khattab: They will be presented before your Lord in rows, ˹and

18:48.qpc_hafs: لَّقَدۡ جِئۡتُمُونَا كَمَا خَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةِۭۚ
18:48.en_khattab: deniers will be told,˺ “You have surely returned to Us ˹all alone˺ as We created you the first time,

18:48.qpc_hafs: بَلۡ زَعَمۡتُمۡ أَلَّن نَّجۡعَلَ لَكُم مَّوۡعِدٗا
18:48.en_khattab: although you ˹always˺ claimed that We would never appoint a time for your return.”

18:49.en_khattab: And the record ˹of deeds˺ will be laid ˹open˺
and you will see the wicked in fear of what is ˹written˺ in it
They will cry, “Woe to us! What kind of record is this

18:49.qpc_hafs: لَا يُغَادِرُ صَغِيرَةٗ وَلَا كَبِيرَةً إِلَّآ أَحۡصَىٰهَاۚ
18:49.en_khattab: that does not leave any sin, small or large, unlisted
They will find whatever they did present ˹before them˺
And your Lord will never wrong anyone

18:50.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,”

18:50.qpc_hafs: فَسَجَدُوٓاْ إِلَّآ إِبۡلِيسَ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ
18:50.en_khattab: so they all did— but not Iblîs, who was one of the jinn,
but he rebelled against the command of his Lord.
Would you then take him and his descendants as patrons instead of Me,

18:50.qpc_hafs: وَهُمۡ لَكُمۡ عَدُوُّۢۚ بِئۡسَ لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ بَدَلٗا
18:50.en_khattab: although they are your enemy? What an evil alternative for the wrongdoers ˹to choose˺!

18:51.en_khattab: I never called them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth
nor would I take the misleaders as helpers

18:52.qpc_hafs: وَيَوۡمَ يَقُولُ نَادُواْ شُرَكَآءِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ زَعَمۡتُمۡ
18:52.en_khattab: And ˹beware of˺ the Day He will say, “Call upon those you claimed
were My associate-gods.” So they will call them, but will receive no response.
And We will make them ˹all˺ share in the same doom.

18:53.en_khattab: The wicked will see the Fire
and realize that they are bound to fall into it
and will find no way to avoid it

18:54.en_khattab: but humankind is the most argumentative of all beings.

18:55.en_khattab: and from seeking their Lord’s forgiveness
except  their demand to meet the same fate of earlier deniers
or that the torment would confront them face to face

18:56.en_khattab: We do not send the messengers
except as deliverers of good news and warners.
But the disbelievers argue in falsehood,
˹hoping˺ to discredit the truth with it,
and make a mockery of My revelations and warnings.

18:57.qpc_hafs: وَمَنۡ أَظۡلَمُ مِمَّن ذُكِّرَ بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّهِۦ
18:57.en_khattab: And who does more wrong than those who, when reminded of their Lord’s revelations

18:57.qpc_hafs: فَأَعۡرَضَ عَنۡهَا وَنَسِيَ مَا قَدَّمَتۡ يَدَاهُۚ
18:57.en_khattab: turn away from them and forget what their own hands have done?
We have certainly cast veils over their hearts
—leaving them unable to comprehend this ˹Quran˺—and deafness in their ears.

18:57.qpc_hafs: وَإِن تَدۡعُهُمۡ إِلَى ٱلۡهُدَىٰ فَلَن يَهۡتَدُوٓاْ إِذًا أَبَدٗا
18:57.en_khattab: And if you ˹O Prophet˺ invite them to ˹true˺ guidance, they will never be ˹rightly˺ guided.

18:58.en_khattab: Your Lord is the All-Forgiving, Full of Mercy.

18:58.qpc_hafs: لَوۡ يُؤَاخِذُهُم بِمَا كَسَبُواْ لَعَجَّلَ لَهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابَۚ
18:58.en_khattab: If He were to seize them ˹immediately˺ for what they commit, He would have certainly hastened their punishment.

18:58.qpc_hafs: بَل لَّهُم مَّوۡعِدٞ لَّن يَجِدُواْ مِن دُونِهِۦ مَوۡئِلٗا
18:58.en_khattab: But they have an appointed time, from which they will find no refuge.

18:59.en_khattab: We destroyed when they persisted in wrong
and We had set a time for their destruction

18:60.en_khattab: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his young assistant,

18:60.qpc_hafs: لَآ أَبۡرَحُ حَتَّىٰٓ أَبۡلُغَ مَجۡمَعَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَيۡنِ أَوۡ أَمۡضِيَ حُقُبٗا
18:60.en_khattab: “I will never give up until I reach the junction of the two seas, even if I travel for ages.”

18:61.en_khattab: But when they ˹finally˺ reached the point where
the seas met, they forgot their ˹salted˺ fish,
and it made its way into the sea, slipping away ˹wondrously˺.

18:62.qpc_hafs: لَقَدۡ لَقِينَا مِن سَفَرِنَا هَٰذَا نَصَبٗا
18:62.en_khattab: We have certainly been exhausted by today’s journey.

18:63.qpc_hafs: قَالَ أَرَءَيۡتَ إِذۡ أَوَيۡنَآ إِلَى ٱلصَّخۡرَةِ
18:63.en_khattab: He replied, “Do you remember when we rested by the rock?

18:63.qpc_hafs: فَإِنِّي نَسِيتُ ٱلۡحُوتَ وَمَآ أَنسَىٰنِيهُ إِلَّا ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ
18:63.en_khattab: That is when I forgot the fish. None made me forget to mention this except Satan.

18:63.qpc_hafs: أَنۡ أَذۡكُرَهُۥۚ وَٱتَّخَذَ سَبِيلَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡبَحۡرِ عَجَبٗا
18:63.en_khattab: And the fish made its way into the sea miraculously.

18:64.en_khattab: Moses responded, “That is ˹exactly˺ what we were looking for.”
So they returned, retracing their footsteps.

18:65.en_khattab: There they found a servant of Ours,
to whom We had granted mercy from Us
and enlightened with knowledge of Our Own.

18:66.en_khattab: provided that you teach me some of the right guidance you have been taught?”

18:68.en_khattab: And how can you be patient

18:68.qpc_hafs: عَلَىٰ مَا لَمۡ تُحِطۡ بِهِۦ خُبۡرٗا
18:68.en_khattab: with what is beyond your ˹realm of˺ knowledge?

18:69.en_khattab: You will find me patient, Allah willing,
and I will not disobey any of your orders.

18:70.en_khattab: do not question me about anything
until I ˹myself˺ clarify it for you.

18:71.en_khattab: but after they had boarded a ship,
the man made a hole in it.
Moses protested, “Have you done this to drown its people?
You have certainly done a terrible thing!”

18:73.en_khattab: and do not be hard on me.

18:74.qpc_hafs: قَالَ أَقَتَلۡتَ نَفۡسٗا زَكِيَّةَۢ بِغَيۡرِ نَفۡسٖ
18:74.en_khattab: Moses protested, “Have you killed an innocent soul, who killed no one?
You have certainly done a horrible thing.”

18:75.en_khattab: that you cannot have patience with me?

18:76.qpc_hafs: قَالَ إِن سَأَلۡتُكَ عَن شَيۡءِۭ بَعۡدَهَا
18:76.en_khattab: Moses replied, “If I ever question you about anything after this
then do not keep me in your company
for by then I would have given you enough of an excuse.

18:77.en_khattab: until they came to the people of a town
but the people refused to give them hospitality

18:77.qpc_hafs: فَوَجَدَا فِيهَا جِدَارٗا يُرِيدُ أَن يَنقَضَّ
18:77.en_khattab: There they found a wall ready to collapse
so the man set it right
“If you wanted, you could have demanded a fee for this.”

18:78.en_khattab: He replied, 'This is the parting of our ways.'
what you could not bear patiently.

18:79.en_khattab: it belonged to some poor people, working at sea.
So I intended to damage it,

18:79.qpc_hafs: وَكَانَ وَرَآءَهُم مَّلِكٞ يَأۡخُذُ كُلَّ سَفِينَةٍ غَصۡبٗا
18:79.en_khattab: for there was a ˹tyrant˺ king ahead of them who seizes every ˹good˺ ship by force.

18:80.en_khattab: and we feared that he would pressure them into defiance and disbelief.

18:81.en_khattab: that their Lord would give them another, more virtuous

18:82.en_khattab: it belonged to two orphan boys in the city,
and under the wall was a treasure that belonged to them,
and their father had been a righteous man.
So your Lord willed that these children should come of age
as a mercy from your Lord.
I did not do it ˹all˺ on my own.

18:82.qpc_hafs: ذَٰلِكَ تَأۡوِيلُ مَا لَمۡ تَسۡطِع عَّلَيۡهِ صَبۡرٗا
18:82.en_khattab: This is the explanation of what you could not bear patiently.

18:83.en_khattab: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about Ⱬul-Qarnain.
Say, “I will relate to you something of his narrative.”

18:84.en_khattab: We established him in the land,

18:86.en_khattab: until he reached the setting ˹point˺ of the sun
which appeared to him to be setting in a spring of murky water

18:86.qpc_hafs: قُلۡنَا يَٰذَا ٱلۡقَرۡنَيۡنِ إِمَّآ أَن تُعَذِّبَ وَإِمَّآ أَن تَتَّخِذَ فِيهِمۡ حُسۡنٗا
18:86.en_khattab: We said, “O Ⱬul-Qarnain! Either punish them or treat them kindly.

18:87.en_khattab: then will be returned to their Lord,
Who will punish them with a horrible torment.

18:88.en_khattab: As for those who believe and do good,
they will have the finest reward,
and we will assign them easy commands.”

18:90.en_khattab: until he reached the rising ˹point˺ of the sun.
He found it rising on a people

18:90.qpc_hafs: لَّمۡ نَجۡعَل لَّهُم مِّن دُونِهَا سِتۡرٗا
18:90.en_khattab: for whom We had provided no shelter from it.

18:91.en_khattab: And We truly had full knowledge of him.

18:93.en_khattab: until he reached ˹a pass˺ between two mountains.
He found in front of them a people

18:94.qpc_hafs: إِنَّ يَأۡجُوجَ وَمَأۡجُوجَ مُفۡسِدُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ
18:94.en_khattab: Surely Gog and Magog are spreading corruption throughout the land.

18:94.qpc_hafs: عَلَىٰٓ أَن تَجۡعَلَ بَيۡنَنَا وَبَيۡنَهُمۡ سَدّٗا
18:94.en_khattab: provided that you build a wall between us and them?

18:95.qpc_hafs: قَالَ مَا مَكَّنِّي فِيهِ رَبِّي خَيۡرٞ
18:95.en_khattab: He responded, “What my Lord has provided for me is far better.
and I will build a barrier between you and them.

18:96.qpc_hafs: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا سَاوَىٰ بَيۡنَ ٱلصَّدَفَيۡنِ قَالَ ٱنفُخُواْۖ
18:96.en_khattab: Then, when he had filled up ˹the gap˺ between the two mountains, he ordered, “Blow!”

18:96.qpc_hafs: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَعَلَهُۥ نَارٗا قَالَ ءَاتُونِيٓ
18:96.en_khattab: When the iron became red hot, he said, “Bring me
molten copper to pour over it.

18:97.en_khattab: And so the enemies could neither scale

18:98.qpc_hafs: فَإِذَا جَآءَ وَعۡدُ رَبِّي جَعَلَهُۥ دَكَّآءَۖ
18:98.en_khattab: But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will level it to the ground.

18:99.en_khattab: On that Day, We will let them
Later, the Trumpet will be blown,
and We will gather all ˹people˺ together.

18:100.en_khattab: On that Day We will display Hell

18:101.en_khattab: those whose eyes were within a cover
and they were not able to hear

18:102.qpc_hafs: أَن يَتَّخِذُواْ عِبَادِي مِن دُونِيٓ أَوۡلِيَآءَۚ
18:102.en_khattab: they can ˹simply˺ take My servants as lords instead of Me?
We have surely prepared Hell as an accommodation for the disbelievers.

18:103.en_khattab: Shall we inform you of who will lose the most deeds?

18:104.qpc_hafs: ٱلَّذِينَ ضَلَّ سَعۡيُهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَا
18:104.en_khattab: ˹They are˺ those whose efforts are in vain in this worldly life

18:105.qpc_hafs: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ وَلِقَآئِهِۦ
18:105.en_khattab: It is they who reject the signs of their Lord and their meeting with Him

18:105.qpc_hafs: فَلَا نُقِيمُ لَهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ وَزۡنٗا
18:105.en_khattab: so We will not give their deeds any weight on Judgment Day

18:106.qpc_hafs: بِمَا كَفَرُواْ وَٱتَّخَذُوٓاْ ءَايَٰتِي وَرُسُلِي هُزُوًا
18:106.en_khattab: for their disbelief and mockery of My signs and messengers.
